exam_name: CLAT - Common Law Admission Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Consortium of National Law Universities (NLUs) has released the CLAT 2025 application form on July 15, 2024. Eligible candidates can register and fill out the application form of CLAT exam online from its official website, consortiumofnlus.ac.in. The CLAT exam date 2025 is Rs. 4,000 for general candidates and Rs. 3,500 for SC/ST candidates. The last date to submit the CLAT application form 2025 is October 15. The consortium has also released the first CLAT 2025 sample paper on September 13, 2024. Candidates who have completed CLAT 2025 registration can download the sample paper through their CLAT login. The offline-based CLAT 2025 will have 120 objective-type questions to be asked from topics mentioned in the exam syllabus. CLAT 2025 syllabus broadly covers the English language, general knowledge and current affairs, legal, logical and maths subjects.
Also Check | How many candidates appear in CLAT, success rate

What is CLAT Exam?

The Common Law Admission Test, also known as CLAT is a national-level law entrance exam conducted by the Consortium of National Law Universities (CNLUs). The CLAT scores are accepted for admission to undergraduate and postgraduate law programs offered by 24 national law universities and over 60 affiliated colleges. CLAT is conducted across the country, in offline, pen and paper format.

What's New In CLAT 2025?

A change introduced in CLAT 2025 is that candidates are not required to fill in their NLU preferences at the time of CLAT 2025 registration. Instead, candidates must submit their NLU preferences at the time of counselling after the CLAT 2025 results have been declared. This change provides the candidates with the opportunity to target specific NLUs as per their CLAT 2025 score.

Revised CLAT 2025 Syllabus

The Consortium of NLUs has reduced the number of questions in the CLAT entrance exam to make it more student-friendly. The total number of questions in the CLAT exam was reduced to 120, which was earlier 150. The section-wise distribution of questions is given below.

CLAT 2025 Syllabus and Pattern

SectionsApproximate number of questionsWeight
English Language22-26 20%
Current Affairs, including General Knowledge28-32 25%
Legal Reasoning28-32 25%
Logical Reasoning22-26 20%
Quantitative Techniques10-14 10%

Good Score in CLAT 2025

As per the CLAT cut-off trends available for last year, a good score in CLAT 2025 is expected to be 100+ marks for general category candidates for admission into top NLUs such as NLSIU Bengaluru and NALSAR Hyderabad. The good score in CLAT varies across category. A good CLAT score for EWS and OBC candidates is expected to be 90+ marks and 80+ marks respectively. For SC/ST category, a good score in CLAT 2025 is expected to be around 75+ marks.

CLAT 2025 exam events

CLAT 2025 - Events
Details
CLAT 2025 official notification The consortium has released the CLAT 2025 admission notification. The official notification informs candidates about registration window and CLAT 2025 exam date.
CLAT application form 2025Registration for CLAT 2025 will open on July 15, 2024
CLAT 2025 admit card The CLAT admit card 2025 will be issued in the third week of November 2024.
CLAT 2025 exam dateThe offline-based CLAT 2025 will be conducted on December 01, 2024. CLAT question paper will have multiple-choice questions on subjects like general knowledge, current affairs, legal and logical reasoning and quantitative ability.
The PG-CLAT will have questions on common subjects of the LLB programme.
CLAT answer key 2025After the conduct of the examination, the consortium will release the CLAT 2025 answer key. Candidates will be given an opportunity to raise objections online.  
CLAT 2025 resultThe consortium will release the CLAT result 2025 tentatively a week after the exam. The result will be declared as per the CLAT 2025 final answer key.
CLAT 2025 counsellingAll candidates who have a valid score in CLAT 2025 will be able to register for CLAT 2025 counselling. There will be five rounds of counselling. The CLAT 2025 seat allotment will be done as per the candidate's rank and preferences.

CLAT Colleges 2025 and Seat Intake

The CLAT colleges include both national law universities and over 60 law schools that will sign the memorandum with the Consortium of National Law Universities (NLUs). At present, there are 24 NLUs and an off campus of GNLU Gandhinagar, and GNLU Silvassa that accept CLAT scores. Only NLU Delhi and NLU Meghalaya are not participating in the CLAT exam. NLU Prayagraj was a new NLU that was added in the list of CLAT colleges last year. CLAT 2025 Exam Analysis

The Common Law Admission Test is considered one of the most difficult law entrance exams in the country. With CLAT exam analysis, candidates can decode the exam and estimate the level of preparation needed for CLAT 2025. The CLAT 2025 exam analysis will include important topics covered in the exam, good attempt, expected good score in CLAT and the cut off for top NLUs. As per the CLAT 2024 exam analysis available for last year, the CLAT exam was easy due to the reduced number of questions. 

History of CLAT

The inception of CLAT as the common test has its roots in the 2007 case, Varun Bhagat v. Union of India when a parent of law aspirant argued for a centralized test. Following this, the first Common Law Admission Test (CLAT) was organised in 2008 for seven national law universities. 

In 2014, seven other national law universities joined CLAT. The exam was conducted online this time. However, a permanent secretariat for the CLAT consortium was still elusive. In 2015 - A PIL was filed by Professor Shamnad Bashir seeking an institutionalized system with a permanent secretariat for the conduct of CLAT. The case eventually led to the setting up of the CLAT Consortium in Bengaluru in 2018. The mode of the CLAT exam was also changed from online to offline. 

Earlier, the CLAT was being conducted by national law universities on a rotation basis. Now, with a permanent secretariat, CLAT is conducted by a seven-member executive committee consisting of a convenor, president, vice-president, secretary-treasurer and other members.

As of 2025, CLAT scores are accepted by 24 out of 26 national law universities. NLU Delhi and the recently established NLU Meghalaya are conducting separate entrance exams. NLU Delhi conducts the All India Law Entrance Test (AILET), whereas NLU Meg organises MEG-UAT and MEG-PAT for admissions to UG and PG programs.Consortium of NLUs

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates appearing in the CLAT exam 2025 must meet the eligibility criteria prescribed by the Consortium of National Law Universities (NLUs). Since the Common Law Admission Test (CLAT) is conducted for both UG and PG programmes, the eligibility criteria are also different for each level. The details of CLAT UG and CLAT LLM eligibility criteria are given below.

CLAT2025 eligibility criteria - Highlights

ParticularUG-CLATPG-CLAT
Educational qualificationClass 12th or equivalentLLB graduation
Minimum marks requiredGeneral candidates - 45%
SC/ST - 40%		General candidates - 50%
SC/ST - 45%

UG CLAT 2025 eligibility criteria - Details

Candidates have to meet the following conditions;

  • Candidates should have passed Class 12 with at least 45% marks (40% for SC and ST students) from a recognized board or institution. 
  • Candidates who will appear in Class 12th board exams in April-May 2025 are also eligible to appear in the exam. However, the admission of such students will be subject to fulfilling the required eligibility criteria.
  • Candidates who have completed a diploma or any other programme equivalent to Class 12th can also apply for CLAT exam 2025.

CLAT LLM eligibility criteria 2025

The eligibility criteria for LLM-CLAT are given below;

  • Candidates should have passed graduation in Law (3-year LLB or 5-year LLB) from a recognized university. 
  • They must have obtained at least 50% marks (45% in the case of SC and ST candidates) in the qualifying examination. Further, candidates appearing in the final year of the LLB degree programme are also eligible. 

CLAT 2025 age limit

There is no age limit for appearing in CLAT 2025. Further, there are no restrictions on the number of attempts.

application_process.html_content:
The Consortium of NLUs has opened the CLAT 2025 application form on July 15, 2024. Eligible candidates who wish to appear in CLAT 2025 can register online and fill out the CLAT application form 2025, by visiting the CLAT official website - consortiumofnlus.ac.in. The deadline to submit the CLAT 2025 application form is October 15, 2024. The CLAT PG 2025 application form will also open at the same time. This year, candidates are not required to fill in the CLAT NLU preferences at the time of registration. Candidates will be required to submit the preferences after the result.

How to fill CLAT Application Form 2025?

Candidates had to follow the steps mentioned below to fill out the application form of CLAT 2025.

  • Registration: To register, enter your name, email id, mobile number, and other details. 
  • Fill in relevant details: Here enter personal, academic, and contact details and reservation details. Candidats are also required to select the program of study (UG or PG), 
  • Upload documents: Scanned copies of the signature, photograph, and other documents in the prescribed specification (refer to the table below) have to be uploaded.

Document Required for CLAT 2025 application form

  • Application fee: Depending on the category of the candidate, the application fee may vary as shown in the table below.

CLAT 2025 registration fee

CategoryFee

General/ OBC/PwD/NRI/PIO//OCI category

Rs. 4,000

SC/ST/BPL category

Rs. 3,500

CLAT Application Form 2025: Important points to remember

  • During the document verification process of CLAT counselling 2025, all details entered in the form will be verified. Exam officials will demand originals of all essential documents to be produced before them. In case of any inconsistency in the information shared in the application form, the candidate may be disqualified.
  • Candidates must carefully all the information in the CLAT 2025 application form. Certain information such as programme and category cannot be changed or edited after submission of the application form.
  • Also, simply meeting the eligibility criteria is no guarantee for admission, as the final CLAT seat allotment will be based on the merit rank of the candidate in the online exam. 
  • Candidates can gain CLAT seat allotment in only those NLUs which are part of their NLU preferences at the time of registration.

You may also check- 

  • CLAT Registration 2025 Last Date
  • CLAT 2025 Registration Fees

preparation_tips.html_content:
Sometimes the candidate may need a little assistance in their CLAT exam preparation to get over the line. Like the candidate may want to know about some tools that can assist them to improve accuracy or improve speed. 

CLAT 2025 Preparation Tips 

  • Candidates need to be well-versed with the exam pattern and syllabus.
  • Practice sufficient mock tests and sample papers to edify learning and to hone problem-solving skills.
  • CLAT aspirants are also advised to follow a proper timetable for preparation.
  • Candidates should choose books that are easy to follow, meet quality standards, and contain lots of practise material to prepare for the exam.
  • Regular revision is the key to scoring good marks in exams.
  • Maintaining equanimity is crucial for effective preparation. To achieve that stay in the moment, instead of flying into the future or pondering the past. 

CLAT 2025 last-week and exam-day tips

  • Solve sample papers: The last most should involve extensive solving of CLAT sample papers 2025. While in the preliminary phases of the CLAT exam preparation one may solve one sample paper a week, the number in the last month and weeks can be increased. One may solve as many sample papers as possible.
  • Mock test: The idea of CLAT mock tests 2025 is to get an exam-like experience, which may include a pressure-cooker situation. Considering the exam will be now conducted in online mode, mock tests will help the candidate to understand navigation, how questions are presented, how questions can be answered, and manage time. Note that there will be 150 multiple choice questions that have to be answered in 120 minutes. This means speed and accuracy will be important qualities for success in the exam.
  • Don't study new topics close to the exam: Unless you are thoroughly done with what you have already taken up, better don't get entangled in new topics, because it will eat into your last phase of exam preparation. Remember the last phase is all about acceleration, which includes doing fast revision, solving sample papers, and taking mock tests. But if you bring in new topics, you will break the flow; also note that new topics will take more time to master, which you can ill afford at this stage.  
  • How to answer the CLAT question paper 2025: The questions asked in the CLAT exam 2025 can be placed in three groups: easy, moderate, and difficult. It is recommended that the candidate starts with easy questions, before answering moderate and difficult questions. Also, if one gets stuck with a difficult question, better not spend too much time on it, but instead move on to the next question.
  • Stay composed even in difficult situations during exams: Sometimes the question paper may turn out to be more difficult than expected, or you may not be able to answer an easy-looking question. In those situations, it is important to keep one's cool and not get rattled. Take a deep breath and move on to the next question.
    Also read | Last minute preparation tips to ace CLAT 2025 exam

CLAT 2025 best books for exam preparation 

When preparing for CLAT exam 2025, it is important to have dependable and high-quality study material. The CLAT best books 2025 will be those that are easy to understand, and contain few to no errors, including problem sets and instructions.

admit_card.html_content:
The Consortium of NLUs will issue the CLAT 2025 admit card tentatively in the third week of November 2024. CLAT admit card is a mandatory document for appearing in the examination. 

Further, the admit card mentions various details such as candidate roll number, application number, exam centre name, address, CLAT exam reporting time and instructions. One must download and take a printout of the admit card to the designated CLAT exam centre on the exam day. 

How to download CLAT admit card 2025?

Candidates can follow the steps mentioned below to download their admit card of CLAT 2025.

  • Visit the CLAT official website of the CLAT consortium 
  • A login window will open
  • Enter your registration or application number and password
  • Enter your NLUs preferences (minimum five), and click on update NLUs preferences
  • The CLAT admit card will be displayed on screen in downloadable pdf format
  • Download the admit card and take a printout

CLAT admit card login window

CLAT 2025 Exam Guidelines 

As per the CLAT 2025 exam guidelines, the candidate has to report to the CLAT 2025 exam centre at least one hour before the commencement of the exam. Also, after 15 minutes after the commencement of the CLAT exam, no candidate will be allowed fresh entry.

To take the test, the candidate has to display a printout of the admit card and a valid and original photo ID proof. 

No baggage counter

There will be no baggage counter at the exam venue and candidates will be solely responsible for the safe keep of their belongings. So, it is advisable not to carry non-essential items to the centre.

If the candidate wants, they may visit the exam centre to check out the location, travel route, distance and traffic situation. However, no candidate will be allowed beyond the main entrance gate, except on exam day and that too is only on producing the admit card and photo ID.  

Important items to carry to the CLAT exam hall

  • Blue/Black Ball Pen

  • Admit Card

  • Any original photo ID proof issued by the Government.

  • Transparent water bottle.

  • Own mask, gloves and personal hand sanitiser.

  • Self-health declaration

  • Disability certificate for PWD candidates

CLAT exam day 2025 - Things to avoid 

  • Electronic/communication devices such as mobile phones

  • Any kind of watch, calculator, headphones, etc.

  • Sheets of paper including blank sheets are not allowed inside the examination hall.  

Candidates may also note that the consortium or the security staff at the exam centre will not be held responsible for the loss and damage of any property/gadgets of candidates.

What is a good score in CLAT 2025?

To decide what is a good score you have to first identify the NLU you want to get admission into. And the last rank (or cutoff rank) for which admission is offered in that institute can be considered to be a good score. That said the cutoff fluctuates depending on a host of parameters like seat intake, the performance of candidates in CLAT 2025 total applicants, and the CLAT merit rank of these applicants. So, you will be in the safe zone only if you score a little higher than the past year's cutoff rank.

counselling_process.html_content:
The CLAT 2025 counselling will be conducted in online mode. The Consortium of National Law Universities (NLUs) will release the CLAT merit list 2025 on the basis of scores of candidates. Candidates included in the merit list of CLAT 2025 will be eligible for admission to the allotted National Law Universities. Candidates are required to fill their NLU preferences at the time of counselling. They will be able to gain admission in only those NLUs which are part of their preferences. 

The counselling of CLAT 2025 will be conducted in five rounds, in online mode. After each round, the consortium will release the seat allotment for all national law universities participating in the common admission process. Around 15, 000 candidates in CLAT UG and 3,000 candidates are expected to be invited for CLAT counselling 2025.

CLAT counselling fee 2025

The counselling fee of CLAT 2025 is Rs. 30,000. For SC and ST candidates, the counselling fee is Rs 20,000. Candidates can pay the counselling fee online while registering for the counselling. The counselling fee will be adjusted with the NLU course fee. 

CLAT Seat Allotment 2025

The CLAT seat allotment is made on the basis of the merit rank of the candidate and NLU preference selected. The seat allotment of CLAT 2025 will be announced for each law school, in five rounds. After each round of seat allotment, candidates will have the following options;

  • Accept the seat allotment and complete the admission process
  • Apply for upgrade and submit NLU fee
  • Exit the admission process

Post Round 5 seat allotment, the candidate has two options before him:

  • Accept the allotted seat
  • Exit the admission process.

To accept a seat, the candidate will have to pay the NLU fees and complete admission formalities. However, if the candidate is unhappy with the allotted seat, they may exit the admission process without paying the admission fee.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Candidates preparing for CLAT exam should be well-versed with the exam pattern and syllabus. The CLAT exam pattern informs the candidates about the test structure, number of questions and their types, marking scheme and several other test modalities. 

As per the CLAT 2025 exam pattern, It is an offline-based exam, with OMR sheets and question papers. CLAT 2025 question paper comprises 120 multiple-choice type questions in CLAT UG and 120 questions in CLAT LLM. All questions are based on comprehension passages. The details of the exam pattern are mentioned below.

CLAT Exam Pattern 2025

ParticularsDetails
LanguageEnglish
Type of questionsObjective type test 
Total number of questionsCLAT UG - 120 MCQs 
CLAT PG - 120 MCQs
Maximum marksCLAT UG - 120
CLAT PG - 120
Exam duration2 hours
Marking scheme1 mark for each correct answer
Negative marking0.25 marks will be deducted for each incorrect answer

exam_name: NMIMS-LAT - NMIMS Law Aptitude Test
conducting_body: Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies (NMIMS), a deemed to be university, is conducting the NMIMS Law Aptitude Test 2024 (NMIMS-LAT 2024) in two phases. The exam is being conducted in multiple slots in online mode for law admissions into its seven campuses in India. The NMIMS-LAT 2024 application for the second phase was closed on May 20, 2024. 

The NMIMS LAT phase 2 registrations began on March 11, 2024. The NMIMS LAT phase 2 exam will be conducted from March 16, 2024, to May 25, 2024. The NMIMS LAT merit list 2024 will be released on June 13, 2024. Aspirants must fill the application for the NMIMS law exam online and schedule their exam at their preferred available slot. The list of programmes offered by NMIMS KPMSOL through NMIMS-LAT include BA LLB (Hons.), BBA LLB (Hons.), and one-year LLM.

What is NMIMS LAT?

NMIMS-LAT is the NMIMS entrance exam for law. Through this test,the institute admits students into the 5-year integrated BA LLB (Hons) and BBA LLB (Hons) programmes, at its various campuses of the NIMIMS School of Law located at Mumbai, Navi Mumbai, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Indore, Chandigarh and Dhule. It must be noted that the BA LLB programme is not available at the Dhule campus. 

The institute will also admit students into LLM programme through the NLAT 2024. The one year LLM is available only at the Mumbai campus.

NMIMS-LAT 2024 will be conducted in online mode in multiple slots at designated test centres across India. Before applying, candidates must make sure they fulfil the NMIMS LAT eligibility criteria. The NMIMS law entrance exam 2024 will test the candidates’ ability in five areas namely verbal reasoning, general knowledge, quantitative reasoning, logical reasoning and legal reasoning. There will be a total of 150 multiple choice questions. 

NMIMS Admission Through CLAT 2024

Law aspirants must also note that, other than the NMIMS law entrance exam, NMIMS also conducts law admissions through CLAT 2024. Therefore, aspiring candidates who appeared for CLAT 2024 can also apply for admission into NMIMS. The Consortim of NLUs conducted CLAT 2024 for admission into UG and PG law programmes of participating NLUs on December 3, 2023.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Only those candidates who fulfil the eligibility criteria of NMIMS LAT 2024 will be eligible to appear for the Narsee Monjee Law entrance test and get admission into different programmes at various campuses. NMIMS prescribes the following NMIMS-LAT 2024 eligibility criteria:

NMIMS-LAT Eligibility Criteria 2024

ParticularsDetails
Educational Qualification10+2 in any stream
Minimum passing marks50%

It must be noted that candidates appearing for their class 12 exams are also eligible to apply. However, such candidates must submit their qualifying certificates at the time of admission.

NIMIS School of Law also accepts CLAT 2024 scores. If candidates appeared for the CLAT exam, they need not appear for NLAT 2024.

application_process.html_content:
NMIMS has opened the application form of NMIMS LAT 2024 in online mode. Candidates are required to visit the official website and complete registration and then pay the required fees. The last date to submit the application form was May 20, 2024. Candidates have to select the programme and campus preferences. 

As the NMIMS law entrance exam takes place in multiple slots, candidates can also apply for multiple attempts. Each candidate is allowed to take the exam a maximum of three times - one attempt and two retakes. The best score among the three attempts is considered for admissions. The registration fees depends on the number of attempts the candidate has chosen

How to Fill NMIMS LAT Application Form 2024

Given below are steps to fill the NMIMS LAT 2024 application form

  • Visit the official website - nmimslat.in

  • Click on the apply now link to register and create an account 

  • Login using registration ID and password

  • Select desired test category, school, program name and campus preferences

  • Candidates can select multiple attempts. They are allowed one main attempt and two retakes for the exam.

  • Submit the application fee and complete the NMIMS LAT 2024 application process.

admit_card.html_content:
NMIMS LAT 2024 admit card will be generated after the candidate has completed slot booking and exam scheduling. Candidates can access the admit card through their dashboard. Given below are the steps to download the admit card of NMIMS law entrance exam.

  • Visit the official website - nmimslat.in

  • Login to access the candidate’s dashboard

  • Click on the admit card link

  • NMIMS LAT 2024 admit card will appear on the screen

  • Download and save for future reference

The NLAT admit card 2024 is a mandatory document to appear for NMIMS-LAT 2024. Along with the admit card, candidates also carry with them a photo id proof on the day of the exam.

exam_name: PU BA LLB Entrance - Panjab University BA LLB Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
UILS Chandigarh, PURC Ludhiana and PUSSGRC Hoshiarpur have commenced the physical counselling process. Candidates whose name has been mentioned in the merit list can visit the colleges from July 10 to 12 as per the schedule for document verification and admission. Panjab University (PU) published the PU BA LLB 2024 merit list on July 2, 2024. The university will start the PU BA LLB counselling 2024 on July 10, 2024. Earlier, the university published the PU BA LLB 2024 tentative merit list on June 26, 2024 and invited objections. The university released the PU BA LLB admission form 2024 on May 24, 2024 on its official website - uglaw.puchd.ac.in. The last date to fill the PU BA LLB 2024 admission form was June 10, 2024. 

Earlier, Panjab University had declared the PU BA LLB result 2024 on May 15, 2024. Candidates can check the result of PU BA LLB 2024 from the official website - results.puexam.in by entering their roll number. The university had released the PU BA LLB answer key 2024 on May 3, 2024 in online mode on its official website. Candidates were allowed to submit objections and cross objections till May 5, 2024. Panjab University has declared the PU BA LLB result 2024 after considering all the objections. PU had conducted the PU BA LLB 2024 entrance exam on April 28, 2024 in offline mode.

Earlier, it released the PU BA LLB 2024 admit card in online mode on April 23, 2024. Candidates who filled their application form in due time were able to download their admit cards using their login id and password. The university had opened the PU BA LLB 2024 application form in online mode on March 13, 2024. Interested applicants could fill the PU BA LLB application form 2024 till Aprill 10, 2024. 

PU BA LLB 2024 exam is an offline based exam conducted for admission to BA LLB and B.Com LLB programme for a combined intake of 480 seats. The university will conduct seat allotment on the basis of PU BA LLB merit list prepared using PU BA LLB 2024 scores. As per the PU UG law eligibility criteria, candidates who have passed Class 12 with at least 50% marks (45% in the case of SC and ST candidates) are eligible to apply for admission. 

What is PU UG Law Entrance Test 2024?

The PU UG Law Entrance Test 2024 is the entrance exam conducted by Panjab University to admit candidates into the 5 year integrated BA LLB and B.Com LLB programmes. The entrance exam is administered in three languages - English, Hindi & Punjabi. The test consists of objective-type questions from Current affairs, Legal aptitude and Mental Ability and English. Admissions through PU BA LLB entrance test are offered on the basis of merit cum preference. The merit list is prepared category-wise, based on the marks scored by the candidates.

PU BA LLB entrance exam 2024: Test structure

Panjab University does not prescribe a specific syllabus of PU UG law 2024 entrance exam. However, candidates can check the broad sections from which questions come in the exam. The same is given below:

  1. General Knowledge & Current Affairs
  2. Aptitude for Law
  3. Mental Ability
  4. English Language

To know more check - PU BA LLB syllabus 2024

highlights.value: Panjab University BA LLB Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates seeking to pursue five-year integrated legal education at participating institutes of Panjab University have to appear in PU BA LLB entrance test. The eligibility criteria of PU BA LLB 2024 are conditions that the candidate has to meet to be considered for admission.  

PU BA LLB 2024 eligibility criteria

  • Qualifying exam: The applicant needs to have passed  10+2 examination or equivalent exam scoring minimum 50% marks. Relaxation of 5% in minimum marks applies for candidates belonging to reserved categories. 
  • Open University candidates: who have passed 10+2 directly without having any basic qualification are not eligible
  • Age limit: There is no upper age limit for appearing in the exam.

application_process.html_content:
Panjab University has closed the application process of PU BA LLB 2024 on April 10, 2024. Earlier, the university released the PU BA LLB application 2024 on March 13, 2024 in online mode at uglaw.puchd.ac.in. When filling the form, one had to be careful to fill out only accurate information. Any discrepancy can lead to rejection of the application.

How to fill PU BA LLB application form 2024

  • Get registered using valid email id and mobile number 
  • Fill in academic, personal and academic details
  • Select an exam centre
  • Upload all relevant documents in the prescribed format
  • Pay the prescribed application fee 
  • Submit the application form

admit_card.html_content:
Panjab University  released the admit card for PU BA LLB entrance exam online on April 23, 2024. Candidates can download the admit card by logging into the UG admission portal of the university. PU BA LLB admit card 2024 is a mandatory document to be carried to the exam hall. In addition, it carries some vital information like the name and roll number of the candidate, date and time of the exam, venue details, and also exam day guidelines. 

How to download PU BA LLB 2024 admit card?

  • Visit the PU BA LLB admission portal
  • Click on the admit card link
  • Log in using the registration number and password
  • The PU BA LLB admit card will be displayed on the screen.
  • Download and take the printout for future reference.

PU UG Law exam day guidelines 2024

The admit card carries a series of guidelines for the candidates appearing in the entrance examination. Candidates should read all the exam day guidelines carefully before going to the exam centre. Some of the important exam day instructions are mentioned below.

  • Candidates should read the exam centre of PU BA LLB 2024 at least 30 minutes before the examination. 
  • Candidates going to appear in PU UG law entrance exam must carry a printed copy of admit card and an original photo ID card to their exam centre.
  • Candidates should also carry a blue/black ballpoint pen.
  • Candidates will not be allowed to carry any electronic items such as mobile phones, watch, earphones, calculator inside the exam hall.
  • No candidate will be allowed to leave the exam centre before the completion of the test. 
  • Candidates are further advised to keep the admit card safe for the remaining admission process.

cutoffs.html_content:
The Panjab University will release the cut off of PU BA LLB 2024 at the time of counselling. The PU BA LLB cut off 2024 will indicate the minimum marks required for admissions to Panjab University and its law centres. For each law centre, the PU BA LLB 2024 cut off will be released separately. Candidates coming under the cut off list will have to complete the admission process by appearing in counselling. 

The PU BA LLB 2024 cutoff will be affected by the following factors; 

  1. Number of vacant seats
  2. The number of qualifying candidates, 
  3. The difficulty level of the examination
  4. Preference for law centre given by the candidates.

counselling_process.html_content:
Panjab University will conduct the counselling of PU BA LLB 2024 in offline mode from July 10, After considering the objections against the tentative merit list, it has published the PU BA LLB provisional merit list 2024 on July 2, 2024.  The PU BA LLB admission form 2024 was closed on June 10, 2024. Later, the university also published the PU BA LLB 2024 tentative merit list on June 26, 2024. The counselling is conducted at all law centres of Panjab University separately. Candidates shortlisted through PU BA LLB merit list will have to appear in the counselling process in order to complete the admission process.

The counselling of PU BA LLB 2024 will include steps such as online registration, submitting the documents and educational certificates for verification and conforming the seat by paying the course fee.

Documents required for PU BA LLB counselling process

  • Class 10 and 12 mark sheets and certificate
  • Birth certificate
  •  Character certificate
  • Gap year affidavit (if applicable), 
  • Reserve category certificates (if applicable) 

After the document verification process, candidates will have to submit a demand draft of the fee for blocking seats for themselves to confirm their admission.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
It is advised to the candidates to have a good understanding of the PU BA LLB 2024 exam pattern to score maximum marks and secure a seat. The exam pattern helps in understanding the nature of questions that are likely to be asked during the PU BA LLB entrance test. The exam pattern of PU BA LLB helps in understanding the type of questions, question sequence, total marks, distribution of marks, marking scheme and relevant section. The details of the pattern are given below.

faqs.question: What subjects should I study for PU UG law entrance exam preparation?
faqs.answer: You should study subjects such as general knowledge, current affairs, legal and logical reasoning and maths for PU UG law entrance exam preparation.

faqs.question: How many questions are asked in PU UG law entrance exam?
faqs.answer: In PU UG law entrance exam, a total of 100 objective type questions are asked. Each question carries one mark, and a negative marking of 0.25 marks per incorrect answer is applied.

faqs.question: How can I fill the PU BA LLB 2023 application form?
faqs.answer: You can fill the application form of PU BA LLB 2024 by registering at the UG Law admission portal of the university. The application form can be filled in online mode and can be submitted by paying the application fees.

faqs.question: What is the minimum educational qualification required for appearing in PU BA LLB entrance exam?
faqs.answer: As per the eligibility criteria of PU BA LLB 2024, the minimum educational qualification for appearing in the university's UG law entrance exam is Class 12th. However, candidates appearing in the board exam (qualifying exam) are also eligible to appear in the entrance test.

exam_name: LSAT-India - Law School Admission Test for India

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Law School Admission Council (LSAC) will notify the LSAT─India 2025 exam schedule on its official website - lsatindia.in.  The LSAT─India 2025 application form will be opened tentatively in September 2024. Interested applicants must complete LSAT─India 2025 registration online. The LSAC does not prescribe any LSAT─India eligibility criteria 2025. So, candidates must make sure they fulfil the eligibility criteria prescribed by the law college in which they seek admission. Pearson Vue will conduct the Law School Admission Test─India on behalf of LSAC in two phases. The first phase of LSAT─India 2025 exam will be conducted tentatively in January 2025. The second phase of LSAT─India 2025 will be conducted tentatively in May 2025. Interested candidates can register and appear for both phases of LSAT─India 2025 and their best scores will be considered for admission.

There are 18 colleges accepting LSAT─India 2025 scores. There is no centralised counselling process for LSAT─India 2025. After appearing for the exam, candidates are required to separately apply to the desired colleges for admission.  Interested candidates must also note that Jindal Global Law School (JGLS) has announced that it will conduct the JGLS LLB admissions for 5-year LLB through LNAT UK 2025 scores only from the academic year 2025-26 onwards. 

What is LSAT─India Exam?

The Law School Admission Test ─ India (LSAT─India) is a standardised test of Law School Admission Council (LSAC). LSAT─India is conducted for admissions into 5-year LLB integrated LLB, 3-year LLB and LLM programmes of participating colleges. LSAT—India 2025 will focus on the high-level reading, informal reasoning, and deductive reasoning skills necessary to succeed in law schools. The LSAT─India 2025 syllabus includes sections on analytical reasoning, logical reasoning and reading comprehension. 

LSAT─India Colleges 2025

Several top private law schools in India accept LSAT─India 2025 scores for admission to law programmes offered at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels. At present 18 colleges are participating in LSAT─India 2025.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The Law School Admission Council does not prescribe any specific LSAT—India 2025 eligibility criteria. However, candidates must check the eligibility criteria with individual law colleges for undergraduate and postgraduate law programmes in which they wish to apply. To check the eligibility criteria of LSAT—India 2025 colleges candidates must visit their official websites. Given below is the general eligibility criteria for 5-year LLB, 3-year LLB and LLM programmes. LSAT— India eligibility criteria 2025 cover educational qualification, age limit and various other details as mentioned below. 

LSAT—India exam eligibility for 5-year LLB programme

  • Candidates who have passed 10+2 or equivalent exam.
  • Those who are appearing in the qualifying examination or awaiting results are also eligible to apply and appear for LSAT—India exam.

LSAT—India 3-year LLB eligibility criteria

  • Candidates having a bachelor's degree in any stream from a recognized university/ college
  • Those who are awaiting the results of the final year qualifying examination are also eligible to appear for LSAT—India.

LSAT—India PG eligibility criteria

  • Candidates having an LLB degree from a recognized university or college
  • Those who are awaiting the results of the final year qualifying examination are also eligible to appear for LSAT—India.

It must be noted that candidates who are appearing for their qualifying exams must submit their qualifying certificate at the time of admission or else their candidature is likely to be rejected.

application_process.html_content:
Pearson VUE will open the LSAT—India 2025 application form tentatively in September 2024. Candidates can visit the official website - lsatindia.in to complete LSAT—India registration 2025. Pearson will notify the  LSAT—India 2025 registration deadlines for the two phases of the exam to be conducted in January 2025 and May 2025. Candidates can register for LSAT—India 2025 for only one or both the phases of the exam. 

Candidates looking to appear for LSAT—India 2025 must register themselves and complete the application process online before the deadline. Candidates must keep the below-mentioned documents ready before filling out the LSAT—India application form 2025.

  • Email address

  • Valid phone number

  • Passport size photograph

  • A valid identity proof

  • Signature

  • Debit card/credit card or any other digital payment modes

How to fill LSAT—India 2025 application form?

Step 1: Visit the official website of LSAT—India - lsatindia.in.

Step 2: Click on the "New User Account" button to create a new account if you are a new user. If you are an existing user, log in using your registered email ID and password.

Step 3: Fill in your personal details like name, email address, mobile number, and pin code. Click on "Save and Continue" to proceed.

Step 4: Fill in your academic details like the name of your school/college, board/university, year of passing, and percentage of marks obtained. Click on "Save and Continue" to proceed.

Step 5: Upload the required documents like a passport-sized photograph, signature, and photo ID proof. The photograph should be in JPG/JPEG format with a file size of up to 80 KB. The signature should be in JPG/JPEG format with a file size of up to 80 KB. The photo ID proof should be in PDF format with a file size of up to 2 MB.

Step 6: Pay the application fee of INR 3,999 using any of the available payment options like credit/debit card, net banking, or UPI. After successful payment, you will receive a confirmation message with your LSAT—India registration number.

Step 7: Submit the application form and take a printout of the same for future reference.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Scoring a good percentile in LSAT—India is important for getting admission to top-ranked law schools. Candidates are therefore advised to prepare well in a systematic manner. An organized study plan that covers all subjects included in the LSAT—India syllabus would help the candidates prepare effectively.  Here are some important preparation tips to ace the LSAT—India exam.

  • One must fully acquaint oneself with the exam pattern of LSAT—India. They must be aware of the type of questions to be asked, the number of questions, duration, topics, and marking scheme.
  • Candidates must know that unlike other entrance examinations, LSAT—India does not test mathematical or general knowledge. The test aims to assess candidates’ critical reasoning and critical thinking abilities. Candidates are therefore required to practice the previous year's sample papers to have an idea of the questions asked and also to strengthen their logical and reasoning abilities.
  • Candidates are advised to take mock test sessions wherein they practice the sample papers within the same duration as that of the test. This will help the candidates to chart out a time management strategy and mentally prepare for the test.
  • Candidates are strictly advised not to leave preparation for the last few days before the exam.

LSAT—India Preparation Tips for Analytical Reasoning Section

  • Candidates are advised to practice mental computations in order to get quick in data analysis.
  • Candidates must carefully read and analyze analytical thinking passages in order to understand the nature of the passage.
  • Candidates must focus on thefacts while reading the passage and refrain from making unwanted assumptions.
  • Do not be stressed about the questions based on the set of circumstances thinking that they are long and complicated.
  • Complete one question at a time and then move on to the next question. Re-reading is a waste of time in the exam.

LSAT—India Logical Reasoning Preparation Tips 2025

  • To make sure your pattern is correct, check your pattern both forwards and backwards.
  • Do not spend too much time on a particular question. Sometimes logical reasoning questions take a lot of time.
  • Familiarizing yourself with patterns of symbols and shapes will help solve questions faster.
  • Candidates must make a habit of thinking logically in solving questions from this section.
  • Start your preparation with the easiest patterns and then move on to complex logical variables.

LSAT—India Reading Comprehension Preparation Tips 2025

  • Candidates must not try to memorize all the words in the passage.
  • Candidates are advised to first read the questions of the passage and then move on to reading the passage.
  • Do not over-emphasize the vocabulary skills for Reading Comprehension.
  • Candidates should not rely on 'trigger words' like 'but' or 'however'.
  • During preparation, while reading the passage, constantly ask questions from the passage.

cutoffs.html_content:
The scores of LSAT—India exam are accepted by around 18 private law colleges in India. Each of the participating colleges will release their LSAT—India cutoff 2025 separately. The cutoff of LSAT—India 2025 is the minimum percentile required to get admission to a particular course. Candidates who clear the LSAT—India cutoff will be eligible to participate in the counselling process of colleges accepting LSAT—India scores.

Factors like availability of seats, candidate's percentile, total number of applicants etc will determine the LSAT—India 2025 cutoff that will vary from one college to another.

LSAT—India Cutoff 2025 - Determining Factors

The below-given factors will play an important role in the determination of the LSAT—India 2025 cutoff:

  • Number of applicants who appeared for LSAT—India 2025 exam.
  • Availability of seats at a particular college/university.
  • Marks secured by candidates and their ranks in the merit list.
  • Category of the candidates.
  • Difficulty level of the exam.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The LSAT—India 2025 exam pattern will be notified on the official website. The LSAT—India exam pattern 2025 highlights the basic framework of the test paper, exam duration, marking scheme and various other details. Below, candidates can check the complete details of LSAT—India exam pattern 2025. 

LSAT—India 2025 Exam Pattern

ParticularsDescription

Mode of exam

Online, remote proctored mode

Duration of LSAT—India exam

2 hours 20 minutes

Total number of questions

92

Question format

Multiple-choice type.

Marking scheme

There is no negative marking

Scoring pattern

Test scores will be provided as a scaled score between 420 and 480, a score band, along with percentile rank.

LSAT—India 2025: Important points to remember

  • LSAT—India will be conducted online. All tests will be held in remote proctored mode using AI-assisted technology. 
  • Video recording of the candidate’s entire examination via the computer’s web camera will be done.
  • There are four sections in LSAT—India, 35 minutes each. Candidates will not be able to attempt questions or review answers once the section time is over. 
  • Additional time will be provided for check-in procedures and other formalities before the test.
  • If a candidate completes a section before the allotted section time expires, the balance of time will not be added to the next section’s allotted time.
  • There is no negative marking or penalty for incorrect answers. 
  • The candidate will receive a scaled score between 420 and 480 as a percentile rank.
  • The test cannot be accessed through mobile phones. Candidates should refer to Testing and Equipment Requirements for the Operating System needed to take the exam.

faqs.question: Is LSAT—India hard?
faqs.answer: Candidates require systematic preparation to get a good score in LSAT—India. However, the exam is considered relatively easier than CLAT and AILET because candidates can attempt the exam two times a year, and there is no negative marking for incorrect answers.

faqs.question: Is 450 a good score in LSAT—India?
faqs.answer: Yes, 450 is a good score in LSAT—India exam. However, it does not guarantee admission to top colleges.

faqs.question: What is the LSAT—India registration fee?
faqs.answer: LSAT—India 2025 registration fee is Rs. 3,999 for all candidates. Candidates can pay LSAT—India registration fee online while completing the application process.

faqs.question: Which is better CLAT or LSAT—India?
faqs.answer: Both CLAT and LSAT—India are popular law entrance exams in India. CLAT is conducted for admission to national law universities and its affiliated colleges. Whereas, LSAT—India is accepted by top private law schools in India.

faqs.question: What is LSAT—India official website?
faqs.answer: The official website for LSAT—India is

faqs.question: How many colleges accept LSAT—India scores?
faqs.answer: There are around 18 LSAT—India colleges at present. However, more LSAT—India are expected to be added soon.

faqs.question: Does Harvard accept LSAT—India?
faqs.answer: No, LSAT—India is conducted only for Indian law schools. Harvard does not accept LSAT—India.

faqs.question: Is LSAT—India harder than CLAT?
faqs.answer: No, LSAT—India is a standardised aptitude test and it is sightly easier than CLAT which test both aptitude and general awareness.

faqs.question: Can I take LSAT—India exam in India?
faqs.answer: Yes, LSAT—India is conducted in twice a year in India. You can appear in LSAT—India online, in remote proctored mode.

faqs.question: Is there any negative marking in LSAT—India exam?
faqs.answer: No, there is no negative marking in LSAT—India 2024. Candidates can attempt all questions.

faqs.question: How will the LSAT—India 2025 be conducted?
faqs.answer: LSAT—India 2025 will be conducted in online, remote proctored mode. Candidates can appear in the LSAT—India exam 2025 from the comfort of their home.

faqs.question: When will LSAT—India 2025 be conducted?
faqs.answer: The LSAT—India 2025 will be conducted tentatively in January 2025 and May 2025.

faqs.question: Who can apply for LSAT—India 2025?
faqs.answer: Candidates who have completed their 10+2 or are appearing for their class 12 exams can apply for the BA LLB programmes under LSAT—India 2025. Graduates in any stream can apply for the 3-year LLB programme under LSAT—India 2025.

exam_name: MHCET Law - Maharashtra Common Entrance Test Law

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Common Entrance Test Cell Maharashtra published the institute-level merit list for the MH CET 3-year LLB CAP round on September 20, 2024, on the official website - llb3cap24.mahacet.org. Candidates could fill in the choices through their login for the institute-level round choice-filling of LLB 3 years CAP from September 15-19, 2024. Earlier, the CET cell published the third MH CET law seat allotment for 3-year LLB on September 6, 2024, and completed the centralised MH CET law 2024 counselling process. The MH CET 5-year LLB institute-level merit list was also published on September 3, 2024. The CET Cell had earlier conducted three LLB 2024 CAP rounds. It had conducted the entrance exams for 3-year LLB and 5-year LLB on March 12, 13 and May 30, respectively. The MH CET results were published on May 3 for 3-year LLB and on June 26 for 5-year LLB on the official website.

What is MH CET Law Exam?

Maharashtra Common Entrance Test - Law or MH CET Law is a state-level law entrance exam conducted by the State CET Cell, Maharashtra. Through MH CET Law 2024 candidates would be admitted into 3-year LLB and 5-year LLB programmes of participating colleges in Maharashtra. The CET scores are accepted by around 150 law colleges in the state. A total of 147 law colleges accept MH CET law scores. 

MH CET 3-year LLB

Through the MH CET 3-year LLB entrance exam 2024, candidates are admitted into the 3-year LLB programme of participating colleges. There are around 16,240 3-year LLB seats available through the exam. The LLB CET 3 years tests candidates on English, GK, legal and logical reasoning.

MH CET 5-year LLB

Through MAH LLB 5 years candidates are admitted into 5-year LLB programmes of participating colleges. There are around 10860 5-year LLB seats available through the exam. The MH CET 5-year LLB exam tests candidates on English, GK, Legal and Logical Reasoning.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
MAH-LLB (5 Years)

The State Common Entrance Test (CET) Cell, Maharashtra prescribes the MHCET law eligibility criteria 2024 for 5-year LLB programmes offered by various law colleges. The MHCET law 2024 eligibility criteria covers the minimum requirements that one needs to fulfill before filling out the application form.

MH CET law eligibility criteria 2024 - 5-year integrated law:

  • Qualifying exam: The candidate needs to have passed 10+2 or an equivalent exam (including 3-year diploma in engineering)
  • Minimum marks: Maharashtra state candidates needs to secure a minimum aggregate of: 45% - General category, 40% - SC/ST, 42% - VJ / DT / NT(A) / NT / O.B.C./ S.B.C. category.   
  • Others: Candidates who have passed senior secondary or obtained a first-degree certificates through distance education or correspondence method are also eligible for admission.

MAH-LLB (3 Years)

Before filling up the MH CET law application form for 3-year LLB, candidates must make sure they fulfil the eligibility requirement. State CET Cell, Maharashtra has prescribed the following conditions as part of MHCET law eligibility criteria 2024 for 3-year LLB:

  • The candidates must possess a graduate degree in any discipline.
  • Candidates appearing for their final year exams can also apply provided they submit the qualifying certificates at the time of admission.

application_process.html_content:
The MH CET Law application form has been closed for both 5-year LLB and 3-year LLB courses. The MH CET 5-year LLB application form was released on January 18, 2024. Whereas, the 3-year LLB application form was released on January 12.

Candidates could fill out the MH CET Law application form online from the official website -  cetcell.mahacet.org. The application process for MH CET Law 2024 involves steps such as online registration, fill the application form by providing details such as educational qualification details, communication details, and fee payment.  

How to fill MH CET law 2024 application form?

  • Registration - The first step in the MHCET law 2024 application process is registration, wherein the candidate will have to create an applicant account. In the MHCET law registration form, enter your name, father's name, mother's name, contact details and other personal details. On successfully entering the information, a new account will be created with a unique login ID.

  • Fee payment - In the last step of the application process, the MHCET law application form fee 2024 has to be paid using an online mode: credit card, debit card or net banking.

preparation_tips.html_content:
MH CET law 2024 is one of the most popular and competitive entrance exams. Therefore, candidates will need to prepare well to secure good marks/rank. 

Difficulty level of MH CET Law 2024

The online, computer-based MH CET law 2024 for 5-year LLB will be of intermediate level. Questions in the maths section will be of Class 10 level, while, in the remaining sections, candidates will be expected to demonstrate a decent level of knowledge and awareness.

The difficulty level for MH CET law 3-year LLB will be slightly higher, at graduation level. Candidates appearing MH CET LLB 3 years should have a good conceptual understanding of the subjects as well as knowledge of current events.

How to prepare for MH CET law 2024- Important tips   

Candidates may follow the preparation tips given below to shape their preparation.

Make a study routine:

For a competitive entrance exam like MH CET law 2024, the preparation should be well organized and timely. Candidates should start their MH CET law preparation as early as possible. They should have a daily study routine, giving 3-4 hours each day to the preparation.

Refer to best-recommended book

The quality and relevance of the study material largely affect the candidates' preparation for MH CET law 2024. The study material for MH CET law 2024 should be concise, easy to understand, and relevant to the requirements of the test. Some of the important books that candidates can refer to for MH CET law preparation are mentioned below.

Make handwritten notes 

While preparing for the MH CET law 2024, candidates should make short and concise handwritten notes. These notes will help them in revising the topics in a short period of time. The short notes will also come handy a few days before the exam when candidates will need to revise the important topics quickly.

Solve sample papers

The official question papers of MH CET law are not released by the exam authorities. Therefore, candidates should rely on the sample papers available in the market. Solving sample papers is an important exercise as it makes the candidates' exam ready. Further. candidates can also solve the question papers of TS LAWCET, AP LAWCET, CLAT, AILET as these all are relevant for law entrance exam preparation and have very much similar syllabus and level as seen in MH CET law.

Topics-wise Questions, Preparation Tips & Books

  • MH CET LAW Legal Reasoning 
  • MH CET LAW Logical Reasoning
  • MH CET Law GK
  • MH CET Law Maths

admit_card.html_content:
The State Common Entrance Test (CET) Cell, Maharashtra releases the admit card of MH CET law in online mode. The MH CET 5-year LLB admit card was issued on May 18, 2024 while the MH CET 3-year LLB admit card was released on March 3, 2024. The MH CET law admit card 2024 is a mandatory document that the candidate has to carry with them on the day of the exam along with a valid photo id proof. MH CET law 2024 admit card carries information such as the roll number of the candidate, allotted MH CET law exam centre, date and time of exam and reporting time. 

On the day of the MH CET law exam, the candidate has to arrive at the exam centre as per the reporting time. Latecomers may not be allowed entry inside the exam venue. 

How to Download MH CET Law 2024 Admit Card?

  • Visit the offical website mahacet.org
  • Click on the programme (3-year or 5-year LLB).
  • Click on the download link to open the login page.
  • Enter your registration id and password.
  • Admit card will be displayed on the screen.
  • Download and take a printout of the admit card.

The candidate needs to check that the details mentioned on the admit card, including the candidate's name, allotted exam centre, etc. are correctly mentioned. If there is any discrepancy, one needs to get in touch with exam officials and get it rectified at the earliest.

Also check - MH CET LAW Rank wise College List 2024

counselling_process.html_content:
The State CET Cell, Maharashtra is conducting the MH CET Law 2024 counselling in online mode. The CET Cell released the MH CET 3-year LLB institute-level merit list on September 20, 2024. Candidates can view the merit list through their login on the official website - llb3cap24.mahacet.org. The CET Cell opened the choice filling for the institute-level LLB 3 years CAP round from September 15-19. Candidates could provide their college preferences through their login. It had earlier published the seat allotment for the third round of MH CET 3-year LLB counselling on September 6, 2024  The MH CET 5-year LLB institute-level merit list was published on September 3, 2024. The CET Cell has completed the centralised MH CET law 2024 counselling rounds for both the law programmes. The LLB 5 years admissions are completed at the institutional level as well.

All candidates who have a non-zero CET score in MH CET Law exam could register online for counselling and seat allotment from the official counselling portal. Candidates will be allotted seats in law colleges based on merit cum preference. Candidates must make sure to clear the MH CET Law cut-off to be eligible for seat allotment. Here are the simple steps for MH CET Law counselling.

  1. CAP Registration: MH CET law CAP registration is mandatory for appearing in the counselling process. Only such candidates who register for the counselling will be included in the merit list and considered for MH CET LAW seat allotment.
  2. Issue of merit numbers: Candidates who are shortlisted for counselling will be issued merit numbers.
  3. Choice filling: Candidates who have been issued merit numbers will be invited for choice filling and locking. As part of the choice-filling process, candidates will need to pick their choice of institutions before the start of CAP Round-I and CAP Round II. All entries should be in the order of priority.
  4. Seat allotment: The allotment of seats will be made after each MH CET LAW CAP Round taking into account the merit rank and choices entered by the candidate.
  5. Document verification: Upon allotment of seats, the candidate has to accept the seat, pay the acceptance fee through candidate log-in.
  6. Report at allotted college: Finally, the candidate has to report at the institute allotted to them on the designated day to complete the remaining admission formalities.

Note that options entered before CAP Round I will be the basis for seat allotment in CAP Round-I and II. Also, the choice-filling option will be activated again before CAP Round III, which will be the basis for seat allotment in the round.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Any candidate who plans to take the state-level exam should consult the MHCET law 2024 exam pattern which provides direction and key insights to ace the exam. 

The MH CET Law exam 2024 question paper will include objective-type questions only. There will be 150 questions to be attempted in a duration of 120 minutes. This translates to less than 1 minute per question. So, one must not only solve the questions but do it fast as well.

Mode of the examOnline, CBT (Computer Based Test)
Type of paperMultiple choice question paper
Exam duration120 minutes
Total number of questions150
Maximum marks150
Marking scheme1 mark for each correct answer
There is no negative marking
LanguageMarathi and English

exam_name: CUET LLB - CUET Law

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The National Testing Agency has declared the CUET BA LLB 2024 result on July 28, 2024. The CUET BA LLB 2024 answer key was released on July 7, 2024. The CUET LLB 2024 result was declared on April 13, 2024. Earlier, NTA released the CUET BA LLB registration form on February 27, 2024 in online mode.  CUET LLB 2024 was conducted on March 13, 2024 in the third shift. While CUET BA LLB 2024 was held on May 22, 2024. The application form of CUET PG LLB was closed on February 10. The Common Universities Entrance Test (CUET) is conducted for both 3-year LLB and 5-year LLB. Students interested in 5-year LLB admissions are required to appear for the CUET UG 2024, while 3-year LLB candidates had to appear in the CUET PG 2024 exam.

 The CUET LLB 2024 comprises of four sections - language/verbal ability, general knowledge, computer basics, and logical reasoning. Students who appear for the entrance exam are eligible for admission to the CUET LLB participating universities and colleges. CUET BA LLB comprises two language sections, one domain-specific legal studies along a general test. The scores of CUET BA LLB will be accepted by all central universities and over 100 private law schools.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates wishing to appear for the CUET Law entrance exam 2024 must first fulfill the eligibility criteria laid out by the authorities. The CUET LLB eligibility criteria 2024 specifies the conditions candidates need to fulfill to take the exam. The CUET Law 2024 eligibility criteria specifies details like educational qualification required, age limit etc. The eligibility conditions are given below:

CUET Law 2024 Eligibility Criteria

CourseEligibility
5-year LLBCandidates must have passed their class 12 from a recognized board.

Candidates who are currently in their class 12 are also eligible to apply.
3-year LLBCandidates who have completed their graduation from a recognized university are eligible to apply.

Candidates who are currently in the final year of their graduation are also eligible to apply.

Candidates who have completed their graduation from Open University with Preparatory Examination are also eligible to apply.

application_process.html_content:

Eligible candidates will be apply for CUET UG online from NTA's website; cuet.samarth.ac.in. The CUET 3-year LLB application form has already been closed on February 10.

The CUET LLB application forms for both 3 and 5-year LLB are made available in online mode only. The steps to apply for CUET Law 2024 are given below:

CUET Law 2024 Application Process

  • Logon to the official website of CUET: pgcuet.samarth.ac.in for 3-year LLB and cuet.samarth.ac.in for 5-year LLB.

  • Read the declaration form and click on "Proceed".

  • Log in to your CUET LLB candidate login.
  • Enter all the required academic, personal and communication details.
  • Save all the entered details and select your exam centre preferences.
  • Next, upload scanned copies of your photograph and signature in the specified format.
  • Make the application fee payment in your preferred mode of online payment.

exam_name: AP LAWCET - Andhra Pradesh Law Common Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
APSCHE has published the AP LAWCET 2024 results on June 27, 2024. Candidates can check the results on the official website - cets.apsche.ap.gov.in. The AP LAWCET 2024 counselling schedule will be declared after the result. Earlier, the authorities closed the objection window for the AP LAWCET 2024 provisional answer key on June 12, 2024. The AP LAWCET 2024 answer key was released on June 10, 2024. Acharya Nagarjuna University conducted the AP LAWCET 2024 exam on June 09, 2024, in online mode on behalf of APSCHE. Earlier, the authorities closed the AP LAWCET application form 2024 with a late fee of Rs 3000 on May 29, 2024 which was the final deadline to apply.  Eligible candidates could fill the AP LAWCET 2024 application form online from the official website - cets.apsche.ap.gov.in. The authorities had issued the AP LAWCET hall ticket 2024 on June 3, 2024.   The application form for AP LAWCET 2024 was released on March 26.  

AP LAWCET 2024 exam was held across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. The AP LAWCET 2024 question paper will have 120 multiple-choice questions on subjects such as general knowledge and mental ability, current affairs and legal aptitude. Each question will carry one mark.

What is AP LAWCET?

Andhra Pradesh Law Common Entrance Test, also known as AP LAWCET is a state-level law entrance exam conducted by Acharya Nagarjuna University, Guntur. AP LAWCET exam is accepted for admission to 3-year LLB and 5-year LLB programmes offered by the law colleges in Andhra Pradesh.

AP LAWCET Exam Details 2024

Candidates looking to appear for AP LAWCET 2024 should be familiar with the exam details. The online based AP LAWCET 2024 exam will have three sections as mentioned below:

  1. Current affairs and general knowledge
  2. Legal aptitude 
  3. Mental ability

AP LAWCET 2024 Exam: Highlights of Important Events

Release of AP LAWCET notification 2024The admission notification for AP LAWCET 2024 has been released by APSCHE on March 22. The AP LAWCET notification along with exam dates was published in local newspapers and the official website of the council.
Application form releaseAP LAWCET 2024 registration commenced on March 26. The official website for AP LAWCET 2024 application form submission is cets.apsche.ap.gov.in/LAWCET. 
Last date to apply for AP LAWCET 2024The application window without late fees was open till May 4, 2024. However, candidates who fail to register by the end of the first deadline will have to pay the late registration fee. The final deadline to apply for AP LAWCET 2024 was May 29, 2024 with a late fee of Rs 3000.
Admit cardAP LAWCET 2024 admit card was issued on June 03, in online mode. Only those candidates who have registered on the website of the council will receive their admit cards on the login window.
AP LAWCET exam dateAP LAWCET 2024 exam date was June 09. It was  an online test held in major cities of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.
Result announcementThe result of AP LAWCET 2024 has been announced on June 27, 2024. The scores will be accepted by law colleges in Andhra Pradesh. The council will organise a centralized counselling to complete the admission process.

AP LAWCET 2024 courses

Around 35 law colleges and universities will participate in AP LAWCET 2024. These colleges will offer 2,660 seats in 5-year LLB programmes and 5,578 seats in 3-year LLB courses. The law colleges of Andhra Pradesh will offer the following courses through AP LAWCET 2023.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
APSCHE prescribes the programme-wise eligibility criteria for AP LAWCET 2024 along with the admission notification. Candidates should read the eligibility criteria of AP LAWCET 2024 before filling the application form.  AP LAWCET eligibility criteria 2024 include the academic qualification of the candidate, qualifying exam passed and minimum marks, and age limit. The programme-wise eligibility criteria of AP LAWCET are given below.

AP LAWCET eligibility criteria 2024

ProgrammeQualifying examMinimum marks
3-year LLB Graduation in any stream45% marks for general category candidates

42% marks for OBC category candidates

40% marks for SC/ST category candidates

5-year LLB Passed 10+2 examination45% for general category

42% marks for OBC category candidates

40% marks for SC/ST category candidates

Also, candidates appearing in the qualifying examination can also appear in AP LAWCET 2024 to pursue 3-year or 5-year LLB based on their eligibility. However, such candidates must submit their qualifying certificate at the time of admission.

application_process.html_content:
Acharya Nagarjuna University closed the AP LAWCET 2024 application form on May 29, 2024 which was the final deadline to apply with a late fee of Rs 3000. It had released the AP LAWCET 2024 application form on March 26, 2024. The application form was available online on the official website. The last date to apply without late fee was May 4, 2024. Candidates registering after this deadline will have to pay a late fee. Eligible candidates could fill out the application form within the prescribed deadline by visiting the official website - sche.ap.gov.in.

Steps to fill AP LAWCET application form 2024

The AP LAWCET 2024 application process consists of various steps such as initial registration, filling details, uploading documents and payment of application fee.

AP LAWCET registration 2024

Candidates who meet the eligibility criteria of AP LAWCET 2024 should register themselves by providing their personal and communication details. This initial registration would give them their login credentials.

Candidates can make the payment of the registration fee online and offline. candidates can use a credit card, debit card or net banking details for online payment. They have to visit the nearest AP online Centre to pay the application fee in offline mode. The AP LAWCET 2024 application fee is Rs. 900, 850, and 800 for OC, BC and SC/ST categories respectively.

Filling AP LAWCET application form 2024

After successful registration, candidates should fill out the AP LAWCET 2024 application form. Candidates need to provide their academic qualifications, contact details and other relevant information. They also need to select the course and AP LAWCET exam centres 2024 while filling out the application form. 

Uploading documents 

Candidates should upload the required documents in the prescribed format and size. The passport photograph size should not be more than 30kb and the scanned copy of the signature should not be more than 15kb. 

Submitting AP LAWCET application form 2024

Candidates should check all the information provided in the application form and submit the same. They should also take a printout of the AP LAWCET application form for future reference.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Candidates appearing in AP LAWCET 2024, will have to secure a higher rank in the merit list in order to secure admission to a law college of their choice. Therefore, they will have to prepare well for the examination. The AP LAWCET preparation would revolve around completing the syllabus, making short notes, attempting mock tests and others. 

How to prepare for AP LAWCET 2024? 

Mentioned below are some of the important tips to help the students prepare for the examination.

Go through AP LAWCET syllabus and pattern

Before starting their preparation, candidates should always go through the syllabus and pattern of AP LAWCET as prescribed by the exam authority. By referring to the syllabus, they will be able to know about the subjects they need to prepare for the examination.

Make a study plan

Candidates should have a study plan to cover the entire syllabus of AP LAWCET 2024 smoothly. They should give around two-three hours each day for AP LAWCET preparation for three to four months. They should maintain a decent level of consistency to get the desired results.

Follow standard books for AP LAWCET preparation

Candidates should be focused on their AP LAWCET 2024 preparation. They should focus on limited but most relevant study material for the examination. The standard law entrance exam preparation books along with daily newspapers are ideal for the AP LAWCET preparation. Some of the important books for the examination are mentioned below.

Best books for AP LAWCET 2024 preparation

SubjectsBooks
Aptitude for the study of law Legal Awareness and Legal Reasoning: For CLAT and Other Law Entrance Examinations
Current affairs

Daily Newspaper

Monthly current affairs book

Study IQ videos


General knowledge

Lucent general knowledge

Manorama Year Book

NCERT of History, Polity and Geography


Mental ability 

A modern approach to Verbal & Non-Verbal reasoning by S. Chand

Quantitative aptitude by RS Aggarwal


Solve AP LAWCET 2024 mock test 

The mock tests and sample papers of AP LAWCET play a crucial role in the preparation. Candidates should attempt at least one or two mock tests in a week in a time-bound manner. The AP LAWCET previous year papers are the most important study resources to make the candidate familiar with the examination. By solving the mock tests, the candidates will be able to know about the type of questions asked in the examination. They will also be able to know about their strengths and weaknesses and work upon them before the actual examination.

Revise AP LAWCET important topics

While preparing for AP LAWCET 2024, candidates should revise the handwritten notes on all important topics multiple times. They should be well-versed in current affairs, general knowledge, and legal aptitude before the examination.

AP LAWCET 2024 exam day tips 

The exam day is one of the most crucial days when candidates have to give their best. Therefore, candidates should prepare well for the AP LAWCET exam day. Mentioned below are some of the important tips for AP LAWCET 2024 exam day.

  • Avoid reading anything new on the AP LAWCET exam day.
  • Reach the exam centre at least 30 minutes before the exam day.
  • Carry all the necessary items to the exam hall.
  • Read the questions carefully before marking any answers.
  • Complete your test at least 20 minutes before the stipulated time.
  • Spent your remaining 20 minutes revisiting the question paper and answering the unattempted questions.

admit_card.html_content:
The authorities issued the admit card of AP LAWCET 2024 on June 03, in online mode. Candidates could download AP LAWCET admit card 2024 by logging into their registered accounts. 

The admit card is a mandatory document for appearing in the AP LAWCET 2024. It carries information such as exam centre details, roll number of the candidate, exam date, and reporting time. Additionally, the admit card also mentions the exam instructions for AP LAWCET 2024.  

How to download AP LAWCET 2024 admit card?

  1. Click on the download admit card link given at the admission portal of AP LAWCET 2024.

  2. Log in using your registration number, mobile number, date of birth.

  3. The admit card of AP LAWCET 2024 will be displayed on the screen.

  4. Download and take a printout for future reference.

Candidates should keep the admit card of AP LAWCET safe till the admission process is over. The admit card may also be used at the time of counselling and seat allotment.

In case of any discrepancy in the information mentioned on the AP LAWCET admit card, candidates are advised to contact the exam authorities immediately for making necessary corrections.

AP LAWCET 2024 exam day - Important items to carry

Candidates can carry the following items to their exam centre.

  • Admit card of AP LAWCET 2024
  • A valid ID card such as an Aadhar card, Voter ID, Passport, PAN card
  • A blue or black pen
  • A transparent water bottle
  • A face mask and hand sanitiser

AP LAWCET exam instructions 2024

After downloading the admit card, candidates should carefully go through the exam instructions mentioned on it. They should follow all the guidelines to ensure hassle-free entry inside the exam hall. Some of the important exam instructions for AP LAWCET 2024 exam are mentioned below. 

  • Candidates should report to the AP LAWCET exam centre at least 30 minutes before the examination.
  • They must carry a copy of the AP LAWCET admit card and an original valid ID card issued by government authorities.
  • Candidates are strictly prohibited from carrying any electronic devices, study material, mobile phones, and calculators inside the examination hall. 
  • No candidate will be allowed to leave the examination hall before the completion of the test.
  • Further, candidates should keep the admit card safe after the test. They will have to produce the admit card at the time of admission.
