counselling_process.html_content:
APSCHE will release the AP LAWCET counselling date 2024 soon. The counselling will be conducted for candidates who have qualified in the exam. The counselling of AP LAWCET 2024 will be conducted in multiple rounds. Candidates who couldn't participate in the first round of counselling have the option to register for the next round. The AP LAWCET 2024 seat allotment is done based on both the merit rank of the candidate and also choices opted for admission, including course and college. 

AP LAWCET 2024 counselling includes steps such as online registration, choice filling (Web options), document verification, and fee payment. Candidates will be shortlisted for the counselling of AP LAWCET 2024 based on their merit in the entrance test.  APSCHE conducts the centralized counselling of AP LAWCET for admission to the law schools in the state. 

AP LAWCET 2024 counselling: Document checklist

  • Admit card of AP LAWCET 2024
  • Rank card of AP LAWCET 2024
  • Marksheets and certificates of qualifying examination
  • Caste certificate (if applicable)
  • PH/NCC/CAP/Sports and Games Certificates (if applicable)
  • Transfer Certificate (if applicable)
  • EWS certificate (if applicable)
  • Income certificate that is issued by post-January 1 in admission year [ the certificate should be valid for three years from the date of issue] (for candidates who want to claim fee exemption).
  • 7 years study/ bonafide certificate academic years preceding the year of passing qualifying examination
  • Residence certificate / Aadhar card proof of candidate/parents in Andhra Pradesh for a period of 10 years

AP LAWCET Counseling 2024: Important points to know

  • Candidates who have qualified in the AP LAWCET 2024 exam will be invited to attend the counselling process.
  • These candidates will get invitations for AP LAWCET counselling through SMS/email.
  • Candidates can also check the rank list by visiting the official website.
  • APSCHE will conduct the counselling of AP LAWCET in online mode. Hence, the shortlisted candidates will have to register themselves for counselling, fill in their choices and verify their documents only at the designated help-line centres.
  • All the eligible candidates will have to complete the document verification process successfully, or else they will be disqualified from AP LAWCET 2024 counselling process.
  • Candidates have to pay the prescribed counselling registration fee to participate in the counselling process.

You may also check - AP LAWCET 2024 Web Options

exam_name: ULSAT - University of Petroleum and Energy Studies Law Studies Aptitude Test
conducting_body: University of Petroleum and Energy Studies Dehradun

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
ULSAT 2024: University of Petroleum and Energy Studies (UPES), Dehradun conducts the ULSAT 2024 for admissions into its law programmes. The university offers 5-year integrated law programmes namely B.Com LLB (Hons), BA LLB (Hons.) and BBA LLB (Hons.), 3-year LLB and LLM programmes. ULSAT 2024 will be conducted in online remote proctored mode. Candidates can fill the ULSAT 2024 application form in online mode from the official website - admission.upes.ac.in. Alternatively candidates can also apply offline by obtaining the application form the admission office of the university. Candidates have to book their preferred slots and also appear for a demo test before appearing for the actual exam. ULSAT 2024 will take place in multiple phases. 

ULSAT 2024 and Law courses offered by UPES 

The School of Law at University of Petroleum and Energy Studies Dehradun offers a mix of Integrated UG and PG programmes in law. The list of courses at UPES Dehradun include B.Com LLB, BA LLB and BBA LLB, 3-year LLB and LLM. The UPES Law Studies Aptitude Test is conducted for admissions to these courses.

UPES Dehradun Alternative Admission Routes

Besides ULSAT 2024, there are also several alternative admissions routes to enrol for law courses at UPES Dehradun.  

UPES Admission Through CLAT Merit / LSAT-India Exams

UPES Dehradun also admits candidates through exams such as CLAT and LSAT—India for integrated law programmes. Students taking admissions through this route must have a CLAT AIR ranking up to 15000 or L-SAT India Percentile of 60 percentile or above and they will be exempted from ULSAT. However, such candidates must ensure they meet the eligibility criteria prescribed by the university. They may also have to appear for a personal interview in addition to the test. 

UPES Admission Through Board Merit

UPES Dehradun admissions to five year integrated law programmes are also done on merit, based on marks obtained in class 12. Candidates who scored 75% in 10th and 12th (along with English as one of the compulsory Subjects) are exempted from appearing for ULSAT. 

Popular Law Entrance Exam:

  • AILET
  • TS LAWCET
  • DU LLB  Entrance Exam

Toll-free number - 1800-102-8737

Website - www.upes.ac.in

How to fill ULSAT Application Form 2024?

The online application form of ULSAT 2024 can be filled in five stages, the application process of ULSAT 2023 is mentioned below. 

Registration – As a first step candidates must obtain their login credentials by registering using their mobile number and email id. This email ID and mobile number will be used for all further communication with the candidate. 

Log In – Once the candidates get the registration done, they have to log in using the login ID and password sent to their email ID. 

Fill out the Application Form – Next, candidates have to enter other details like parents' names, educational qualifications, and other relevant details.

Upload Photograph and Signature – At this stage, candidates have to upload the scanned images of their photograph and signature as per the prescribed size and dimension. 

Fee Payment – Candidates have to choose the fee payment option (Online) from the ULSAT 2024 application form and pay the application fee using a credit card, debit card and net banking.

ULSAT 2024 will be held in online remote proctored mode. Candidates will have to answer 150 questions spread equally across five sections in 2 hours. All the questions are objective in nature and candidates have to select the correct answer option out of the available. The five sections in ULSAT 2024 syllabus include -

  • Language

exam_name: RULET - Rajasthan University Law Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Rajasthan University has published the third RULET 2024 admission list on July 16, 2024. Shortlisted candidates have to submit the fee and complete document verification between July 18-July 20 from 8 am to 1 PM to take admission. The shortlisted candidates have to deposit an admission fee of Rs 50440. The RULET 2024 cut-off for the third round have also been published on the official website. Earlier, the university published the second RULET 2024 admission list on July 11, 2024 and the first RULET 2024 admission list on July 6, 2024. The university had announced the RULET 2024 result on July 3, 2024.  The university will admit students into the 5-year BA LLB programme through the Rajasthan University Law Entrance Test or RULET 2024. Candidates will be admitted into the 5-year law programme based on the marks obtained in RULET 2024 exam and personal interview and GD. Rajasthan University offers a total of 120 seats in the BA LLB programme. 

 Earlier, the RULET 2024 final answer key was released on June 27, 2024. The university released the RULET 2024 provisional answer key on June 20, 2024 shortly after the exam on its official website. Candidates could submit objections against the answer key till June 24, 2024. The RULET 2024 GD PI was conducted from June 21-28, 2024. Rajasthan University conducted RULET 2024 on June 20, 2024 in offline mode for which the RULET admit card 2024 was issued on June 14, 2024.

The university closed the RULET 2024 application form on June 10, 2024. It had released the RULET application form 2024 on May 21, 2024. Candidates could apply online form the university's official website -rulet.univraj.org. The RULET exam is a two-hour long test. The test paper consists of 150 objective-type questions, each carrying two marks. There will be a negative marking of 1 mark for each incorrect answer. The questions will be asked from the following subjects;

  • English (Language ability)
  • General knowledge
  • Current affairs
  • Legal aptitude
  • General science
  • Social science

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Rajasthan University has prescribed the following eligibility criteria for RULET entrance exam 2024.

For Candidates domiciled in Rajasthan:

The candidates must have passed Class 12th or an equivalent examination with at least 50% aggregate marks (45% in the case of SC and ST category candidates).

For candidates coming from other states

The candidates must have passed Class 12th or an equivalent examination with minimum 60% marks or above, from a board recognised by Rajasthan University.

Candidates appearing in the qualifying exam in the current year may also apply.

Age limit 

There is no age limit for appearing in the exam.

application_process.html_content:
Rajasthan University has closed the RULET 2024 application form on June 10, 2024. It had released the RULET 2024 application form in online mode on May 21, 2024. Candidates were allowed to fill the application form of RULET 2024 by registering on the official website - rulet.univraj.org. The RULET 2024 application form fee was Rs 2200 for all the candidates.

Candidates were also be allowed to make corrections to the application form on June 12, 2024 till 11:59 pm. While filling the application, candidates must provide genuine and verifiable information. Any candidate found falsifying information may be subject to disqualification.

The RULET 2024 application form filling process involves the following steps:

  • Candidates must visit the official website - rulet.univraj.org
  • Online registration - Candidates may register by using the email id, contact information and other details such as educational qualification, communication details etc. 
  • Uploading of documents
  • Payment of application fee - The application fee is Rs. 2000, which is the same for all applicants. candidates may submit the application using a credit card, debit card, or net banking facilities.
  • Taking printout of completed application

The following scanned documents have to be uploaded:

  • Photograph
  • Signature
  • Left-hand thumb impression

preparation_tips.html_content:
Candidates should follow the preparation tips given below to prepare well for Rajasthan univeristy llb entrance exam 2024:

Improve reading skills - Candidates should focus on improving  their reading speeds and for this, they should read newspapers, books, as well as blogs. 

Read best books - There are plenty of books by recommended authors that will help you learn important tips and tricks to score well in the exam as well as understand difficult concepts from the syllabus.

Practice mock tests - It is advised that to prepare and get an idea of the real-time exam, you should refer to the previous years' papers for RULET 2024 as well as there are plenty of mock tests available online that are similar to the law entrance exam. Practice the papers as much as possible to score well.

Revision notes - During the exam preparation it will not be possible for candidates to study all sections and therefore, it would be better if you making notes. It will be helpful for the GK section as well as the legal reasoning section.

admit_card.html_content:
The Rajasthan University issued the RULET admit card 2024 in online mode on June 14, 2024. Candidates could download the admit card of RULET 2024 by logging into the admission portal of the university. The RULET 2024 admit card will carry the details such as name, roll number, application number of the candidate, exam centre name, address, reporting time and exam day guidelines.

Steps to download RULET admit card 2024

  •  Visit the official admission portal of RULET 2024.
  • Click on the admit card link
  • Login using user id and password
  • The admit card of RULET 2024 will be displayed on the screen.
  • Download and take the printout for your reference.

Exam day Instructions

Here are some important points that candidates should take care of on the test day: 

  • Reach the exam centre at least an hour before the exam timings

  • Carry the admit card for RULET 2024 along with one valid photo ID proof

  • Avoid taking study material, mobile phones, calculator, watch or any technical device inside the examination hall

  • Follow the instructions of the exam invigilators during the test 

  • In case, candidates face any difficulty regarding the exam facilities, reach out to your instructor, however, asking answers from the question paper is not allowed.

counselling_process.html_content:
Rajasthan University notifies the RULET 2024 counselling schedule on the official website.The university has conducted two rounds of RULET 2024 counselling after publishing the admission list. The first and second RULET 2024 admission lists were published on July 6, 2024 and July 11, 2024 respectively. The  RULET counselling 2024 will be held in offline mode. 

RULET 2024 counselling process includes steps such as online registration, document submission, verification of documents and candidate details and seat allotment.  The RULET 2024 counselling will be held in multiple rounds. After each round, an admission list will be declared. Shortlisted candidates have to complete the admission process by submitting the course fee.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The university conducts RULET 2024 in offline mode. It has prescribed the test pattern of RULET 2024 which gives an insight into the test structure as well as other rules and modalities of it. The important features of RULET 2024 exam pattern are given. 

RULET 2024 exam syllabus will be divided across five sections as mentioned below.

  • English Language
  • Legal Reasoning
  • Current Affairs and General Knowledge
  • Quantitative Aptitude and Logical Reasoning

RULET 2024 will be conducted for a duration of two hours. There will be 150 objective type questions. Each correct question will carry two marks. And, no marks will be deducted for incorrect answers.

exam_name: TS LAWCET - Telangana State Law Common Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Telangana Council of Higher Education (TGCHE) has started the web option editing for the second phase of TS LAWCET 2024 counselling on September 25, 2024. The second TS LAWCET 2024 seat allotment will be published on September 30. The window to fill the TS LAWCET web options 2024 for the second round of counselling was open from September 23-24, 2024. Earlier, the authorities completed the first phase of counselling after publishing the seat allotment on September 2. Osmania University had earlier conducted the TS LAWCET 2024 on June 3, 2024 in online mode on behalf of TGCHE. The TS LAWCET 2024 exam was conducted in online mode at designated exam centres for TS LAWCET 2024 situated across Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. The TS LAWCET 2024 results were declared on June 13, 2024 for 3-year LLB and 5-year LLB candidates. It must be noted that the TS LAWCET result 2024 scores will be accepted by law colleges in Telangana for admissions to 5-year integrated LLB and 3-year LLB courses.

PGM Ambedkar has secured the top rank in TS LAWCET 3-year LLB 2024 with 97.490453 marks. Sriram Boddu has secured the top rank in TS LAWCET 5-year LLB 2024 with 87 marks. TSCHE will commence the TS LAWCET 2024 counselling from August 5. The authorities have also declared the result statistics along with the TS LAWCET 2024 toppers list. TSCHE declared the TS LAWCET 2024 result on June 13, 2024. Candidates can download the TS LAWCET result from the official website - lawcet.tsche.ac.in by entering their hall ticket number and date of birth. 

The authorities had released the TS LAWCET 2024 provisional answer key on June 6, 2024 and the objection window was closed on June 7, 2024. The TS LAWCET 2024 application form with a late fee of Rs 4000 on May 25, 2024.  

TS LAWCET 2024 Exam- Overview

Telangana State Law Common Entrance Test, popularly known as TS LAWCET is a state-level law entrance examination conducted by Osmania University, Hyderabad. The TS LAWCET exam is conducted for admissions to 5-year integrated LLB, and 3-year LLB courses offered by law colleges in Telangana. There are around 3,597 seats for the 3-year programme and approximately 1,580 seats for the 5-year integrated programmes. 5-year integrated LLB programmes include BA LLB, BBA LLB, and B.Com LLB.

Courses Offered Through TS LAWCET 2024

Candidates woud be admitted into the 3-year LLB and 5-year LLB programmes of participating colleges in the state of Telangana through TS LAWCET 2024. At present there are around 22 colleges offering 5-year LLB and 25 colleges offering 3-year LLB through TS LAWCET 2024.

TS LAWCET 2024 Exam Details

Candidates preparing for the TS LAWCET exam should familiarise themselves with the TS LAWCET exam pattern. The entrance test is conducted for 1 hour and 30 minutes duration. The TS LAWCET exam question paper comprises 120 objective-type questions from subjects such as English, general knowledge, and legal aptitude. The TS LAWCET syllabus 2024 is mentioned below.

TS LAWCET Syllabus 2024

TS LAWCET 2024 Admission Process

The admission process of TS LAWCET 2024 consists of the following steps

  • Issue of TS LAWCET application form by TSCHE.
  • Registering for the exam by candidates before the stiulated deadline.
  • Issue of admit card by the authorities
  • Exam held in online mode on the specified date
  • Online counselling registration
  • Publication of list of eligible candidates for TS LAWCET counselling process
  • Filling up web options by candidates
  • Publication of seat allotment

TS LAWCET 2024 Exam - Highlights of Important Events

Release of TS LAWCET notification 2024The official notification of TS LAWCET 2024 was released on February 28. It provided the dates for the release of the application form and exam date along with various other details.
TS LAWCET 2024 application formThe LAWCET 2024 application form was released on March 1. Candidates applying for TS LAWCET 2024 must fill the application form before the last date. The official website for submission of TS LAWCET registration form is, lawcet.tsche.ac.in.
Release of admit card for TS LAWCET exam 2024The admit card of TS LAWCET 2024 will be issued on May 30, to all candidates who have registered and completed the fee payment. The TS LAWCET admit card 2024 will be a mandatory document for appearing in the law entrance exam. 
TS LAWCET 2024 exam dateThe TS LAWCET notification 2024 mentions the exam date. As per the schedule, the TS LAWCET 2024 exam will be held on June 03, in online mode.
Release of answer key and TS LAWCET result declarationThe provisional answer key of TS LAWCET 2024 was released on June 06. Candidates will be allowed to raise objections following which a final answer key will be published.
The TS LAWCET result 2024 has been announced on June 13, 2024. Along with the result, individual rank cards and toppers lists will also be published. 
Counselling and seat allotmentThe TS LAWCET 2024 counselling notification mentioning dates, processes and colleges will be released separately. TSCHE conducts online-based TS LAWCET counselling in multiple rounds.

The TS LAWCET 2024 exam instructions are issued to the candidates through the TS LAWCET admit card. Given below are some of the important exam day guidelines 

  • Candidates must arrive at the specified exam centre at the reporting time which is usually 30 minutes before the start of the exam.

  • Candidates should not carry any forbidden items into the exam hall such as mobile phones, smartwatches, calculators etc.

  • Candidates are required to carry a prinout of the TS LAWCET 2024 admit card to the exam hall which is a mandatory document for the exam.

highlights.value: Telangana State Law Common Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates who wish to appear for TS LAWCET 2024 exam must learn about the eligibility criteria specified by the authorities. The TS LAWCET eligibility criteria 2024 has been released by the exam conducting body. Only those applicants who meet the TS LAWCET 2024 eligibility criteria will be considered for admission. The course-wise details of eligibility criteria are given below.     

TS LAWCET Eligibility Criteria 2024

ProgrammeQualifying examMinimum marks in qualifying exam

3-year LLB

The candidate needs to be a graduate in any discipline (10+2+3 pattern)

45% marks in aggregate

5-year LLB

Those who have passed the 2-year intermediate exam can apply (10+2 pattern) 

45% marks in aggregate


Relaxation in minimum marks: 5% relaxation in qualifying marks is applicable for SC and ST categories. 

Nationality: Indian nationals who meet local/unreserved status as required by Andhra Pradesh Educational Institutions (Regulation of Admissions) Order, 1974 and any amendments made thereto are eligible to apply.

application_process.html_content:
TGCHE has closed the TS LAWCET application form with a late fee of Rs 4000 on May 25, 2024. It had earlier released the TS LAWCET application form 2024 on March 1, 2024. The eligible candidates could apply online through the official portal - lawcet.tsche.ac.in. There is a common TS LAWCET application form for both UG and PG courses. Candidates will however have to give the course preference while filling out the application form.

The exam authority provides more than one deadline for TS LAWCET 2024 registration. Candidates were given the opportunity to fill the TS LAWCET 2024 application form by May 4, 2024 without late fee.  After the first deadline, late fee is charged which increases after each deadline. The late fee starts at Rs. 500 and goes up to Rs. 4000 by the end of the last deadline.

Candidates are recommended to use only genuine and verifiable information, as anyone found using counterfeit information stands to be disqualified.

How to fill TS LAWCET application form 2024?

  1. Pay the application fee - The first step in the TS LAWCET application process is the payment of the application fee. Online payments can be made using: net banking, and credit or debit cards. Another option is to visit a TS - AP centre, which are online centre operated by the authorities at various locations, and make the payment.

  2. Check payment status: Upon payment of the fee, check your fee payment status. If payment is successful, move to the next step. 

  3. Registration - Fill in the registration form and create an applicant account.

  4. Fill the form - In this step, enter your personal, academic, and contact details and finally submit the form.

TS LAWCET 2024 correction window

The university provides a correction window for TS LAWET 2024 application form. The TS LAWCET 2024 application form correction window was open from May 20-25, 2024. During this period, candidates are allowed to edit certain details on their application form. These include qualifying examination details,  local area status, annual income of the parents, address for correspondence, e-mail ID, gender, Aadhaar card details etc.

For any other changes such as qualifying hall ticket number, name, parents' name, mobile number, signature, or photograph, candidates have to make a written request to the convenor of TS LAWCET 2024 through an email ID. Such emails must be sent to convener.lawcet@tsche.ac.in along with the scanned documents.

preparation_tips.html_content: N/A

admit_card.html_content:
TPSCHE has issued the TS LAWCET 2024 hall ticket on May 29, 2024, a day earlier than scheduled. To download the TS LAWCET admit cards 2024, the candidate must visit the official portal, click on the hall ticket link and then log in using candidate credentials. 

An important document for taking the online exam, the admit card carries such details like the name, roll number, date and time of exam, and TS LAWCET 2024 exam centre name and address. In addition, it also carries exam-day guidelines to be followed by the candidate.    

Step-wise process to download TS LAWCET 2024 admit card

  • Go to the official website and click on the relevant link
  • A login window will open
  • Enter your date of birth, registration number and qualifying exam hall ticket number
  • On successful login, the TS LAWCET 2024 admit card will appear on screen
  • Download and take a printout of the admit card

Precautions to be taken after or before downloading the TS LAWCET admit card

  1. Check that the details mentioned on it are correct. If there is any discrepancy, like the name is incorrectly spelt, TS LAWCET 2024 test centre is incorrectly allotted, in such scenario contact admission officials to get it addressed immediately.
  2. The admit card will have TS LAWCET 2024 exam-day guidelines, including list of items that are allowed/prohibited, code of conduct etc.  
  3. Document checklist: In addition to the TS LAWCET admit card 2024, the candidate must also carry with them a valid photo id proof.

cutoffs.html_content:
The admission conducting authority will release the category-wise TS LAWCET cutoff 2024 for all the participating colleges during the counselling. Also, the TS LAWCET 2024 cutoff will be course-specific. The cutoff would indicate the last rank for which admission is given to a course for a particular category or institute. Candidates who score below this cutoff in the chosen course (or category or institute), he/she will not be considered for admission.

The various factors on which TS LAWCET 2024 cutoff would depend include the number of applicants, their performance in the LAWCET 2024 entrance exam, number of sanctioned seats, the category of the candidate, etc. If any of these parameters change, the cutoff will also automatically change.

counselling_process.html_content:
Telangana Council for Higher Education (TGCHE)  has opened the web option editing for the second phase of TS LAWCET 2024 counselling on September 25. Candidates can edit the options on the official website. The second TS LAWCET 2024 seat allotment is scheduled to be published on September 30 based on the preferences and rank of the candidates. The window to fill the web options was open from September 23-24. The authorities have completed the first round of TS LAWCET counselling 2024.

 The counselling of TS LAWCET 2024 is the last stage of the admission process during which the exam officials would verify the documents and information submitted by the candidates. The candidate must get their documents verified at designated centres. Post document verification, the candidate has to participate in web counselling, during which the choice should be filled and locked. Since TS LAWCET 2024 seat allotment is based on both the merit rank of the candidate and selected options.

How to participate in TS LAWCET 2024 counselling?

Candidates will have to follow the steps mentioned below to participate in the counselling.

  1. Registration for web counselling and payment of counselling process fee
  2. Upload original certificates
  3. Preliminary online certificate verification by the counselling authorities
  4. Exercise web options (selecting law colleges in the order of preference)
  5. Seat allotment (To be announced by the authorities)
  6. Download fee payment challan and joining report
  7. Report to the allotted college along with original certificates for final verification, fee payment 
  8. Verification of original certificates at the allotted college and commencement of classes

Documents Required for TS LAWCET 2024 Counselling Process

  • Class 10 and Class 12 marksheets and pass certificate

  • TS LAWCET 2024 score card

  • Aadhar Card

  • TC

  • Migration Certificate

  • Reservation certificate (if applicable)

  • Domicile certificate (if applicable)

  • Income certificate (if applicable)

  • Disability certificate (if applicable)

Among the first things, a candidate who is appearing in the state-level exam ought to do is consult the TS LAWCET exam pattern 2024. This is because it will provide insights into the TS LAWCET 2024 question paper, including the types of questions, asked, marking scheme, sections covered, and test duration. So, if a candidate is armed with the knowledge of what is in the TS LAWCET 2024 exam pattern, they will be better able to face the challenges posed by the 

TS LAWCET 2024 Test Pattern

exam_name: AIBE - All India Bar Examination

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Bar Council of India (BCI) has issued the AIBE 19 notification on September 3, 2024 on its official website, allindiabarexamination.com.  The AIBE 19 application form 2024 has also been opened on September 3, 2024. Candidates can register online from the AIBE official website. The deadline to complete AIBE 19 registration is October 25, 2024. The AIBE XIX (19) registration fee is Rs. 3,500 for general category candidates and Rs. 2,500 for SC/ST candidates. The AIBE 19 (XIX) exam will be conducted on November 24, in offline mode. BCI has also notified about the addition of a new AIBE exam centre at Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh. Candidates who have completed either a 3-year LLB or a 5-year LLB degree from a recognised institute can appear for AIBE 19. However, as per the revised AIBE 19 eligibility criteria, notified by BCI, final year law students and candidates who do not have an enrolment certificate are also eligible to register for AIBE 19. The AIBE result of such candidates will be subject to them completing their law degree.

Earlier AIBE was a post-enrolment exam, so candidates needed to complete their enrolment with a state bar council before applying for the All India Bar Council Exam. With the revised AIBE eligibility, candidates can complete AIBE registration without completing enrolment.

The Bar Council of India exam has questions on basic legal concepts taught in the LLB courses.  The Bar Council of India has also issued the AIBE 18 CoP on August 27, 2024. Candidates can collect the AIBE 18 Certificate of Practice from their respective state bar council in which they are enrolled.   BCI had also earlier released figures for AIBE 18 in response to an RTI query describing the number of candidates who appeared for the previous AIBE 18 exam. The pass percentage in AIBE 18 is 48.36%.

Candidates who clear the All India Bar Examination will be awarded a Certificate of Practice. The CoP is a mandatory certificate to practise law in India. Once a candidate clears the bar exam, he or she becomes an advocate. The All India Bar Examination (AIBE) is no longer conducted in open-book mode. However, candidates can carry the bare acts without notes or with short notes, without comments to their exam hall.  General category candidates have to clear the AIBE cutoff 2024 by securing at least 45% marks whereas SC/ST candidates are required to obtain at least 40% marks. AIBE XIX (19) 2024 is a qualifying exam. So, every candiate who scores the minimum AIBE cut off marks in the All India Bar Examination will be considered to have cleared the exam. 

The Supreme Court of India has also recently rejected a petition to lower the AIBE 19 cut off. The Bar Council of India had increased the AIBE cut off from AIBE 18 onwards. The earlier AIBE cut off was 40% for general/OBC candidates and 35% for SC/ST candidates.

What is AIBE?

A standard test for law graduates, AIBE is a certificate-based examination, conducted by the Bar Council of India (BCI). BCI conducts the AIBE exam to test an advocate's ability to practice law in India. The AIBE exam tests the skills of law graduates at a fundamental level and sets the minimum benchmark for admission to the practice of law. Law graduates who want to appear for the All India Bar Examination (AIBE) must also complete enrolment with the state bar council. AIBE exam is only open to candidates who have completed either a 5-year LLB or a 3-year LLB degree. AIBE is conducted in 40 cities across the country, in 11 different languages. Passing the bar examination or AIBE is mandatory for law graduates in India to represent clients in a court of law.

AIBE XIX (19) 2024 - Highlights

ParticularsDetails
AIBE full formAll India Bar Examination
Current sessionAIBE 19
Conducting bodyBar Council of India (BCI)
Purpose of examQualifying examination for law graduates who want to practice law
Frequency of examOnce/Twice a year
Mode  of examOffline, through pen and paper-based test mode.

What is New in AIBE 19 Exam?

Recent changes in the AIBE 19 exam include an increased AIBE cut off. Candidates from the general and OBC have to secure a minimum of 45% marks to clear the AIBE exam 2024. Candidates from SC/ST category must obtain 40% marks to qualify in the AIBE exam. The earlier AIBE cut-off was 40% and 35% for General/OBC and SC/ST respectively.

AIBE 19 Syllabus and Exam Pattern

The AIBE 19 syllabus consists of 19 subjects from different areas of law. There will be 100 multiple-choice questions covering the 19 subjects. Each question carries one mark. There will be no negative marking for incorrect answers.

AIBE 19 Exam Process 2024

The exam process of AIBE 2024 is a long drawn affair. The exam process starts with issue of exam notification by the Bar Council of India and ends with issue of CoP to candidates. The AIBE 19 exam process includes the following steps:

  • Issue of notification by BCI: The Bar Council of India will issue the AIBE 19 exam notification on its official website - allindiabarexamination.com. It will contain the AIBE 19 exam date 2024 and  all the other important AIBE 19 exam dates.
  • Enrolment with State Bar Council: Candidates desirous of appearing for AIBE 19 exam must first register themselves with the respective state bar council in which they wish to practise law. 
  • Filling of AIBE application form: Candidates must fill the AIBE 19 application form before the deadline in online mode from the official website.
  • Issue of AIBE admit card 2024: Next, BCI will issue the AIBE 19 admit card in online mode a few days before the exam. Candidates would be able to download the AIBE admit card through their login.
  • Appearing for the exam: Candidates must appear for AIBE 19 exam which will be conducted in offline mode at centres spread across the country.
  • AIBE 19 result: BCI will publish the AIBE exam result tentatively two months after the exam. The AIBE result 2024 would be declared in online mode on the official website.
  • Issue of CoP: Candidates who have cleared the AIBE exam by scoring above the AIBE cut off will be awarded a Certificate of Practice.

AIBE 18 Statistics

In response to an RTI query, the Bar Council of India has release the following figures for AIBE 18 exam.

AIBE 18 Data

ParticularsDetails
No. of candidates registered1,48,781
No. of candidates appeared1,44,014
No. of candidates absent4767
No. of candidates passed69646
No. of candidates failed74368

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The Bar Council of India prescribes the AIBE 2024 eligibility criteria. Candidates who want to apply for AIBE 2024 must meet the eligibility criteria before filling out the application form. The eligibility criteria of AIBE 18 includes conditions pertaining to educational qualification, minimum passing marks, enrolment with a state bar council and age limit if any. The AIBE eligibility criteria are as mentioned below. 

Educational Qualification

Candidates should have completed graduation in law (3-year LLB or 5-year LLB) from a university recognized by the Bar Council of India.  Final year law students are also eligible to appear for AIBE. All candidates who obtained their law degree from 2009-10 onwards are required to appear in AIBE and pass the examination in order to practice law in India. However, candidates whose law degree was awarded before 2009-10 are not required to appear in the AIBE exam.

Minimum percentage required

BCI does not prescribe any minimum passing marks to be eligible to appear for AIBE. The exam is open to all law graduates. 

Enrolment with state bar council 

As per the revised notification issued by BCI, candidates without an enrolment certificate can register for AIBE. Earlier, candidates had to enrol themselves with the respective state bar council before appearing in the All India Bar Examination.  To enrol with the state bar council, candidates were required to submit their qualifying documents along with the required fee and appear before the enrolment committee. Once enrolled, candidates can appear for the AIBE exam any number of times.

application_process.html_content:
The BCI has opened the AIBE 19 application form on September 3, 2024. Candidates can fill out the AIBE 19 application form 2024 from the official website - allindiabarexamination.com. The deadline to complete AIBE 19 registration is October 25, 2024 Interested candidates must also pay the prescribed application fees to complete the AIBE 19 application form by October 28, 2024.  Applicants can make corrections to the AIBE 19 application form till October 30, 2024.

AIBE is a post-enrolment exam, so candidates must first enrol with the state bar council. Once enrolled with the state bar council, candidates can appear for the AIBE exam any number of times. When filling out the AIBE 19 application form one must provide genuine and verifiable information or else the candidate will be disqualified.

How to fill AIBE 19 (XIX) application form 2024 

  • Registration: The candidate will have to first get registered by entering their enrolment number, date, and year of enrolment.
  • Fill in the form: In this step personal, education and enrolment have to be entered. In the education and enrolment section, the candidate has to enter the name of the college from which the LLB degree is earned, year of admission and year of passing out, duration of the course, graduation stream, enrolment number, state with code, and year of enrolment.
  • Uploading of documents: Scanned copies of the signature and photograph have to be uploaded in the prescribed specification (size 10-50 kb). A self-Attested enrolment certificate and photo id should also be uploaded. The allowed format is jpg/jpeg.
  • Select test language and exam centre: The AIBE 2024 exam will be administered in 11 languages.
  • Test languages: Assamese, Bengali, English, Gujarati, Hindi, Kannada, Marathi, Oriya, Punjabi, Tamil, Telugu
  • Payment of test fee:  The candidate will next have to pay the application fee in offline mode using an SBI bank challan (which has to be downloaded from the online application portal) at a nearby SBI bank branch. 
  • Uploading of challan info: The candidate will have to upload fee payment details like bank code, journal number, etc. to complete the application process.

preparation_tips.html_content:
The AIBE 2024 exam is conducted at the national level. The test is a mix of legal awareness and law. Therefore, candidates need to keep themselves updated with the current legal developments while also working on the fundamentals of law.  

  • At this stage, you are more or less familiar with the AIBE 2024 XIX (19) exam pattern. But there is a twist in that books and textual material; bare acts are allowed through. So, the candidate now has to work for a plan where they are able to answer questions asked in the exam without having to consult a source. There is no doubt that one will have to work and depend on their memory power among other things to ace the exam this year. 
  • Being conversant with the marking scheme, the structure of questions asked, weightage carried by various sections will help to get more out of one's preparation. 
  • Don't go beyond the AIBE syllabus of 2024, because questions will be drafted from the official syllabus only.
  • Candidates are advised to start their preparation well in advance and not leave the syllabus for the last few days. Break down the syllabus in chunks, assign time for each block, and allot time as per the difficulty level of a topic. 
  • Candidates must go through AIBE sample papers and practice them. They may also take mock tests to get an idea of the exam situation and how to deal with it. Solving sample papers is also an effective preparation strategy. This will mentally prepare the candidate for the exam and he/she will not be caught off-guard easily. 
  • Complete the syllabus in a way that there is enough time for revision.

admit_card.html_content:
The Bar Council of India (BCI) will release the AIBE 19 admit card on November 18, 2024. Candidates must download the admit card from the official website - allindiabarexamination.com. Candidates cannot appear for AIBE without the AIBE admit card. It contains important details such as the exam centre details, exam date and time, reporting time, personal details of the candidate, and important exam instructions.

An important document for appearing in the AIBE exam 2024, the admit card carries vital details like the date and time of the exam, AIBE exam centre 2024 allotted to the candidate and exam-day guidelines. BCI will not send the AIBE 19 admit card by post. Candidates can only access the admit card in online mode.

How to download AIBE XIX (19) admit card 2024? 

  • Visit the official website of AIBE (19) 
  • Click on the official admit card download link. 
  • The candidate will be redirected to a log-in window
  • You have to enter your registration number and DOB
  • On successful login, AIBE admit card will be displayed in downloadable pdf format.
  • Download and take a printout of the AIBE 2024 admit card.

Details mentioned on the AIBE admit card 2024

  • Candidate's name
  • Roll number and application number
  • Name and address of AIBE XVIII (18) exam centre.
  • AIBE 2024 exam date and timings
  • Reporting time
  • Exam-day guidelines

Discrepancy in AIBE admit card

 In such a scenario, the candidate needs to get in touch with exam officials at the below numbers/email ids at the earliest.

AIBE Helpdesk

ParticularsDetails
Email idaibe.bci@gmail.com
Phone no.

9804580458, 01149225022, 01149225023

AIBE 19 Exam Day Guidelines

The AIBE exam instructions are mentioned on the admit card of AIBE. Given below are some of the important AIBE exam day guidelines:

  • Candidates will not be allowed to appear for the exam without the AIBE 19 admit card
  • Along with the admit card, candidates must carry one Photo ID proof to their respective examination centre. 
  • Candidates are allowed to carry only BARE ACTS (without notes and comments) inside the examination centre.
  • Electronic or communication devices such as mobile phones, laptops, smart watches etc, books or notes (except BARE ACTS without notes and comments) are strictly prohibited.
  • Candidates must not leave the examination hall before the conclusion of the examination and without handing over the answer sheet.
  • Use only Blue/Black Ball Point pen.
  • Using a pencil in the OMR sheet will lead to the disqualification of the candidate.
  • Candidate should enter the roll number on the answer sheet as it is mentioned on the admit card and fill in the respective ovals. Any mismatch would lead to disqualification.
  • Candidate should fill the question booklet Set code and roll number and all other necessary information correctly on the answer sheet.
  • Candidates with more than 50% disability will be given 20 minutes of extra time per hour. Such candidates have to submit a certified copy of their disability certificate to the invigilator to avail the extra time.

cutoffs.html_content:
The Bar Council of India prescribes the AIBE 19 cutoff. The cut off for AIBE is 45% for general and OBC category candidates. AIBE cutoff 2024 for SC/ST candidates is 40%. The BCI has prescribed the cut off for AIBE in the form of minimum qualifying marks. All candidates securing a score equivalent to or above the passing marks will be declared as "Pass" in the examination. The AIBE cut off was increased from AIBE 18 session onwards from the earlier 35% for SC/ST and 40% for General and OBC categories. Recenty, the Supreme Court also rejected a petition to lower the AIBE cut offs.

It must be noted, that even though the AIBE exam is for 100 marks, the actual AIBE 19 cut off marks may change due to revised answer key.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Candidates appearing in AIBE XIX (19) 2024 should be familiar with its exam pattern. The AIBE exam pattern informs about the test mode, language, question numbers, types as well as marking scheme. Having prior information on AIBE XIX (19) exam pattern would help the candidates prepare well for the examination. The exam contains multiple choice questions from different areas of law. There is no negative marking. Candidates must score atleast 45 marks out of 100 to qualify in the exam. (40 marks for SC/ST candidates)

AIBE is no longer an open-book exam. Candidates are not allowed to carry books and other textual material inside the exam hall. However, Bare acts (without notes) are allowed. The details of the AIBE syllabus and exam pattern are given below.

Marking scheme

1 mark for each correct answer. There is no negative marking.

faqs.question: Is AIBE objective or descriptive?
faqs.answer: The questions in the AIBE question paper are in objective form.

faqs.question: Is AIBE an open-book exam?
faqs.answer: AIBE is not an open-book exam since 2021 onwards. However, candidates are allowed to carry bare acts without notes.

faqs.question: Do I need to enrol in the state bar council to appear in AIBE 2024?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is mandatory for candidates to enrol themselves with the State Bar Council to appear for the AIBE 2024.

faqs.question: Can someone appear for the bar examination without a law degree?
faqs.answer: No, only candidates need a law degree to appear for the bar examination.

faqs.question: Is AIBE online or offline?
faqs.answer: AIBE is conducted in offline mode

faqs.question: Is there any age limit to appear for AIBE?
faqs.answer: No, there is no age limit to appear for AIBE

faqs.question: Is there any limit on the number of attempts for AIBE?
faqs.answer: There is no limit on the number of attempts for AIBE.

faqs.question: How many times is AIBE conducted?
faqs.answer: The All India Bar Examination is usually conducted once a year. However, BCI has conducted AIBE twice a year as well.

faqs.question: Can anyone practice law without appearing in the AIBE ?
faqs.answer: No, a law graduate who completed law graduation from 2009-10 onwards cannot practice law without appearing for AIBE.

faqs.question: Can a lawyer practice without AIBE?
faqs.answer: No, AIBE is a mandatory exam to get Certificate of Practice and law graduates  cannot practice law with Certificate of Practice.

faqs.question: How many AIBE exams in a year?
faqs.answer: The AIBE exam is generally conducted twice every year.

faqs.question: Is there any exam for Bar Council of India?
faqs.answer: The All India Bar Examination (AIBE) is conducted once or more than once every year. The Bar Council of India conducts the examination nationally. The AIBE exam is conducted in offline mode.

faqs.question: When will the AIBE XIX admit card be released?
faqs.answer: The admit card of AIBE XIX will be issued around one week before the exam.

faqs.question: Is AIBE an open book exam?
faqs.answer: AIBE is no longer an open book exam, so you cannot carry the study material like books, copies inside the hall. However one can carry Bare acts with them.

faqs.question: Is there any negative marking in AIBE?
faqs.answer: There is no negative marking in AIBE

faqs.question: What is the qualifying marks for AIBE?
faqs.answer: General and OBC category candidates must score minimum 45 marks out of 100 to qualify AIBE exam. SC and ST category candidates need to score minimum 40 marks to qualify.

faqs.question: Is it difficult to pass AIBE exam?
faqs.answer: No, AIBE is not a very tough examinations. It is just a qualifying examination where candidates need to score qualifying marks to get their Certificate of Practice.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for AIBE exam?
faqs.answer: As per the eligibility criteria, the candidate must be a law graduate and has completed his graduation after 2010.

exam_name: AILET PG - All India Law Entrance Test for LLM

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
National Law University, Delhi has opened the AILET PG 2025 application form on August 1, 2024. Candidates can submit the AILET LLM application form 2025 on the official website - nationallawuniversity.ac.in. The last date to apply for AILET 2025 is November 18, 2024. NLU Delhi will conduct AILET PG 2025 exam on December 8, 2024. AILET 2025 will be conducted in offline mode in around 50 AILET exam centres spread across 35 cities in the country. The All India Law Entrance Test is conducted once every year for admission to BA LLB and LLM courses at the National Law University, Delhi. NLU Delhi has been ranked the second-best law school in India in the NIRF Law Rankings 2023.

The purpose of AILET LLM is to admit students into the one year LLM programme of National Law University, Delhi. NLU Delhi prepares a merit list based on the scores obtained in AILET and holds multiple counselling rounds for its admissions process. The LLM programme at NLU Delhi has an intake capacity of 70 seats through AILET merit. The seats will be filled through counselling based on AILET LLM 2025 scores as per the reservation criteria followed by the institute.

AILET LLM 2025 Updated Syllabus and Exam Pattern

NLU Delhi has made quite some changes to the AILET LLM syllabus and exam pattern  last year. Students  will now have 120 minutes to attempt the exam. Earlier the time duration for the exam  was earlier 90 minutes. All questions in AILET PG will now be asked from different branches of law in the form of MCQs. Also, there will be no descriptive questions in the AILET PG 2025 exam. Each question in the exam will now carry one mark, which means the maximum marks are now 100 instead of 150.

Important Topics for AILET LLM 2025

  • Constitutional Law
  • Jurisprudence
  • Administrative Law
  • Law of Contract
  • Law of Torts
  • Family Law
  • Criminal Law
  • Property Law
  • Company Law
  • Public International Law
  • Tax Law
  • Environmental Law
  • Labour & Industrial Law

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates desirous of admission to the LLM program at NLU Delhi must meet the prescribed AILET PG 2025 eligibility criteria. AILET PG eligibility criteria 2025 include important points such as qualifying exam passed, minimum marks in qualifying exam, and age limit. Refer to the following points given below for complete details.

AILET PG eligibility criteria 2025

  • Qualifying exam: The candidate needs to be an L.L.B graduate from a recognized university recognized by Bar Council of India

  • Marks in qualifying exam: The candidates must have scored minimum 55% marks in the qualifying degree exam

  • Relaxation: Reserved category candidates belonging to SC/ST/PwD category are eligible for 5 percent relaxation in minimum marks

  • Those appearing in qualifying exam: Such candidates who are appearing in final year L.L.B examination may also apply

  • Age: No age bar is prescribed for admission to LLM program

application_process.html_content:
NLU Delhi has released the AILET PG 2025 application form on August 1, 2024 on its official website. The deadline to submit the AILET PG application form 2025 is November 18, 2024. The applicant must take note to use only genuine and verifiable information for filling the application form as otherwise the candidature of the candidate may be cancelled at any stage of the admission process. 

The following items are required for the registration process

  • A valid email-id

  • An active mobile number

  • Scanned photograph and signature in the prescribed specification

Steps to fill AILET application form 2025

  • To start the application process, the applicant had to first get registered by entering details like email id, mobile number, and date of birth.

  • The candidate had to select and confirm a password for the new candidate account.

  • Next the candidate has to select the program of study from the drop-down menu and lock the application.

  • Fill in the application, including personal and academic details

  • Upload signature and photograph
  • Pay the application fee 
  • Submit the form

counselling_process.html_content:
NLU Delhi will conduct the AILET PG counselling 2025 in online mode after the delaration of results. The AILET LLM counselling 2025 will be conducted in five rounds. The admission authorities will open the AILET LLM 2025 counselling registration shortly after the declaration of results. Candidates will be able to register for the counselling in online mode on the official website.

AILET LLM counselling 2025 - Steps to register

Step 1: Check AILET invite list 2025 - The university will release the list of shortlisted candidates for AILET 2025 counselling after the declaration of results. Candidates three times more than the available seats will be invited for AILET counselling 2025. Only those candidates who will receive the invitation will be eligible to appear in the counselling.

Step 2: AILET 2025 counselling registration - Invited candidates will have to login to the admission portal using their registration number or application number as well as date of birth. They will also have to pay the counselling fee and upload the necessary documents and print the acknowledgement slip for future reference.

Step 3: Provisional admission list for AILET 2025 - The university will release the course-wise first provisional admission list after the verification of the documents submitted by the eligible candidates along with the waiting list.

Step 4: Admission fee payment - The candidates who are shortlisted will have to pay the counselling fees and the pay the remaining admission fees within the deadline.

Documents required for AILET counselling 2025

  • AILET 2025 counselling letter received from the official source
  • A copy of AILET LLM admit card 2025
  • Self-attested  copy of Class 10 and Class 12 mark sheets and certificates
  • Graduation mark sheets and certificates
  • Character certificate of the candidate issued by the last attended school or college
  • Category certificate (if applicable)

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The applicant by consulting the exam pattern of AILET PG 2025 understands how to prepare for the exam. For example, the AILET PG exam pattern tells the test is objective type, including 100 questions and is of 120 minutes. So, the candidates need to focus on accuracy and speed.

AILET PG exam pattern 2025

  • Mode of exam: Offline
  • Test Duration: 2 hours
  • Language: English
  • Question type: Objective type
  • Total number of questions: 100 objective type question
  • Number of Questions: 100
  • Marking Scheme: 1 mark for a correct answer, while 0.25 marks are deducted for incorrect attempt.

exam_name: AIL LET - Army Institute of Law Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Army Institute of Law has decalred the AIL LET 2024 result on June 17, 2024. Candidates can access the result from the official website - ail.ac.in. Shortlisted candidates will be able to take part in the admission and counselling process. Earlier, the institute conducted AIL LET 2024 exam on June 9, 2024. It had closed the AIL LET 2024 application form with late fee of Rs 1000 on May 13, 2024. Candidates could apply online form the institute's official website.  Candidates who have cleared 12th grade or are appearing in the board exams were eligible to apply for admission into the BA LLB programme offered by the institute. The admissions will be conducted through the AIL LET 2024 exam. The deadline to submit the AIL LET application form 2024 without a late fee was May 8, 2024. The institute had opened the AIL LET 2024 application form on on April 9, 2024.

The question paper of AIL LET 2024 will have questions from general knowledge, current affairs, maths and legal awareness. All candidates who register for AIL LET 2024 will be able to download the AIL LET 2024 admit card from May 30, 3034 onwards. The admit card of AIL LET 2024 is a mandatory document for appearing for the law entrance exam and it will also inform about the candidate's roll number, exam centre location and address.  

What is AIL LET exam?

The Army Institute of Law offers a 5-year integrated BA LLB programme through an entrance test popularly known as AIL LET. The institute also offers an LLM programme through AIL LET PG. The entrance exam is conducted in online mode, at the designated test centres across the country. The online-based AIL LET is a two-hour-long test consisting of 200 MCQ-based questions. Candidates are shortlisted based on their AIL LET scores for counselling and admission. 

Army Institue of Law BA LLB seats 2024

The institute offers 100 seats in BA LLB and 15 seats in LLM programme. The seats are distributed under various categories, but a majority of seats are offered to the wards of Army Personnel. Candidates can check the detailed course-wise seat matrix below.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates must ensure they meet the AIL LET 2024 eligibility criteria before applying for the exam. The eligibility criteria of AIL LET 2024 prescribed the institute includes requirements about the minimum qualification, minimum marks in the qualifying exam, and age limit. The complete details of AIL LET eligibility criteria are as mentioned below. 

Educational Qualifications

  • Minimum Qualification: The candidates must have cleared 10+2 exam from Punjab School Education Board or an equivalent exam recognised by Punjabi University, Patiala.

  • Minimum Marks in qualifying exam: Candidates must have scored a minimum aggregate marks in the qualifying exam should be 45%. 

  • Open University: Candidates who have completed 10+2 through the Open University system directly without having any basic qualifications for pursuing such studies, are not eligible to apply.

  • Compartment papers: Candidates who have passed 10+2 in compartments are not eligible for admission.

Provisional application: Applicants appearing in the qualifying exam in March/ April can take AIL LET 2024. However, such candidates need to produce their qualifying certificate with the minimum prescribed marks at the time of admission.

Age limit

There is no age limit for appearing in the AIL LET 2024 exam or pursuing BA LLB or LLM programmes from the institute.

application_process.html_content:
Army Institute of Law has closed the AIL LET applicatio form 2024 with a late fee of Rs 1000 on May 13, 2024. It had released the AIL LET 2024 application form in online mode on April 9, 2024. Eligible candidates could submit the AIL LET application form 2024 online from the official website of the institute - ail.ac.in. Candidates must ensure to fill the form accurately and completely. Any omission or error can lead to rejection of the application form. The last date to submit the AIL LET application form 2024 without late fee was May 8, 2024.

How to Fill AIL LET 2024 Application Form?

  • Visit the official website and click on the official application link.

  • Obtain login credentials by registering for the exam using basic details such as name, phone number, date of birth, email id, and other details. Upon successful registration, a registration number will be created.

  • Log in to the newly created account to continue the application form-filling process. There will be sections like academic, personal and contact details, which have to be duly filled. 

  • Upload photograph, signature, and other mandatory documents. Note that the size of documents to be uploaded must be – passport-size photos (<120 Kb), army category certificates (<1.5 MB), documents (<1.5 MB)

  • Pay the stipulated application fee. .

preparation_tips.html_content:
Candidates seeking admission to Army Institute of Law, Mohali, Punjab may go through the exam preparation tips given here:

  • Study the exam pattern carefully to get an idea about the type and number of questions asked, topics covered, marking scheme, etc.

  • Familiarise yourself with the AIL LET 2024 syllabus as it will make it easier to decide which topics are important and allocate appropriate time.

  • Make and stick to a study routine, while making sure that enough time is allotted to all the topics.

  • Be consistent and study regularly to retain the preparation momentum.

  • Solve as many sample papers and previous year’s question papers in order to assess the level of preparation and also to improve problem-solving skills. 

  • Take mock tests to get a real feel of the exam and give last-minute finishing touches to exam preparation. In fact, mock tests can be taken with a month or so left for the exam, to test and improve one’s time management skills and exam awareness. 

  • Make sure to stay positive and healthy during the course of the preparation. To achieve keep a proper schedule for food, rest and sleep. Stay in the moment rather than pondering on the past or worrying about the future.

admit_card.html_content:
Army Institute of Law, Mohali, Punjab released the AIL LET 2024 admit card on May 30, 2024 in online mode, on the official examination portal of the institute. Candidates who register and complete the fee payment can download AIL LET 2024 admit card by logging into their registered account. The admit card is an important document which must be carried to the examination hall. It contains details such as the candidate's name and roll number, date and time of the exam, exam centre details, photo, and signature.  

Steps to download AIL LET admit card 2024

  • Click on the official link for admit card

  • Login by entering user ID and password

  • The admit card will be displayed on screen 

  • Download and take a printout of the admit card. 

Important things to carry on AIL LET 2024 exam day 

Candidates appearing in AIL LET 2024 should carry the following items while going to the examination hall.

  1. A hard copy of AIL LET 2024 admit card
  2. A valid photo identity card 
  3. A blue/black ballpoint pen

counselling_process.html_content:
The institute will conduct the counselling of AIL LET 2024 in online mode. Only those candidates who qualify AIL LET 2024 exam and are included in the merit list will be invited for the counselling. The counselling process will be conducted as per the category of the candidates and their rank. Candidates shortlisted for counselling must be present at the counselling venue in person. 

AIL LET 2024 Counselling – Document Checklist

  • 10+2 pass certificate

  • 10+2 mark sheet

  • Proof of date of birth

  • Character certificate

  • Migration certificate

  • Medical fitness certificate

  • Category certificate (if applicable)

  • Willingness certificate

  • Eligibility certificate (applicants from boards other than CBSE/ICSE, Himachal, Punjab, Haryana)

  • Affidavit by father/ mother/ guardian stating if the ward has studied Punjabi in matriculation

  • Affidavit/ certificate of Punjab Resident Civil category

  • 12 Passport size photos (including photos on application cum admission form)

  • One photograph of parents, local guardians, family members

AIL LET Counselling process: Document submission, verification and admission 

The institute shortlists candidates based on their marks and rank in the merit list. Such candidates must submit the documents and certificates mentioned above to the institute. 

The counselling officials will verify the details submitted by the candidates during the application process by referring to the original documents. 

  • If the candidates fulfil the eligibility and satisfy all conditions for admission, the institute will approve the admission. 
  • To complete the admission process, such candidates will have to submit the course fee as prescribed by the institute.

exam_name: CLAT PG - Common Law Admission Test for LLM

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Consortium of NLUs has opened the CLAT PG 2025 registration on July 15, 2024. Candidates can submit the CLAT PG application form 2025 through the official website - consortiumofnlus.ac.in. The last date to submit the application form of CLAT PG 2025 is October 15, 2024. The CLAT PG 2025 application form fee is Rs 4000 for general/OBC candidates and Rs 3500 for SC/ST candidates. Candidates who fulfil the CLAT PG eligibility criteria must visit the official website and create a CLAT candidate login to register online.  The consortium had earlier issued the CLAT PG 2025 notification on July 7, 2024. It will conduct CLAT PG 2025 on December 1, 2024 from 2 pm to 4 pm in offline mode. The number of CLAT PG seats is 1373 in CLAT 2025.

The CLAT PG 2025 will be conducted at 139 CLAT PG exam centres spread across the country. Candidates who have a valid score in CLAT PG 2025 would be able to participate in the centralised CLAT 2025 counselling for admissions into LLM programmes of participating NLUs. In addition to the NLUs, CLAT 2025 scores are also accepted by 60+ private colleges. 

CLAT LLM 2025 - Test details

The national-level law entrance exam, CLAT LLM is conducted by the Consortium of National Law Universities (NLUs) in offline (pen and paper) mode. It is a common entrance test for admission into LLM programmes of participating national law universities. CLAT PG is one of the most competitive law entrance exams in India. The intensity of the competition is high owing to big number of registered candidates and the coveted status enjoyed by NLUs.

As per the exam pattern of CLAT PG 2025, the test includes MCQs from various areas of law. There are 120 questions. Each question will carry one mark and each incorrect answer will invite a penalty of -0.25 marks. Candidates should check the CLAT 2025 syllabus for PG before starting the exam preparation. For preparatory purposes, candidates can refer to the previous year's CLAT PG question papers.

Frequency

CLAT PG Is held once a year. The Consortium of NLUs conducts the CLAT PG exam in offline mode along with its undergraduate counterpart at close to 130 test centres across the country.

Purpose of CLAT PG exam

The purpose of CLAT PG exam is to admit candidates into the postgraduate LLM courses at participating NLUs. It must be noted that NLU Delhi, and NLU Meghalaya do not participate in CLAT. CNLU Patna has its own admission process for its LLM programme. 

CLAT PG exam eligibility

In order to be eligible for CLAT PG, candidates must have completed a five year or a three year LLB. The minimum passing marks is 50% for general and OBC candidates and 45% for SC and ST candidates. Final year LLB candidates are also eligible to apply provided that they submit their qualifying certificates at the time of admission.

Applicable for JAG

Indian Army will conduct Indian Army JAG recruitment through CLAT 2025 examination. The CLAT 2025 PG scores will will be used for SSC (NT) JAG entry scheme 33rd course. It is to be noted that the previous year's CLAT score is considered for recruitment of Judge Advocate General Indian Army.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The NLU consortium provides official CLAT PG 2025 eligibility criteria on its official website. The eligibility criteria of CLAT PG 2025 provides information such as qualifying exam passed, marks obtained in the qualifying exam, and age limit of candidates required before filling the CLAT 2025 application form. Only those candidates who meet the CLAT PG eligibility criteria 2025 requirements will be able to apply for the exam.

Eligibility criteria of CLAT PG 2025

  • Educational Qualification - Candidates should have completed LLB graduation (3-year LLB or 5-year integrated LLB) from any recognized institute by the Bar Council of India. 
  • Qualifying exam: All candidates must have minimum 50% marks in the qualifying exam. However, candidates belonging to the SC and ST category will be given 5% relaxation and can apply for CLAT PG 2024 with 45% marks in graduation (qualifying exam).
  • Upper age limit: There is no upper age limit.
  • Appearing in qualifying exam:  Candidates who are in their final year of the qualifying exam can also apply for the CLAT PG 2024 exam.

You may also check - Important Topics in CLAT PG 2025

application_process.html_content:
The Consortium of National Law Universities has opened the CLAT PG application form 2025 on July 15, 2024. Candidates would be able to apply online from the official website - consortiumofnlus.ac.in.  The last date to apply is October 15, 2024. The application form of CLAT LLM 2025 has to be filled out by following the steps mentioned below. 

How to fill CLAT PG application form 2025:

  • Online Registration - To register online, the candidate has to create an applicant account by entering details like name, phone number, and email id. On successful registration, a password will be generated for the new account.   
  • Filling of application form - Next fill in various sections like personal details, correspondence, and address details. Also, select the course of study.
  • Providing NLU preferences: One of the important steps when submitting the CLAT PG application form 2025 is providing NLU preferences. Candidates must provide their NLU preference list in the order of priority. They can get admission in only those NLUs which are part of their preference list.
  • Uploading of documents - In this step, candidates have to upload scanned photographs, signatures, and domicile certificates as per the format specified in the table below:

Document specifications 

DocumentImage size (maximum)Format

Photograph

500 KB

JPG

Signature

100 KB

  • Payment of application fee - After confirming the details, proceed to make payment of the application fee. The online payment options through which fees can be paid are net banking, credit, or debit cards. The CLAT PG application fee 2025 for general/OBC candidates is Rs 4000. The CLAT PG 2025 application fee for SC/ST categories is Rs 3500.

admit_card.html_content:
The Consortium of NLUs will issue the CLAT PG admit card 2025 on the official website tentatively two weeks before the exam. Candidates would be able to download the admit card through their login. The CLAT PG admit card  2025  is an important document that all candidates need to carry during the national-level exam day. Candidates must safely keep the admit card even after the exam day, as it is also required for post-exam events like counselling. 

How to download CLAT PG admit card 2025?

Candidates need to download the admit card of CLAT PG 2025 online. The consortium will not send physical copies of the CLAT PG 2025 admit card.

  • Go to the official website - consortiumofnlus.ac.in
  • Entering the registration number and password to log in
  • The admit card will be displayed on the screen for download
  • Download and take a printout of CLAT PG 2025 admit card
  • Keep safe it for future reference

How to address discrepancies in CLAT PG 2025 admit card?

It is vital for candidates to check that the details mentioned in the CLAT PG 2025 admit card such as the name is correctly spelled, the right photo is included and that the information is legible. In case it is not so, candidates need to get in touch with exam officials immediately and get the error rectified.

Details mentioned on the CLAT PG admit card

  • Name
  • Roll number
  • Date and time of CLAT PG 2024 exam
  • Name and address of exam centre
  • Exam day guidelines

Items to be carried on the exam day

On the day of exam, along with the admit card, the candidate also needs to bring with them a valid photo id proof, including Aadhaar card/PAN card/driving license/passport, etc.

You may also check - How To Prepare For CLAT PG 2025

cutoffs.html_content:
The CLAT PG 2025 cutoff is the minimum rank or score that a candidate will have to secure in order to get admission to the LLM course at any of the participating NLUs. The CLAT PG cutoff 2024 will be category-specific and released separately for the NLUs. The CLAT PG 2025 cut off would be available through the CLAT PG merit list published by the consortium.

Candidates will be required to meet the cutoff criteria (on the basis of their categories) for the applied institute to be considered for admission. Candidates failing to meet the cutoff will not be considered qualified for further admission process. 

Factors affecting CLAT PG 2025 cutoff

  • The number of candidates appearing in CLAT PG 2025
  • The performance of applicants in the exam
  • The number of applicants to the college in question
  • Number of sanctioned seats
  • The category of the candidate.

NOTE: If any of the above parameters change, the CLAT PG cutoff will also be changed.

The exam pattern of CLAT 2024 PG includes details such as the number of questions asked, mode of exam, marking scheme, question type and related information. Last year, when the Consortium revised the CLAT exam pattern, it left the CLAT PG exam pattern unchanged.

Important Points for CLAT PG 2025 exam
