faqs.question: How many students appeared for CLAT PG 2024
faqs.answer: Around 10282 candidates appeared for CLAT PG 2024 exam.

faqs.question: Is there any upper age limit for appearing in CLAT PG 2025?
faqs.answer: No, there is no upper age limit for appearing in the postgraduate exam.

faqs.question: What is the full form of CLAT PG?
faqs.answer: The full form of CLAT PG is Common Law Admission Test - Post Graduate.

faqs.question: Will CLAT PG scores used for admission to NLUs only?
faqs.answer: There are 24 NLUs that are participating institute of CLAT PG exam and use CLAT PG 2025 scores for admission purposes. In addition to this, over 60 law colleges across the country accept the CLAT LLM scores.

faqs.question: When will CLAT PG 2025 entrance exam be conducted?
faqs.answer: The offline-based CLAT PG 2025 exam will be conducted on December 1, 2024.

faqs.question: Were there any changes to the exam pattern for the last session?
faqs.answer: The consortium did not make any changes in the CLAT PG exam pattern in the last session.

faqs.question: Can candidates who haven't yet appeared in their qualifying exam still appear in CLAT PG 2025?
faqs.answer: As per the CLAT PG eligibility criteria, any candidate who will be appearing in the final LLB or any equivalent exam in April/May 2025 will be eligible to take CLAT PG 2025.

faqs.question: When will CLAT LLM application form be released?
faqs.answer: The CLAT PG 2025 application form will be released on July 15, 2024.

exam_name: LAT - Allahabad University LLB Admission Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Allahabad University has published the schedule for the seventh round of AU LAT 2024 counselling  on the official website on September 2, 2024. Candidates can register for the seventh round of AU LAT 2024 counselling from September 3-5, 2024 on ecounselling.in. The authorities published the seventh AU LAT 2024 cut-off along with the counselling schedule. The university has completed six rounds of admissions for AU LAT 2024. It had earlier declared the LAT 2024 result on July 16, 2024. The university conducted the AU LAT 2024 exam on July 1, 2024.

Allahabad University closed the LAT application form 2024 on June 12, 2024. It had opened the LAT application form 2024 in online mode on May 16, 2024. The university offers a total of 975 seats through the LAT 2024 exam in which around 10,000 candidates participate every year. Admission through LAT 2024 will be based on merit cum preference criteria. The merit list is prepared on the basis of candidates' performance in the examination.

Who could apply for AU LAT 2024?

Candidates who fulfill the LAT eligibility criteria for 2024, can apply for the examination. As per the LAT 2024 eligibility, the candidates should have completed graduation with minimum qualifying marks from a recognized university. The minimum qualifying marks are 45% for general category students and 40% for SC and ST candidates.

LAT 2024 exam will consist of 150 objective-type questions. Each correct response carries 2 marks. there is no negative marking. Questions in the examination are asked from the sections mentioned below.

1) Language Comprehension 

2) General Awareness and Current Affairs

3) Reasoning, Mental Ability and 

4) Legal Aptitude.

The university and its affiliated law school will offer a combined intake of 975 seats through LAT. The number of seats in the course is 375 for the Faculty of Law (University of Allahabad), 300 for C.M.P. Degree College, and 300 for Allahabad Degree College (A.D.C.). Candidates shortlisted on the basis of the LAT exam will be called for counselling and seat allotment process which is held in multiple rounds.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates appearing for the 3-year LLB admission test of Allahabad University must fulfil the LAT 2024 eligibility criteria. The eligibility criteria of LAT 2024 is given in terms of educational qualification and minimum qualifying marks. Any candidate who is found to be not complying with the prescribed LAT eligibility criteria,  his/her candidature can be cancelled at any stage of the admission process.

LAT eligibility criteria 2024

  • Educational qualification - The applicant must hold a graduate degree in any discipline from a recognized university or equivalent institute. 
  • Candidates appearing in the qualifying exam are also eligible to appear in LAT 2024. However, such candidates will need to provide proof of qualification at the time of admission or counselling process.
  • Minimum Qualifying Marks - The minimum aggregate marks in the qualifying exam is 45% for general, 40% for SC/ST, and 42% for OBC categories.

application_process.html_content:
Allahabad University had released the LAT application form 2024 online on its official website on May 16, 2024. The application form of LAT 2024 is released for admission to 3-year LLB program offered by the university. The deadline to submit the LAT 2024 application form was June 12, 2024. It is recommended that candidates use only genuine and verifiable information when filling out the LAT application form, as use of false and misleading information can lead to disqualification.

Document required for filling LAT application form

To fill the application form in a smooth and error-free manner, candidates are advised to keep the following documents ready.  

  • Mark sheets of 10th and 12th class  

  • Date of birth certificate as proof of age 

  • Income certificate of parents 

  • Resident certificate

  • Caste certificate (if seeking admission under reserved categories)

How to fill LAT application form 2024?

  • Registration: Click on the registration link to access the registration form. Enter details like name, mobile number, valid email id and other details as requested to create an applicant account. 

  • Fill the form: Log-in to the newly created applicant account and fill in academic, personal and academic details, etc. 

  • Pay the application fee: The candidate has to next pay the application fee of Rs. 800 (SC/ST/PH candidates need to pay only Rs. 400) in online mode. 

  • Submit the form: After paying the fee, submit the form and take a printout of the completed application form.

Important Notes

  • Those filling the application form while also appearing in the qualifying exam must note that they have to complete the graduation with minimum marks before the counselling and seat allotment process. Such candidates will need to show the passing certificate at the time of admission, failing which, their candidature will be cancelled.

  • NRIs, Foreign Nationals, or those who have graduated from foreign universities do not have to fill the application form. The university will conduct a separate admission and application process for such candidates of which the details will be communicated by the Faculty of Law. 

  • Candidates should fill in all the details in the application form and support it with the requisite documents. Incomplete applications will be outrightly rejected.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Candidates appearing for the LAT 2024 can go through the given LAT preparation tips to give edge to their preparation: 

  • First, become familiar with the LAT exam pattern and syllabus. The exam pattern will tell the candidate how to prepare, for instance, since LAT includes objective type questions, so one should focus more on objective questions rather than getting stuck on subjective questions during exam preparation. Meanwhile, the syllabus will tell what to prepare and what to ignore.
  • The candidate may mark topics, say, as important, neutral and less important, as this will enable him or her to invest their energies on scoring topics. 
  • Regular practice and revision is the key, so integrate them into your process. Divide the course into a certain number of blocks, and assign a specific time period to each of the blocks. Try to follow the time-table. Also, do timely revision. 
  • Practice last years' question papers. Take mock-test sessions wherein you finish a question paper within the same time duration as that of the exam. Many candidates mistake simply skimming through the sample papers instead of practising them. But, solving these question papers will not only teach candidates how to solve tricky questions but will also habituate them to the pattern, which can aid in time management.

admit_card.html_content:
The exam conducting body released the LAT 2024 admit card in online mode. The LAT 2024 admit card is available for download at the registration portal of AU Pravesh. The admit card of LAT 2024 is an important document for sitting in the entrance exam, it carries vital details like the name and roll number of the candidate, date and time of the exam, and exam name and address. 

How to download LAT Admit Card 2024?

  • Click on the relevant link
  • Enter username and password
  • The admit card will be displayed on screen
  • Check that the details mentioned on it are correct and legible
  • Download and take a printout

In case there is any discrepancy in the admit card like the name is incorrectly spelt, get in touch with exam officials and get it rectified asap.

Details mentioned on LAT Admit Card 2024

  • Name of the candidate 

  • Name of the candidate’s father 

  • Roll number 

  • Date of Birth 

  • Date and time of exam

  • Name and address of allotted exam centre 

  • Reporting time 

  • Application number 

  • Category under which admission is sought

  • Programme applied for admission 

  • Candidate's photograph 

  • Exam day instructions

counselling_process.html_content:
Allahabad University is conducting LAT 2024 counselling in online mode. The authorities published the schedule for the seventh round of AU LAT 2024 admissions on the official website- ecounselling.in. The LAT 2024 couneslling 2024 registration window is open from September 3-5, 2024 for the seventh round of counselling. Candidates who have cleared the AU LAT 2024 cut-off can attend the counselling session to finalize their admissions into the university’s three-year L.L.B programme. Those securing more marks than the LAT cut off 2024 have to participate in the counselling process by registering for the same. In case of offline counselling, candidates must be physically present at the specified counselling venue on the specified date and time along with all the requisite documents. 

Documents Required at the time of Counselling 

  • Aadhar Card
  • Marksheet of qualifying exam
  • Reservation certificates wherever applicable
  • Transfer Certificate/Migration Certificate

Important notes 

  • Candidates who physically attend the counselling session, fulfil all the eligibility criteria, furnish the requisite documents, and successfully undergo the document verification procedure will be allotted a seat in the university for the three-year L.L.B programme. 

  • Those candidates who are found to be not eligible for admissions on the counselling day will be denied admissions.

  • After the counselling round, candidates have to submit the fees and fulfil other admission-related procedures to finalize their admissions into the university.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
By consulting the exam pattern of LAT 2024 the applicant will get insights into the exam, like the type of questions asked, marking scheme, exam duration, sections and topics covered, etc. This information can be used for aligning one's preparation with exam requirements, which would increase the chances of success.  

LAT 2024 Exam Pattern 

ParticularsDetails

Type of Exam

Objective based (MCQs)

Duration of exam

2 hours

Sections  


Part 1 - Language Comprehension  

Part 2 -  General Awareness and Current Affairs   questions)

Part 3 -  Reasoning, Mental Ability and Legal Aptitude  (50 questions)


Total number of questions

  • A total of 150 questions will be asked, 50 each from the three sections

Marking scheme

  • Each MCQ will carry two marks
  • There is no negative marking

Maximum marks


300

exam_name: ILSAT - ICFAI Law School Admission Test
conducting_body: ICFAI Foundation for Higher Education, Hyderabad

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
ICFAI Law School Hyderabad has opened the ILSAT 2025 application form in online mode for both phases of the exam. Candidates an apply online from the official website - ifheindia.org. The deadline to apply for ILSAT 2025 is December 14, 2024 for the first phase and April 5, 2025 for the second phase. The university will conduct the ILSAT 2025 Phase 1 on December 15, 2024 and ILSAT 2025 Phase 2 on April 6, 2025. The complete schedule for ILSAT 2025 is available on the official website. ICFAI Law School Hyderabad will declare the result of the ILSAT 2025 exam on December 26 and April 10 for the first and second phase respectively.

ICFAI Law School Hyderabd conducts the ICFAI Law School Admission Test 2025 for admission into its 5-year integrated LLB programmes. Candidates may apply for ILSAT 2025 by paying Rs 1000 as a registration fee. The institute offers BBA-LLB(Hons.) / BA-LLB(Hons.) and LLM courses.  The ILSAT 2025 will be conducted in online mode for a duration of 2 hours. In the test paper, the candidates will be asked 125 objective-type questions from sections like English, Logical reasoning, Legal reasoning, GK  and analytical reasoning. 

The institute also accepts CLAT and LSAT India scores for admission to UG and PG law programmes. The CLAT 2025 is scheduled to be conducted on December 1, 2024. Meanwhile, LSAT India 2025 will be conducted in two phases tenatively in January 2025 and May 2025.

highlights.value: ICFAI Foundation for Higher Education, Hyderabad

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
To appear in ILSAT 2025, candidates must meet the prescribed eligibility criteria. ILSAT 2025 eligibility criteria includes the minimum academic qualifications, minimum passing marks and age limit required to appear in the entrance test.  The conducting body has prescribed the following eligibility criteria for BA LLB(Hons.) and BBA LLB(Hons.).

  • Educational Qualification - Candidates should have passed class 12th in English medium.
  • Minimum required marks -  Candidates must have passed the qualifying exam with at least 50% marks. 
  • Age limit: Candidates appearing for the exam must not be more than 21 years as on the date specified by the university.

Further, Candidates appearing in the class 12th exam are also eligible to apply for ILSAT 2025. However, admission of such candidates will be subject to securing minimum marks in the qualifying exam.

application_process.html_content:
ICFAI Law School has opened the ILSAT 2025 application form in September 2024 in online mode for both phases of the exam. Candidates can apply online from the official website. The deadline to submit the ILSAT application form 2025 for the first phase is December 14, 2024. For the second phase, candidates can register till April 5, 2025. Candidates must also pay an ILSAT 2025 registration fee of Rs 1000 to complete the application form.

According to ILSAT 2025 application process, the law aspirants have to fill in their details online, upload their passport-sized colour photograph and submit the application along with the prescribed application which could be paid using Credit/ Debit card (Visa/Master Card/Internet Banking) through the secure internet payment gateway.

Candidates applying in offline mode are required to download the ILSAT application form, fill it out carefully. Candidates must also attach a Demand Draft of Rs 1000 in favour of "IFHE-Prospectus Fee A/c ILSAT 2025", payable at Hyderabad. The application form must be sent to the Admissions Office, through speed post or courier to the following address given below-

IFHE Admissions Office,
# 65, Nagarjuna Hills, Punjagutta,
Hyderabad - 82
Telangana State

preparation_tips.html_content: N/A

admit_card.html_content:
ICFAI Law School will release the ILSAT 2025 admit card in online mode a few days before the exam. Candidates were able to download the admit card of ILSAT 2025 by logging into the admission portal of the institute. The admit card of ILSAT 2025 will inform about the exam date, exam centre name and address, roll number of the candidates and other important details. 

How to download ILSAT 2025 admit card?

  • Login into the ILSAT registered account using registered ID and date of birth.
  • Click on admit card link
  • ILSAT admit card will be displayed in PDF.
  • Download and take a print out for future reference. 

ILSAT 2025 exam day guidelines

  • ILSAT admit card 2025 is a must to take the exam centre; or else the candidate will not be allowed to enter the exam hall.

  • Also, along with the admit card, bring along a valid photo identification proof; remember that the name mentioned on the ID must be the same as the one given at the time of ILSAT 2025 registration.

  • Report at the ILSAT 2025 exam centre at least 45 minutes before the commencement of the exam.

  • Items like written material, paper, electronic devices etc are not allowed inside the exam hall.

counselling_process.html_content:
The university will conduct the counselling of ILSAT 2025 after the declaration of result. ILSAT 2025 counselling will include steps like personal interview, provisional admission, document submission etc. The step-wise ILSAT counselling process is explained below.

  • Reporting and registration for personal interview: Candidates need to report at the prescribed venue for provisional admissions along with original documents and photocopies on the designated day.
  • LSAT counselling 2025 - Provisional admission: The personal interview will be conducted for shortlisted candidates based on their ILSAT merit ranks. Candidates, after getting the approval for provisional admission will have to report for registration along with relevant origin documents and photocopies. Remember that provisional admission is subject to the payment of course fee and successful verification of documents.
  • ILSAT 2025 counselling - Document submission: The candidate participating in document verification will have to submit originals as well as self-attested copies to admission officials. The original documents will be returned to the candidate within a week, after due verification. If during document verification, if any candidate is found to be using misleading data, he/she stands to be disqualified.

Documents required for ILSAT counselling 2025

  • Class X & XI mark sheets and certificates.

  • Birth certificate

  • Transfer/migration certificate

  • Completion certificate of qualifying exam

  • Any other as prescribed

Helpdesk information

IFHE Admissions Office,

65, Nagarjuna Hills, Punjagutta,

Hyderabad - 82, Telangana State,

Toll Free: 1800-599-0767

E-mail: lawadmissions@ifheindia.org

As per the ILSAT 2025 exam pattern, there will be 125 multiple-choice questions in the test paper and candidates will be given 2-hours to attempt the test. 

The online exam will test candidates on five subject areas namely logical reasoning, legal reasoning, general knowledge, current affairs and analytical reasoning. Candidates' responses to a question with the correct answer will be awarded one mark while for any wrong answer no marks will be deducted.

faqs.answer: The ILSAT paper will consist of 125 multiple choice type questions. The questions will be asked from topics such as legal aptitude, maths, reasoning, English etc.

faqs.answer: As per the dates released by the institute, the BA LLB(Hons.) and BBA LLB(Hons.) classes usually commence from July 31 onwards.

faqs.question: Can I apply for ILSAT 2024 in offline mode?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can apply in offline mode. The offline application form can be downloaded from the official website of the institute and submitted to the institute by post.

faqs.question: What law courses are offered by ICFAI Law School Hyderabad?
faqs.answer: The ICFAI Law School Hyderabad offers BA LLB(Hons.) and BBA LLB(Hons.) programmes at the undergraduate level. At postgraduate level, the institute offers LLM course.

exam_name: MDU LLB - MDU LLB Entrance Exam

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
MDU LLB 2024: The MDU BA LLB entrance exam 2024 and the MDU 3-year LLB exam will be conducted for admissions to BA LLB and LLB courses at Maharshi Dayanand University. The MDU BA LLB 2024 application window was open from May 24 to June 8, 2024. The MDU BA  LLB 2024 entrance exam will be conducted on June 20, 2024. The MDU LLB entrance exam 2024 will be conducted in offline mode. The application process of MDU LLB 2024 is carried out online through the official website - mdu.ac.in. The entrance exam question paper of MDU LLB 2024 has questions on Legal aptitude, Reasoning, General English, General Hindi and General Knowledge. The exam is conducted for a duration of 75 minutes. 

Students are given admission to BA LLB and LLB courses at MDU, Rohtak on the basis of merit. The admission authorities of the university will consider the scores of candidates in the entrance examination for admissions. There are a total of 120 seats available for admission in each course. The university will prepare a provisional merit list based on the scores of candidates in the MDU LLB entrance exam.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The university releases the MDU LLB 2024 eligibility criteria for both BA LLB and LLB course. The eligibility criteria of MDU LLB 2024 are released in online mode through the official brochure. Candidates must note that only those applicants will be considered for  admissions who fulfill the eligibility criteria specified by the authorities. The detailed eligibility criteria of MDU BA LLB and LLB 2024 has been given below:

Eligibility criteria for BA LLB

  • Candidates must have passed their class 12 from a recognized board.

  • Candidates must have secured minimum 45% aggregate marks in their class 12.

  • SC/ST/ Blind/ Visually and Differently Abled candidates will be required to score at least 42.75% in their qualifying examination.

Eligibility criteria for LLB

  • Candidates must have completed their graduation from a recognized university.

  • General and OBC category candidates must have secured minimum 45% aggregate scores in the qualifying examination.

  • SC/ST/Blind/Disabled category candidates are given a relaxation of 2.25% and they are required to score a minimum of 42.75% marks in their graduation.

application_process.html_content:
The university  released the MDU BA LLB 2024 application form on May 24, 2024. Interested candidates could complete their MDU BA LLB registration 2024 till June 8, 2024. Interested candidates can fill the MDU LLB application form 2024 within the specified deadline. The detailed application process of MDU LLB has been given below:

How to fill MDU LLB 2024 application form?

  • Visit the official website of MDU LLB 2024.

  • Click on the ‘new registration’ tab.

  • Enter all the basic details required for registration like name, mobile number, email id etc.

  • Next, candidates need to login to the application portal and fill in the detailed application form of MDU LLB 2024 with details like academic details, personal details and communication details.

  • Candidates are also required to upload scanned copies of their photograph and signature.

  • The last step of the MDU LLB application process is application fee payment.

  • After making the application fee payment, candidates are advised to download the application confirmation page for future reference.

preparation_tips.html_content: N/A

admit_card.html_content:
Candidates must note that the admit card of MDU LLB 2024 is a mandatory document  that candidates require to get entry inside the exam centre. The admit card of MDU LLB comprises of important details like name of the candidate, course applied for, date and time of examination, exam centre, exam day instructions etc. The step by step process to download the MDU LLB admit card 2024 has been given below:

  • Open the official website of MDU: mdu.ac.in

  • Click on the “admit card” link on the homepage.

  • Enter your username and password that was generated at the time of filling the  application form.

  • Upon successful entry of login details, the admit card of MDU LLB 2024 will be displayed on the screen.

  • Check all the details given on the MDU LLB admit card 2024 carefully.

  • Download and take a printout of the MDU LLB 2024 admit card for use on the day of exam.

exam_name: CULET - Calcutta University Law Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Calcutta University Law Entrance Exam (CULET) 2024: Calcutta University has issued the fourth CU BA LLB 2024 admission slip on September 20, 2024. Candidates can download the admission slip from the official website,  caluniv.ac.in. The fourth round of Calcutta University BA LLB 2024 admissions will be conducted from September 21-23, 2024 for admissions into government colleges only. The fifth round of CU BA LLB 2024 admissions will be conducted from September 24-27 for admissions into self-financing colleges.  The university had earlier completed three rounds of counselling. The Calcutta University law entrance exam was conducted on August 18, 2024 in offline mode. The Calcutta University BA LLB admissions 2024 are done based on scores in the CULET 2024 entrance test. Earlier, the university closed the CULET 2024 application form on August 2, 2024. It had opened the application form in online mode on July 19, 2024. 

What is Calcutta University BA LLB Entrance Exam?

The Calccuta University BA LLB entrance exam or CULET is an entrance test conducted once every year. The motive of the exam is to carry out BA LLB admissions in Calcutta University and all other affiliated law colleges. The Calcutta University BA LLB entrance  exam is conducted in offline mode and the CULET 2024 syllabus comprises of four subjects - General English, General Awareness/Current Affairs, General Mathematics and Reasoning (Verbal & Non-verbal). The CULET exam comprises of multiple-choice questions and there is no negative marking. The entrance exam comprises of 100 questions and candidates and candidates will be given a time of 2.5 hours to complete the exam. A total of 2,166 seats are available for admissions through CULET 2024 exams.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Calcutta University has prescribed the CULET 2024 eligibility criteria 2024 through the official admission notification. Candidates who have completed their class 12 are eligible to apply for Calcutta University BA LLB entrance exam. The authorities have also specified the minimum marks required in class 12 to appear for CULET 2024. The detailed eligibility criteria of the Calcutta University BA LLB entrance exam 2024 has been given below:

CULET 2024 Eligibility Criteria

  • Candidates must have completed their 10+2 or its equivalent from the board recognized by the University of Calcutta

  • General category must have scored minimum 45% marks in the best four subjects. (excluding environmental studies of WBCHSE). SC/ST category  candidates must secure minimum 40% marks.

  • Candidates from boards other than WBCHSE, ISC,CBSE, Rabindra Mukto Vidyalaya and NIOS must obtain “Equivalence Certificate” from the office of the Registrar, (Equivalence Section) University of Calcutta, 87/1, College Street, Kolkata-700073 by a written application in plain paper with a relevant photocopy of a 10+2 Mark Sheet. Certificate will be required at the time of admission.

application_process.html_content:
The Calcutta University BA LLB 2024 application form has been closed on August 2, 2024. Candidates can fill the CULET 2024 application form through the official website - caluniv.ac.in. The university had opened the CU BA LLB 2024 application form on July 19, 2024. The Calcutta University BA LLB application fee for general and EWS categories is Rs 500, while SC, ST and PwD categories need to pay Rs 250 as registration fee. The step-by-step process to fill the application form has been mentioned below:

Steps to fill CULET 2024 application form

  • Log on to caluniv.ac.in and click on the "BA LLB Admission Notice 2024-25" link.
  • Click on the "Click here to apply" button and next click on "new applicant" link.
  • Candidates will be directed to the registration form where they must fill all required details like name, password, mobile number etc.
  • Next, candidates must login to the candidate portal using their mobile number and password.
  • Fill in the detailed application form with required personal, academic and communication information.
  • Candidates will also be required to pay the registration fee in their preferred mode of online payment.
  • Click on "final submission" and take a copy of the application confirmation page for future reference.

exam_name: AP PGLCET - Andhra Pradesh Post Graduate Law Common Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
APSCHE has declared the AP PGLCET 2024 results in online mode on June 27, 2024. Candidates can check their AP PGLCET results 2024 online from the official website - cets.apsche.ap.gov.in. Earlier, it opened the AP PGLCET objection window against the AP PGLCET provisional answer key from June 11 till June 12 up to 5 PM.  The authorities published the AP PGLCET preliminary answer key on June 10, 2024. Earlier, Acharya Nagarjuna University conducted AP PGLCET 2024 on June 9, 2024, on behalf of APSCHE in online mode.

APSCHE had closed the AP PGLCET application form 2024 on May 29, 2024 with a late fees of Rs 3000 by visiting The AP PGLCET 2024 application fees was Rs 1000, Rs 950, and Rs 900 for OC, BC and ST/ST categories.  Earlier, APSCHE had announced the AP PGLCET 2024 exam date through an official notification. AP PGLCET 2024 will be conducted on June 9, 2024. Through AP PGLCET 2024 candidates will be admitted into LLM course at various participating colleges in the state of Andhra Pradesh. The exam is held in online mode. Candidates are required to submit their applications online and complete the registration process. The exam will be in various exam centres in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. A total of 13 law colleges and universities will participate in the common admission process through AP PGLCET 2024.

AP PGLCET 2024 Test details

The PGLCET tests the candidate's knowledge in different areas of law. It covers topics such as constitutional law, jurisprudence, family law, torts and more. The exam consists of 120 multiple choice questions that candidates have to attempt in a duration of 90 minutes. Shorlisted candidates from the exam will be eligible to participate in the centralised counselling and seat allotment process conducted by APSCHE.

highlights.value: Andhra Pradesh Post Graduate Law Common Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates aspiring to appear for the AP PGLCET 2024 must ensure they meet the eligibility criteria prescribed by APSCHE. The AP PGLCET 2024 eligibility criteria specify requirements pertaining to academic qualifications, minimum passing marks, age limit and resident status. If a candidate is found to be not confirming to these requirements then their candidature is likely to be rejected even if they cleared the exam.

AP PGLCET Eligibility Criteria 2024

ParticularsDetails
Educational QualificationLLB graduate

Final year candidates can also apply
Minimum Marks

General / OBC - 50%

SC/ST - 45%

Age LimitNo age limit

As described in the above table the minimum educational qualification required is a either a 5-year LLB or a 3-year LLB. Candidates appearing for their final year exams are also eligible to apply.

Candidate aspiring to apply under the category of local candidates must ensure they meet the conditions laid down in this regard. Telangana candidates who migrated from Telangana to Andhra Pradesh within 5 years starting from June 2, 2014 will be considered as local candidates.

Only Indian nationals are eligible to apply. However, foreign candidates can also apply provided that they confirm to admissions rules and guidelines of individual universities.

application_process.html_content:
The AP PGLCET application form 2024 was released in online mode on March 26, 2024. Candidates who meet the AP PGLCET eligibility criteria could fill the application form by registering themselves at the examination portal. The deadline to submit the AP PGLCET application form 2024 with late fee was May 29, 2024.

In order to fill out the application form, the candidate needs to first pay the application fee, get registered and fill out the form. While filling out the AP PGLCET 2024 application form, candidates will need to provide the details such as personal information, educational qualification and communication details, upload documents and finally submit the application form. The application process 

How to fill AP PGLCET application form 2024

Fee Payment

  • Visit the official website 
  • Click on new registration link 
  • Enter your name, date of birth, contact number, programme of study to complete initial registration
  • Finally the candidate has to pay the application fee using one of the online mode: net banking, credit, and debit card.
  • There is also provision to make cash payment by reporting at AP ONLINE centres.
  • If the payment is successful, a payment ID will be generated which must be retained for future admission events.

AP PGLCET Application Form Fees

Filling of AP PGLCET 2024 application form

The application form can be filled only post payment of the application fee.

  •  The AP PGLCET 2024 application form will have various fields like personal, academic and contact details.
  • The form will also have a section where the candidates must enter their places of study in the last seven years, based on which local area of the candidate will be determined.
  • Next the programme of study is to be selected  i.e. LLM. 
  • Candidates must also specify the desired test centre. A maximum of two test centres in the order of priority can be selected.    
  • Applicants must also upload scanned copies of photograph and signature as per the specification prescribed.

  • Upon successful submission after completion of above steps, registration number will be displayed on the screen. Note it down
  • Take a printout of the completed application form
  • Candidates will be required to submit the print out at the test centre. For further references after the exam, candidates can use the registration number.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Candidates can refer to the following AP PGLCET 2024 preparation tips to hone their preparation and improve their chances of success in the exam. 

  • Thoroughly go through the exam pattern of AP PGLCET 2024 to learn about the structure and nature of the exam, including the number and type of questions, duration of the exam, topics covered, and marking scheme. 
  • Follow the official syllabus,  and build good conceptual understanding of different topics. as questions in the paper will be based on the syllabus only.
  • Practice previous years' AP PGCLET question papers and sample papers. It will help build speed, improve problem-solving ability and understand concepts better. 
  • Take mock tests, as they are the best tools to test exam readiness and figure out problem areas. Plug the holes as you go along. The more mock tests a candidate takes, the more confident they will feel. Time management can also be learned by taking mock tests.

admit_card.html_content:
The AP PGLCET 2024 admit card was released in online mode on June 3, 2024. Successfully registered candidates could download the admit card by logging into their registered accounts. The admit card is a mandatory document which candidates must carry to the exam hall. 

The AP PGLCET admit card will contain details like the candidate's name and roll number, AP PGLCET exam centre 2024, and the date and time of the exam. In addition, it will also contain exam-day guidelines that the candidate ought to follow.  

How to download AP PGLCET 2024 Admit Card

  • Go to the official website.
  • Click on the admit card link
  • A login window will open; enter your payment reference ID, qualifying examination hall ticket number, registration number, DoB, and mobile number.
  • The admit card will be displayed on screen.
  • Download and take a printout of the admit card.

counselling_process.html_content:
Candidates who have cleared AP PGLCET 2024 will be eligible to participate in the counselling process by registering at - lawcet-sche.aptonline.in. It is the last stage of the admissions process. Candidates who qualify for ranking will be eligible to participate in the counselling process. 

As part of the process, candidates will be required to register and provide their college preferences. The seats will be allotted based on the order of preference and the rank obtained by the candidates. 

Given below are important steps in the AP PGLCET 2024 counselling process-

  1. Online registration
  2. Certification verification
  3. Web option
  4. Change in web option (Optional for the candidates)
  5. Seat allotment 
  6. Self-reporting at colleges by the candidates and fee payment

Aspiring candidates must make themselves familiar with the AP PGLCET exam pattern 2024. Carefully studying these elements will help candidates prepare well for the exam.

exam_name: IILET - Indore Institute of Law Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Indore Institute of Law conducts the IILET exam 2024 in offline mode accross 15 cities in India. The Indore Institute of Law (IIL) is also a CLAT affiliated institute. The institute offers BBA LLB with Global & Transnational Studies, BA LLB(Hons.) and BBA LLB (Hons.) programmes on the basis of IILET, CLAT and LSAT India scores. IIL also offers direct admissions on the basis 12th percentage.  

IILET is an offline test. The paper consists of 150 MCQs on 5 major topics- English, general knowledge and current affairs, elementary mathematics, legal aptitude and logical reasoning. As per the eligibility criteria of IILET, candidates must score at least 45% (40% for reserved categories) in 10+2 level for admission to the law programmes of the institute. Candidates belonging to SC and ST category must score at least 40% marks in the qualifying exam.

Candidates what want to take admission in IIL will need to fill the admissions application form of the IILET 2024 in online mode. Admissions to the institute will be offered on the basis of merit. The seats offered by the university will be filled in the following order.

  • 30% seats will be filled on the basis of entrance test CLAT or LSAT India 2024.
  • 70% seats will be offered directly on the basis of Class 12th percentage.

highlights.value: Indore Institute of Law Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates who want to apply for admission to the Indore Institute of Law must fulfill the eligibility criteria prescribed by the institute. The eligibility criteria for IILET 2024 are mentioned below.

Educational Qualification- Candidates must have passed 10+2 or an equivalent examination from a recognized board. 

In the qualifying exam (Class 12th), the candidate must score at least 45% marks. SC and ST category candidates must score at least 40% marks.

Candidates appearing in the qualifying exam/awaiting their results are also eligible for IILET 2024. However, such candidates, if selected, will have to produce evidence of their passing the qualifying examination at the time of admission.

Age Bar - There is no age limit for candidates to apply for IILET 2024.

application_process.html_content:
The IILET application form will be released by the institute in offline and online mode. In order to fill the IILET application form 2024, candidates will have to provide their personal information such as name, father's name, mother's name, category, occupation, contact information, educational qualification and other details.

Candidates will also have to upload a recent passport size photo in the prescribed format.

The IILET application fee is Rs 1100/- for B.A.LL.B.(Hons.), B.B.A. LL.B.(Hons.) and Rs 2100/- for B.B.A.LL.B (Hons.) with Global and Transnational Studies. Candidates will have the application fee using a debit card, credit card or net banking facility.

preparation_tips.html_content: N/A

admit_card.html_content: The admit card will be available at the official website and candidates will have to download it by logging into their registered accounts. The IILET 2024 admit card will contain all important details related to the exam such as exam centre, city, exam timings, instructions, roll number, application number etc. Being a hall ticket, It will be mandatory for candidates to carry the IILET 2024 admit card to the exam centre as it will be used for the verification process.

counselling_process.html_content: N/A

Indore Institute of Law's IILET will be conducted in online mode. The test pattern of IILET is similar to CLAT exam pattern. IILET 2024 will be conducted in offline mode and 150 multiple-choice questions will be asked in the test paper. The detailed exam pattern is given below in a table.

exam_name: TS PGLCET - Telangana State Post Graduate Law Common Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Telangana Council of Higher Education has announced the rescheduled TS PGLCET counselling dates on the official website - lawcetadm.tsche.ac.in. The list of verified candidates eligible for further counselling process has been published on September 25, 2024. The TS PGLCET 2024 web option filling will open from September 26-27. Earlier, the TS PGLCET 2024 counselling registration closed on September 24, 2024. TGHE declared the TS PGLCET result 2024 on June 13, 2024. Candidates can download the result from the official website - lawcet.tsche.ac.in. Along with the results, the authorities also published the TS PGLCET 2024 toppers list. Peri Bala Sai Vishnu Vardhan has secured the first rank in TS PGLCET 2024 with 76 marks. The minimum qualifying marks for general and OBC candidates in TS PGLCET is 25% to be eligible to register for TS PGLCET 2024 counselling. There is no minimum qualifying marks prescribed for SC/ST candidates. Osmania University had  conducted TS PGLCET 2024 on June 3, 2024 on behalf of the Telangana State Council of Higher Education (TSCHE). Earlier, TSCHE closed the TS PGLCET application form on May 25, 2024 with a late fee of Rs 4000. 

The authorities had opened the TS PGLCET 2024 application form on March 1, 2024. It had earlier released a detailed notification on its website regarding the TS LAWCET exam date and other important dates.  The last date to fill the TS PGLCET application form without late fee was earlier extended till May 4, 2024. Candidates were allowed to apply for TS PGLCET 2024 by paying a late fee that increases with time from Rs 500 till Rs 4000 till the final deadline.

Telangana State Post Graduate Law Common Entrance Test or TS PGLCET is a law entrance exam to conduct LLM admissions in participating colleges in Telangana. TS PGLCET is accepted by over 30 law colleges and universities in Telangana. These law colleges offer around 750 seats in the LLM programme. 

TS PGLCET 2024 exam details 

The online-based, TS PGLCET 2024 will be of 90-minute duration. The question paper of TS PGLCET 2024 will have 120 objective-type questions, each carrying one mark. The topics in the syllabus for TS PGLCET are derived from various subjects of law such as Jurisprudence, Constitutional Law, Public International Law, Mercantile law, Crimes and Torts, IPR and Labour Laws.

The result of TS PGLCET 2024 will be released online at lawcet.tsche.ac.in. Scores obtained by the candidate in the exam will be used to prepare TS PGLCET merit lists, which will be used to shortlist candidates for counselling and seat allotment.

highlights.value: Telangana State Post Graduate Law Common Entrance Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Telangana State Council of Higher Education (TSCHE) prescribes the eligibility criteria of TS PGLCET 2024 for admission to the LLM programme offered by participating colleges. The eligibility requirements would pertain to minimum qualifications, age limit domicile and other such requirements the candidate has to fulfil for admission. 

TS PGLCET Eligibility Criteria 2024

ParticularsDetails
Academic Qualification3-year LLB/5-year LLB
Final year candidates can also apply
Age LimitNo age limit

As listed in the above table, candidates must have cleared a 3-year LLB or a 5-year LLB in order to be eligible for LLM. Final year students are also eligible to apply provided that they submit their qualifying certificates at the time of admission.  There is no age limit. Candidates also need to satisfy domicile requirements if they are applying under local candidate category. 

General and OBC candidate are required to score at least 25 % in TS PGLCET 2024 entrance exam to be considered for ranking. However, there is no such stipulation for SC and ST candidates.

Tie Breaker Rule

In case of a tie in total marks, the marks obtained in Part-A of the exam will be considered for deciding the rank. If the tie persists candidates may be bracketed together for the purpose of ranking and senior candidates (by age) may be given first preference.

application_process.html_content:
The application window of TS PGLCET 2024 has been closed. Earlier, TSCHE released the TS PGLCET 2024 application form on March 1, 2024. Candidates could register online at lawcet.tsche.ac.in. Such candidates who met the prescribed eligibility criteria could duly fill out the TS PGLCET application form and submit it before the specified deadline. The last date to submit the TS PGLCET application form with a late fee was May 25, 2024.  As part of the application process, the candidate needed to first get registered and pay the application fee, post which the application form can be filled out.  

How to fill TS PGLCET 2024 application form?

  • Registration and payment of application fee - The fee can be paid in both online and offline mode. Online payment can be made using net banking, credit or debit cards. For making offline payments, one needs to go to the TS online centres. 
  • Check payment status - If the payment is successful, the payment status will be updated in the application portal. 
  • Fill the form: In this step, the candidate will be required to fill in personal, academic and contact details. 
  • Select exam centre: A maximum of three choices is allowed; enter the options in the order of priority. 
  • Upload documents - Photograph and signature would have to be uploaded as per the prescribed format. 
  • Submission of application form

counselling_process.html_content:
The TS PGLCET 2024 verified candidates list has been published on September 25, 2024 on the official website - lawcetadm.tsche.ac.in. The shortlisted candidates can start exercising the web options for phase 1 of TS PGLCET admissions from September 26-27. Candidates will have to register for web options using the counselling registration number on the official website. The TS PGLCET 2024 counselling is conducted in online mode. Candidates who have a valid score in TS PGLCET 2024 exam are eligible to appear in the counselling. 

 The TS PGLCET counselling is the last stage of the admission process during which around 30 law colleges will come together to offer approximately 750 seats.

TS PGLCET 2024 counselling would comprise steps such as exercising web options, entering and locking of choices, and seat allotment. The allotment of seats will be based on the merit rank of the candidate and the options opted for by the candidate.

During counselling, document verification will be conducted. It is mandatory for all candidates to successfully complete the process, or else they will not be considered for admission.

exam_name: ACLAT - Alliance University Common Law Admission Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Alliance Common Law Admission Test commonly known ACLAT is an entrance exam conducted by Alliance University, Bangalore for admissions to one-year LLM course. Candidates who have completed their LLB graduation with at least 45% aggregate marks (40% for reserved category candidates) are eligible to apply for ACLAT 2024.

The ACLAT 2024 application form has been released in online mode. The last date to submit the ACLAT 2024 application form will be notified later. Candidates may register and submit the application form at the official admission portal of the university. The ACLAT 2024 application fee is Rs 1000 for Indian candidates, foreign nationals have to pay Rs. $50 as application fee.

The Alliance Common Law Admission Test (ACLAT) is a two-hour duration paper that will have 200 questions of one mark each. The Alliance University follows a negative marking scheme where 0.25 marks for every wrong answer will be deducted from the total score.

Based on the ACLAT results, a rank list will be published, which will be the basis for the Personal Interview round, upon which a final merit list will be announced. This year, Alliance University is offering 120 seats in the LLM programme.

highlights.value: Alliance University Common Law Admission Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The Eligibility Criteria of ACLAT 2024 mentions the minimum academic qualification and age bar required to appear in the test and take admission to the LLM programme. Only after fulfilling the eligibility criteria of ACLAT, candidates should fill the application form. the candidature of ineligible candidates will be rejected. The ACLAT 2024 eligibility criteria are mentioned below.

  • The candidate should have completed 3-year LLB or 5-year integrated LLB graduation with at least 45% marks (40% in case of reserved category candidates), from a university recognized by Bar Council of India.

application_process.html_content:
Alliance University has released the application form for ACLAT 2024 in online mode. Eligible candidates may register for ACLAT 2024 by proving their personal details, educational qualifications, communication details etc. Candidates should fill the ACLAT application form 2024 withiin the specified timeline.

Candidates are advised to fill in all the details carefully as no rectifications could be possible once the form has been submitted. After successful filling of the application form for 2024, candidates will be required to remit a prescribed application fee using the available payment options. The ACLAT application fee is Rs. 1000 and can be paid using Credit Card/Debit Card/Net Banking. 

Candidates who want to fill the application form of ACLAT 2024 in offline mode, will be required to send the filled form at the address given below -

exam_name: AILET - All India Law Entrance Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
NLU Delhi has opened the AILET 2025 application form on August 1, 2024. Candidates can fill out the AILET 2025 application form online from the official website - nationallawuniversitydelhi.in. The deadline for AILET 2025 registration is November 18, 2024. The university had earlier announced the AILET 2025 exam date on its official website.  AILET 2025 is scheduled to be conducted on December 8, 2024. NLU Delhi has also started offering BCom LLB programme from this academic year. The total seat intake of NLU Delhi B.Com LLB is 60 seats and the admissions will be done through AILET 2025 exam.

The university will conduct AILET 2025 in offline mode at designated exam centres across the country. Through the AILET 2025 exam, candidates will be admitted into the 5-year BA LLB and B.Com LLB programme of the university. The exam is held once a year. Shortlisted candidates will be invited to participate in the AILET 2025 counselling and admission process to obtain seat allotment. The counselling will be conducted in multiple rounds after publishing the AILET 2025 merit list for each round containing details of the candidates invited for the counselling process. The AILET 2025 cut-off will be available in the merit list published for each round of counselling. The university offers 110 seats for admission into its BA LLB programme and 50 seats in BCom LLB programme through AILET 2025 .

What is AILET Exam?

All India Law Entrance Test, popularly known as AILET is a national-level law entrance exam conducted by NLU, Delhi for admission into its 5-year integrated BA LLB, LLM and PhD programmes. Candidates may note here that NLU Delhi is the only national law university along with NLU Meghalaya that is not part of CLAT 2025. All the remaining 24 NLUs accept CLAT scores for admission into their 5-year LLB programmes.

AILET 2025 Exam Details 

The university had revised the AILET exam pattern last year to make the exam more student-friendly. The time duration of AILET BA LLB 2025 will be 120 minutes. The AILET 2025 syllabus consists of three sections - English, current affairs and general knowledge, and logical reasoning. Changes have also been made to the AILET PG exam. In AILET LLM 2025, the descriptive section has been removed. Candidates can check the overview of the syllabus below.

AILET BA LLB Syllabus 2025

SectionSubjectTotal questions and marks
Section AEnglish Language50
Section BCurrent affairs and general knowledge 30
Section CLogical reasoning (Including legal reasoning)70

AILET LLM syllabus 2025 

SectionSubjects, questions, marks
Objective section100 MCQs on different areas of law

AILET 2025 courses and seat intake

NLU Delhi offers 120 seats in the BA LLB (Hons.) programme and 60 seats for BCom LLB (Hons). Out of this, 110 seats in BA LLB and 50 seats in B.Com LLB will be filled through AILET 2025. For the LLM programme, the university offers 80 seats, out of which 70 seats will be offered through the AILET 2025. Candidates can check the details of seat matrix below.

AILET 2025 seat matrix

AILET Exam 2025 - Events

ParticularsDetails
 AILET application formNLU Delhi has opened the AILET 2025 application form in online mode on August 1, 2024. Candidates must register on the official website nationallawuniversitydelhi.in to appear for the exam. The AILET 2025 registration last date is November 18, 2024.
Release of hall ticketThe AILET 2025 admit card will be issued on November 28, 2024. Candidates must download the admit card and take a printout of the admit card to be carried to the exam hall on the exam day. The admit card is a mandatory document for appearing in the examination.   
AILET exam dateNLU Delhi will conduct AILET 2025 on December 8, 2024. The AILET 2025 exam was notified by the university on its official website.
Release of AILET answer keyThe AILET 2025 answer key is released a day after the AILET exam. The AILET answer key helps the candidates calculate their approximate marks. The answer key is provisional and candidates will be given an opportunity to raise objections. The final answer key of AILET 2025 will published after considering all the valid objections.
AILET result announcement The result of AILET 2025 will be announced tentatively ten days after the exam. The AILET 2025 result mentions marks obtained by the candidate, rank and roll number. The AILET result 2025 will be declared as per the final answer key.

AILET 2024 Question Paper Analysis

As per students and experts, the AILET exam 2024, was moderate to difficult. The AILET 2024 exam analysis suggests the question paper was lenghthy. As per the new exam pattern, the exam time has been extended till 120 mintues, but it was still considered too long for the given time.

NLU Delhi Ranking & Placement

NLU Delhi has been ranked 2nd in the NIRF law rankings 2023. While most of the NLUs accept CLAT, NLU Delhi has continued with its separate entrance exam, AILET. Given the reputation of the university, it gets a good number of applicants pool every year. The university has consistently performed well across all ranking parameters. 

The student choice for a college is governed by various factors including the student-faculty ratio, ranking and placements. In the case of NLU Delhi, the university has consistently ranked in the top three in the NIRF rankings for the last three years. The NLU Delhi's average placement package for BA LLB graduates has been 18 LPA in the last three years. LLM pass-out students have been able to grab an average package of 8 LPA in the same period.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Aspiring candidates looking to appear for NLU Delhi’s AILET 2025 must meet the eligibility norms as prescribed by the university. The AILET eligibility criteria 2025 pertains to educational qualification, minimum passing marks and age limit. Candidates who do not meet the eligibility criteria of AILET 2025 will not be considered for admission to law programmes at NLU Delhi even if they are shortlisted after the exam. Therefore, checking eligibility criteria before appearing for the test is very crucial.

AILET 2025 Eligibility Criteria

National Law University, Delhi offers 5-year integrated BA LLB and LLM through AILET and AILET (PG) exams. Each of these courses have different eligibility criteria. The eligibility criteria also differs for candidates from different categories. 

Candidates who have passed Class 12 are eligible for admissions in BA LLB. The minimum passing marks is 45% for general and OBC categories and 40% for candidates from SC/ST categories. Candidates appearing for class 12 exams in April/May 2025 are also eligible to apply provided they submit their qualifying certificate at the time of admissions.

Candidates who have completed 5-year LLB or a 3-year LLB are eligible for admissions in LLM. The minimum passing marks is 50% for general and OBC categories and 45% for candidates from SC/ST categories. Candidates who are appearing for their final year LLB exams are also eligible to apply provided they obtain the LLB degree with the required marks by the time of admission.

application_process.html_content:
NLU Delhi has opened the AILET 2025 application form on August 1, 2024. Interested candidates would be able to register online by visiting the official website- nationallawuniversitydelhi.in. The deadline to submit the AILET application form 2025 is November 18, 2024. 

To complete the application process of AILET 2025 candidates would be required to pay the registration fee of Rs. 3500 for the general category and Rs. 1500 for SC/ST candidates. The BPL candidates belonging to SC and ST categories would be exempted from the application fees for AILET 2025.

After closing the application window, NLU Delhi will also open AILET 2025 application correction window. Successfully registered candidates will be able to make changes in the AILET application form through their login. 

How to fill AILET 2025 application form?

The application form for AILET 2025 could be submitted by following the steps given below -

Step 1: Online registration - Candidates need to visit the official website of NLU Delhi - nludelhi.ac.in. Then, click on 'Register to Apply Now' where they need to create a signup or login account by providing details such as name, email id, create password, date of birth, mobile number and contact address.

Step 2: Select the law course - As the AILET 2025 exam is conducted for undergraduate as well as postgraduate courses in law, candidates should first select the course in the application form - BA LLB, LLM or PhD After the selection of the course candidates should click on 'Apply Now" to move in the next step.

Step 3: Fill out the application form - Candidates after successfully creating the AILET 2025 login account should fill the particulars given below:

preparation_tips.html_content:
With around 17000 candidates appearing for AILET exam last year for 110 seats on offer, it is obvious the competition is tough. Candidates need a carefully thought out AILET 2025 preparation strategy to come on top. 

AILET 2025 preparation should be comprehensive, covering various aspects of the examination. The candidates should start their AILET preparation by first understanding the syllabus and pattern. Knowing what the exam entails is the first step to success. By the time of examination, candidates should have completed the syllabus and solved a good number of mock tests and previous year papers. 

NLU, Delhi is second ranked top law college in India as per NIRF rankings 2023. The AILET exam is conducted only once a year. And with limited seats available, it requires serious preparation to beat the competition and bag a seat in the prestigious institution. So, how to prepare for the AILET 2025 exam? Read below to find out.

AILET 2025 Exam Pattern: 

Knowing what to prepare is important before starting one’s preparation and for that understanding the syllabus is must. The AILET preparation 2025 should start with studying the pattern of the exam.

For the BA LLB Hons. programme, the AILET syllabus 2025 will consist of three sections given in the table below. As per the revised pattern, candidates will get 120 minutes to attempt the exam.

AILET BA LLB 2025 Pattern

SectionsNo. of Questions (Marks)

English Language

50 (50)

Current Affairs & General Knowledge

30 (30)

Logical Reasoning

70 (70)

The exam will be for 150 marks with one mark for each question. For every wrong answer there will be a negative marking of 0.25.  

For the LLM programme, the revised AILET syllabus 2025 will consist of an objective section with 100 MCQ covering different areas of law. The descriptive section has been removed in the revised AILET LLM pattern. The duration of the exam has been increased to 120 minutes.It would be a paper for 150 marks with 0.25 marks being deducted for every wrong answer.

ParticularsDetails
AILET LLM Pattern100 MCQs on different areas of law


AILET 2025 Subject Wise Tips

As mentioned in the exam pattern, the subjects in the AILET 2025 exam would cover English, GK, and logical reasoning. Just like CLAT, AILET is also a reading intensive and lenghty paper. Here are a few subject-specific tips for each one.

AILET English Language

Candidates need to improve their capacity for reading and understanding extensive texts. Candidates must also work on brushing up their grammar fundamentals. By doing that, they may increase their reading speed and keep up with current events by reading newspapers and journals. Aspirants should also refer to good books on the AILET English section. 

Current Affairs & General Knowledge for AILET 2025

Aspirants must stay up to date with the latest happenings and news. Read magazines that help  in preparing for competition exams as they contain short summaries of current affairs and practise test papers. Candidates must also read newspapers on a daily newspaper such as The Hindu or Times of India, which will not only keep them abreast of the latest development but also improve their reading and comprehension skills.

AILET Logical Reasoning

One can improve reasoning skills by indulging in real life activities such as solving puzzles and playing mind games like chess. Similarly there are some good books on AILET logical reasoning to build proficiency in the subject. The logical reasoning section may also have questions that test candidate's reasoning ability in legal propositions. Therefore candidates must improve subject knowledge by referring to good law books as well.

Recommended Books for AILET 2025

SectionBook Name

English

Objective General English by RS Aggarwal and Barron’s pocket guide to Vocabulary. 


Current Affairs & General Knowledge

Newspapers & Law Magazines

Logical Reasoning



Analytical Reasoning by MK Pandey 

A Modern Approach to Logical Reasoning by RS Aggarwal

Legal Awareness and Legal Reasoning by AP Bhardwaj

AILET 2025 Preparation Using Sample Papers

Practising with sample papers is the best strategy that will give good returns on exam day. AILET previous year question papers are also available which a candidate can make use of. 

General AILET Preparation Tips

Here are a few AILET preparation tips 2025 that are not subject-specific but general in nature.

  • Create a weekly study plan. Decide how much time to be allocated to preparing different sections in the week. In AILET time management is very important so start with planning out everything in advance.

  • The study plan must include going through AILET sample papers, AILET previous question papers and taking AILET mock tests to increase speed. It will help in identifying the weak spots and strengths. Build upon those strengths while systematically working on improving the weaknesses

  • Refer to some of the best books for AILET exam preparation as they will improve subject knowledge and will give you insights on easily solving questions.

  • Revision is important to improve retention and comprehension. Keep adequate time for revising the syllabus and prepare accordingly.

  • Take care of health and emotional well-being. Allocate enough time to sleep, relaxation and leisure activities or else it will have a negative impact on you.

admit_card.html_content:
NLU Delhi will issue the AILET 2025 admit card in online mode on November 2. The AILET admit card 2025 will be available for download from the official website - nationallawuniversitydelhi.in. Candidates who have successfully registered for AILET 2025 can download their admit card of AILET 2025 from the official portal by logging in to their AILET account.

The AILET admit card is a mandatory document for appearing in the examination. The AILET admit card will mention details like the candidate's roll number, application number, exam centre, exam reporting time, and instructions. Candidates should download and take a printout copy of the AILET admit card and bring it to the designated AILET exam centre on the exam day. NLU Delhi does not send any physical copies of the AILET admit card to candidates. It is available only in online mode. 

How to download AILET admit card 2025?

Candidates can download the admit card of AILET 2025 by following the steps given below:

  • Visit the official admission portal of NLU Delhi - nationallawuniversitydelhi.in
  • Login using registration ID and password
  • Click on admit card link given there
  • The AILET admit card 2025 will be displayed on the screen
  • Review the details to ensure accuracy
  • Download and save the admit card and take a print-out of it for future reference

AILET 2025 Exam General Guidelines

  • Candidates must reach the exam centre at least one hour before the commencement of the exam.

  • Candidates will not be permitted inside the exam hall after 15 minutes from the start of the test.

  • Candidates cannot carry electronic gadgets such as mobile phones, digital watches, calculators, earphones to the exam hall that. However, analog watches are allowed inside the hall.

  • Candidates can carry only a few items namely, AILET 2025 admit Card, identification proof, transparent water bottle, blue/black ballpoint pen, face mask and sanitizer

How to Correct Discrepancies in AILET 2025 Admit Card ?

When previewing the AILET 2025 admit card if candidates find any discrepancies they must contact the AILET 2025 helpdesk. The details are given below:

AILET 2025 Helpdesk

cutoffs.html_content:
The university will publish the AILET 2025 cut-off on its official website. The AILET 2025 cut off will be published for each round of AILET 2025 counselling. The cut off for AILET 2025 can be obtained from the AILET merit list which displays the ranks of the selected candidates after every round of counselling. The AILET cut off is expressed as the rank of the last candidate selected from a particular category in a particular round.

Candidates who do not meet the AILET cut off 2025 in a particular round will be wait-listed and be eligible for selection in the subsequent round. However, if the candidate misses the final round cut off rank, he/she will effectively be out of the admission process.  Those who clear AILET cut-off and obtain seat allotment will have to accept the seat and complete the admission formalities by paying the course fee. Candidates who fail to pay the admission fee or fail to complete the admission formalities will forfeit their seat.

Why is AILET cut off important?

Knowing the expected cut off of AILET or the trends of the previous years is very important. With previous years' cut off of AILET, candidates may get an idea of the competition. It tells the candidates about the rank that they need to secure in the examination in order to ensure a seat. For reference, the AILET cut off for previous years' is given below.

Factors Determining AILET 2025 Cut Off

Some of the factors which would influence the cut off for AILET 2025 are given below.

  • Number of applicants
  • Difficulty level of the exam
  • Reservation Policy

counselling_process.html_content:
NLU Delhi will conduct the AILET 2025 counselling after publication of the AILET result. Candidates would be required to first register for counselling process by paying the required AILET 2025 counselling registration fee. After closure of the counselling registration window, NLU Delhi will publish the merit list and conduct seat allotment in multiple rounds. The shortlisted candidates in the AILET 2025 merit list are required to pay the admission fee and complete other formalities to finalise their admission. 

AILET counselling 2025 - Steps

Step 1: Check AILET invite list 2025 - The university first releases the list of shortlisted candidates for AILET 2025 counselling after declaring the result. Candidates three times more than the available seats will be invited for AILET counselling 2025. Only those candidates who will receive the invitation will be eligible to appear in the counselling.

Step 2: AILET 2025 counselling registration - Invited candidates must login to their AILET account to complete counselling registration online. Such candidates also have to pay the counselling registration fee and print the acknowledgement slip for future reference.

Step 3: Provisional admission list for AILET 2025 - Once the registration window is closed, the university will release the course-wise first provisional AILET 2025 merit list for each round of counselling. The merit list is provisional and such candidates are required to complete the admission formalities to finalise their admission.

Step 4: Admission fee payment - The candidates who are shortlisted will have to pay the counselling fees and the pay the remaining admission fees within the deadline.

AILET counselling fees 2025

exam_name: NLSAT - National Law School Admissions Test
conducting_body: National Law School of India University Bengaluru

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
National Law School of India University Bengaluru (NLSIU Bengaluru) has declared the NLSAT 2024 result on May 3, 2024. The university had conducted NLSAT 2024  on March 17, 2024. Earlier, the NLSAT application form 2024 was clsoed on February 28, 2024. The academic year for NLSIU Bangalore 3-year LLB will commence from July 1, 2024.

NLSIU Bengaluru conducts the National Law School Admissions Test (NLSAT) for admissions into its three-year LLB course. Candidates who fulfil the eligibility criteria can submit the NLSAT 2024 application form in online mode. The application registration can be done from the official website - admissions.nls.ac.in. NLSAT exam 2024 is a national level offline law entrance test which will be held at exam centres across India. Any candidate aspiring to enrol for 3-year LLB at NLSIU Bengaluru is required to necessarily appear for the NLSAT-LLB. NLSIU Bengaluru is the top law school as per the NIRF law rankings 2023 and is one among the few NLUs which offer three-year LLB courses. It is offering the LLB course from 2022 onwards. 

National Law School Admissions Test 2024 - Exam Details

NLSAT 3-year LLB is an offline examination held across India. The NLSAT 2024 syllabus consists of two parts within the same question paper - Part A and Part B. Candidates are required to attempt both parts of the NLSAT exam in order to be considered for admission. While Part A is an objective type section, Part B consists of descriptive questions. Candidates will be allowed a time of 150 minutes to attempt the NLSAT exam. 

Part A will have questions from reading comprehension, current affairs and critical reasoning. On the other hand Part B will have descriptive questions on legal aptitude/reasoning and analytical ability. Candidates must separately qualify in both the parts and also have a good score in aggregate to make it to the top of the merit list.

Part B will be evaluated only for those candidates who qualify in Part A. Only those candidates who are successful in both the parts will be eligible for admission. Evaluation will be done in the ratio of 1:5 i.e. five eligible candidates for every available seat. Candidates from general and EWS categories are required to obtain a score of 75 percentile in both Part A and Part B in order qualify in the individual sections, while SC, ST, and OBC candidates must have a score of 50 percentile.

Other than 3-year LLB, NLSIU Bengaluru also offers BA LLB (Hons) and LLM programmes. The admission to these two programmes is done on the basis of CLAT UG and CLAT PG respectively. The Consortium of National Law Universities conducted the CLAT 2024 on December 3, 2023.

application_process.html_content:
NLSIU Bengaluru has closed the NLSAT application form 2024 in online mode on February 28, 2024. Candidates are required to visit the website and complete the application process. The NLSAT-LLB 2024 application process involves steps such as online registration, filling the application form, uploading documents and fee payment.

Steps to Fill NLSAT 2024 Application Form

  • Visit the official website of NLSIU Bengaluru - nls.ac.in.

  • Click on the LLB admission tab

  • Click on the application form link

  • Register by filling out basic details such as mobile number and email id.

  • Fill out the application form by entering personal information, educational qualification and communication details

  • Upload required documents and signature

  • Review all the details

  • Submit the application form and pay the application fee

NLSAT 2024 Application Fee

Candidates have to pay the stipulated application fee for NLSAT-LLB 2024 in order to complete the registration. General category candidates will be required to pay Rs 2500 as NLSAT application fee at the time of registration. SC/ST/OBC-NCL/PwD categories will be required to pay Rs 2000 as application fee.

NLSIU Bengaluru Reservation and Seat Matrix

There are a total of 120 seats available for the 3-year LLB course at NLSIU Bengaluru. The seats are allocated to candidates from different categories as per the reservation policy followed by the institute.  The table given below describes the reservation policy of NLSIU Bengaluru.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Candidates can follow the preparation tips given below in order to ace the NLSAT 2024 exam.

  • Study the NLSAT 2024 syllabus and exam pattern well to  prepare a study plan and preparation strategy.

  • Solve as many mock tests and sample papers you can get to build comfort with the paper pattern and improve speed

  • Read law magazines and legal articles to improve legal reasoning and also writing structured arguments in the essay paper

  • Practise writing skills and develop good handwriting. This will help candidates attempt the descriptive section quickly and in a better way.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Any candidate aspiring to appear for NLSAT-LLB 2024 should necessarily go through the exam pattern. The NLSAT 2024 exam pattern informs aspirants about the type of questions, marking scheme, qualifying marks and negative marking if any. This will help candidates in chalking out a preparation strategy. Given below is the exam pattern of NLSAT 2024.

NLSAT 2024 Exam Pattern

ParticularsDetails

Mode of exam

Offline

Medium

English

Level of exam

National level

Type of questions

MCQs (Part A), Descriptive (Part B)

Duration

150 minutes

Marking Scheme

75 marks - Part A

75 marks - Part B (Legal Aptitude- 60 marks, Analytical Ability - 15 marks)

Negative marking

0.25 marks for every incorrect and unanswered question in the objective section.


NLSAT 2024 Syllabus

The syllabus of NLSAT 2024 consists of the objective Part A and the descriptive Part B. Part A will consist of multiple choice questions concerning reading comprehension, current affairs, and critical reasoning. This section would be for a total of 75 marks. 

Part B is the descriptive section that will consist of two sub sections namely legal aptitude for 60 marks and analytical ability for 15 marks. 

The legal aptitude section consists of problem based questions where candidates will be required to write short answers of around 300-350 words. There will be 6 questions of 10 marks each in this section. The analytical ability section will require the candidates to write an essay in about 500 words that will test the student’s ability to form logical arguments and write a well structured essay.

exam_name: ILI CAT - Indian Law Institute Common Admission Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Indian Law Institute, Delhi has released the ILI CAT 2024 application form in online mode through its official website. Interested applicants can submit the ILI CAT application form 2024 till April 22, 2024. The ILI CAT 2024 exam will be conducted on May 5, 2024. The Indian Law Institute (ILI), Delhi offers one-year LLM, PhD in Law and certificate-based programmes. The institute conducts ILI CAT for LLM and PhD programmes. However, candidates who have cleared UGC NET Law are exempted from appearing in the ILI CAT PhD entrance exam.
