highlights.value: Indian Law Institute Common Admission Test

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates seeking admission to the one-year postgraduate law programme must meet the eligibility criteria of ILI CAT 2024. Such candidates who don't meet the prescribed eligibility criteria may be disqualified at any stage of the admission process:  

ILI CAT eligibility criteria 2024:

  • The candidate must have passed an L.L.B. Degree (with not less than 50% marks) from a recognized University/Institution under the Bar Council of India
  • Candidate who have passed a law degree from a foreign university with at least 50% in aggregate or equivalent to Association of Indian University (AIU) Guidelines. 
  • Candidates appearing in their qualifying examination can also apply. However, if the candidate's result of the qualifying degree is not submitted till the examination date of ILI CAT 2024, then his/her admission will be considered provisional. 
  • Age limit: There is no age bar to appear in ILI CAT.

application_process.html_content:
Indian Law Institute (ILI) has released the ILI CAT 2024 application form in online mode. Candidates interested in admissions can apply for ILI CAT 2024 till April 22, 2024. Eligible candidates could fill and submit the application form in online mode. 

When filling ILI CAT 2024 application form one must use correct and verifiable information only, as sharing false information could lead to disqualification. 

In order to fill ILI CAT application form 2024, the candidates need to register at the admission portal of the institute and fill in all details such as personal information, and educational qualification details. communication details etc.

Candidates also need to upload documents and pay the application fee, which is Rs 2,500. It is also suggested that the candidates should take the preview and printout of the application form while submitting the application form.

preparation_tips.html_content: N/A

admit_card.html_content:
Law aspirants who have successfully submitted their application form will be issued ILI CAT 2024 admit cards few days before the date of exam. Candidates can download the admit card in online mode through their registered accounts. 

The admit card carries important information like the roll number of the candidate, the name and address of the exam venue and also the date and time of the exam.

The admit card of ILI CAT 2024 is a mandatory document for appearing in the admission test of the institute. Along with the admit card, candidates have to carry a valid Id card at their exam centre.

counselling_process.html_content:
After the declaration of the result, the Indian Law Institute conducted ILI CAT 2024 viva voce and counselling procedures after the declaration of results. Viva voce is part of the selection process. Candidates who have cleared the entrance examination are required to appear in the interview or viva voce. It will carry a weightage of 20 marks.

The objective of conducting ILI CAT counselling will be to verify the details and documents submitted by the candidates. Thus, candidates will have to carry their original documents at the counselling centre. 

The counselling process will be open to candidates who have qualified in the exam. Further, the counselling will be conducted as per the merit rank of the candidate, with higher-ranked candidates to be given preference in the seat allotment process. Once the seat is allotted, candidates will have to accept the seat by submitting the course fee and completing the admission formalities.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The ILI CAT LLM 2024 is an offline, pen and paper-based test. The all India admission test consists of 140 objective type questions. The ILI CAT 2024 focuses on the following areas of law;

  • Testing aptitude for research, 
  • Legal reasoning and comprehension 
  • Basic knowledge of different branches of law

The entrance exam will however not be the sole parameter of the selection process. A subjective paper to test the legal writing skills of the candidates will also be conducted. It will be of 40 marks. 

Finally, there will be a viva-voce round for candidates who have passed the examination. Taking all three components together, a final merit list will be prepared and uploaded to the website.

Total marks 200

  2. Subjective type questions

The official website for VLAT 2024 registration is vmls.edu.in/admissions. The university is offering 5-year integrated LLB and 3-year LLB programmes through VLAT scores. VLAT (VMRF Law Aptitude Test) 2024

Vinayaka Mission Law school conducts the VMRF Law Aptitude Test in multiple slots. The entrance test is designed to test the reading and comprehension skills, reasoning and critical thinking ability of the students. These skills are considered essential for the study of law. 

For 5-year LLB, the university conducts VLAT 5, whereas, VLAT 3 is conducted for admission to 3-year LLB programmes. Alternatively, candidates can also use the scores of CLAT, AILET, MH CET Law, NLSAT or LSAT India to get admission to law programmes at VMLS.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:

Five-year integrated law programme eligibility:

  • Candidates must have passed Class 12th from a recognized institute (Candidates appearing for April-May 2023 examinations can also apply.)
  • General category candidates must have secured at least 45% marks in the qualifying exam, 42% for OBC and 40% for SC/ST.

VLAT 3-year LLB eligibility

  • Candidate must have a bachelor’s degree in any stream from a recognized university. 
  • Candidates appearing in the final year of graduation are also eligible to apply
  • Candidates must have secured at least 45% aggregate marks in graduation. 42% in the case of OBC candidates and 40% for SC/ST.

application_process.html_content:
VLAT application form is currently open. Eligible candidates can submit the VLAT 2024 application in both online and offline modes. The application fee is Rs. 250 for all candidates. 

How to fill apply for VLAT 2024 application form?

  • Visit the official website of VMLS University
  • Register yourself using your email ID and contact details
  • Fill VLAT application form 2024 by entering all relevant details
  • Pay application fee
  • Submit the application fee with all the required documents

For offline submission of the VLAT application form, candidates have to take the application form from the VMRF University Office and submit it along with the required documents and fee.

exam_name: KLEE - Kerala Law Entrance Examination

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Commissioner for Entrance Examinations Kerala has started the KLEE 2024 counselling registration on September 19, 2024. Candidates can fill out their college options for KLEE 2024 counselling till September 25 for 5-year LLB and till September 26 for 5-year LLB. The KLEE 2024 seat allotment will be announced later. Earlier, CEE Kerala declared the KLEE 5-year LLB 2024 result on September 12, and the KLEE 3-year LLB results on September 10. The authorities also released a revised KLEE 2024 answer key along with the results. CEE Kerala had conducted the KLEE LLM 2024 on August 25, 2024. It had conducted the KLEE 2024 exam for 3-year LLB and 5-year LLB on August 18, 2024. The KLEE 2024 applications are now closed. The authorities had opened the KLEE 2024 application form on July 26, 2024.  

The KLEE entrance exam syllabus has four sections namely general English, general knowledge, arithmetic and mental ability, and aptitude for legal studies. There are a total of 200 multiple-choice questions spread across the four sections. Each question carries 3 marks each. The total marks in KLEE 2024 exam is 600 marks. There is also a negative marking of 1 mark for every wrong answer.

Only those candidates who secure the minimum qualifying marks in the KLEE 2024 entrance exam will be invited to participate in the centralised online counselling process. The minimum qualifying marks in KLEE 2024 for 3-year LLB and 5-year LLB is 10% for candidates from the general/OBC category and 5% for candidates from SC/ST categories. There is no minimum qualifying marks in KLEE LLM.

What is KLEE

The KLEE full form is Kerala Law Entrance Examination. The Commissioner for Entrance Examinations, Kerala conducts the KLEE entrance exam, for admission into 3-year LLB, 5-year LLB and LLM programmes of participating law colleges in Kerala. KLEE 2024 is conducted once a year in online mode at designated test centres in Kerala.

KLEE 2024 Exam Pattern

The exam pattern of KLEE 2024 follows the same structure for five-year integrated LLB and three-year LLB. The exam duration is 2 hours and candidates are required to attempt 200 MCQs. The KLEE syllabus 2024 consists of four sections on general english (60 questions), general knowledge (45 questions), arithmetic and mental ability (25 questions), and aptitude for legal studies (70 questions). KLEE LLM exam will have 200 questions on different topics of law divided into two parts Part A and Part B with 100 questions each. Each question carries 3 marks and there is a negative marking of 1 mark for every wrong answer.

How to take KLEE 2024 in a Computer-based Test Mode

CEE Kerala will release the KLEE 2024 exam guidelines on its official website for each of the three exams to familiarise candidates with how to attempt the online exam. On the exam day, candidates have to first attempt a mock test 15 minutes before the start of the actual test to make themselves familiar with the exam. After completion of the mock test, candidates would be automatically redirected to the actual KLEE exam. The KLEE entrance exam would automatically start and a timer would be visible on the top right side of the screen. The questions with options would be displayed one at a time. The navigation options are given in the table below

KLEE 2024 Exam Navigation 

ActionCommand
Loading the next questionSave and next
Loading the previous questionSave and previous
Saving a responseSelect the option and click Save and next or Save and previous
Clearing a responseClearing response button
Marking questions for reviewMark for review

KLEE Exam Day Guidelines 2024

Given below are the general instructions to be followed by the candidates on the exam day.

  • Candidates must carry the printout of the KLEE admit card and a valid if proof to the exam hall.
  • Candidates must report to the exam venue at the reporting time mentioned on the KLEE admit card.
  • Upon reporting at the exam venue, candidates would be provided with an access card which contains details about the examination hall, a seat, user name and password.
  • Candidates are not allowed to carry any electronic gadgets such as mobile phones, smartwatches and so on to the exam hall.
  • Candidates will be provided with a sheet of paper for rough work which must be returned after completion of the exam.
  • No candidate will be allowed to leave the exam hall before completion of the KLEE entrance exam.

KLEE 2024 Selection Process

Candidates will be shortlisted based on KLEE 2024 scores for the KLEE counselling process. The seat allotment will be done in multiple rounds based on preference given by candidates. At present there are 1110 seats available for three-year LLB, 3120 seats for five-year LLB, and 155 seats for LLM. 

KLEE 2024 Colleges

Five additional colleges have been added this year in KLEE 5-year LLB 2024 and 2 additional colleges have been added in KLEE 3-year LLB 2024. The number of colleges in KLEE LLM is the same.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
L.L.B 5 year

 Eligibility Criteria


CEE Thiruvananthapuram has released KLEE five-year integrated L.L.B eligibility criteria. The eligibility criteria inform candidates about academic qualification, minimum marks and age limit one has to meet to be considered for admission to KLEE five year L.L.B program. 

KLEE 2024 5-year LLB Eligibility Criteria

ParticularsDetails

Educational Qualification

Passed the HSC examination of the Board of HSC education, Kerala or any equivalent qualifying exam

Minimum Marks

45% (General), 42% (SEBC), 40% (SC/ST)

Age Limit 

No age limit

Nativity

Candidates seeking admission to the 5-year LLB program must be Indian citizens; for consideration under the reserved category, the candidate in addition needs to be of Kerala origin.

Only such candidates who are of Kerala origin will be eligible for reservation.

L.L.B 3 year

CEE Kerala releases the eligibility criteria of KLEE for the three-year LL.B program. The KLEE 2024 eligibility criteria include the terms and conditions the candidate has to fulfil in order to be considered for admission.

KLEE Eligibility Criteria for 3-year LLB program 

ParticularsDetails

Academic Qualifications


Graduation in any stream. Final year students can also apply

Minimum marks

45% (General), 42% (SEBC), 40% (SC/ST)


Age limit

As per directives of the Supreme Court of India

Nativity

Candidates seeking admission to the 3-year LLB program must be Indian citizens; for consideration under the reserved category, the candidate in addition needs to be of Kerala origin.

L.L.M

The exam conducting authority releases the KLEE eligibility criteria 2024 for the LLM program containing the list of conditions one needs to fulfil for admission. Any candidate who doesn't meet the KLEE 2024 eligibility criteria, will not be considered for admission.

KLEE 2024 Eligibility Criteria for LLM Program

ParticularsDetails

Academic Qualifications

LLB. 


Final year students can also apply

Age limit

No upper age limit

Nativity

Candidates seeking admission to the LLM program must be Indian citizens; for consideration under the reserved category, the candidate in addition needs to be of Kerala origin.

application_process.html_content:
CEE has released the KLEE 2024 application form in online mode on its official website - cee.kerala.gov.in soon. Candidates can make the corrections in the KLEE application form 2024 for 3-year LLB and 5-year LLB till September 4, 2024 through their login on the official website - cee.kerala.gov.in. The exam authorities have notified a separate KLEE 2024 application window for 3-year LLB, 5-year LLB, and LLM programme. The deadline to fill up KLEE 2024 application form was extended to August 6, 2024. The application correction window was also opened from August 9-11, 2024. The KLEE LLM 2024 application form was reopened again from August 15-17, 2024.

How to fill the KLEE 2024 application form?

Filling up the KLEE 2024 application form is a five stage process.

Step 1: Registration

  • Registration is the first stage and is a one time process

  • Visit official website - cee.kerala.gov.in and select your law programme - 3-year LLB/5-year LLB/LLM

  • Click on the new registration link

  • The registration form will open

  • Enter basic details such as name, mobile number and email id.

  • Upon successful registration, an "application number’ will be created with an applicant account.

Step 2: Fill out KLEE application form 2024

  • Once registered, proceed to fill the application form of KLEE 2024.

  • The application form will ask for personal, contact and educational qualification details which have to be duly filled.

  • Fill out the information carefully and click on the “save and finalse”.

Step 3: Fee payment

Paying the application fee is the third step in the KLEE application process. Candidates can pay the application fee through online payment or e-challan. 

Following is the fee breakup for all courses.

KLEE Application Form 2024 – Fee structure

Category
Fees


KLEE Five Year L.L.B

KLEE Three-Year LLB

LLM

General/SEBC

685

685

840

SC/ST

345

345

420

Online payment

  • Through this mode, one can pay the fee using a credit/ debit card or net banking.

E-challan

If the candidate wishes, they can also make the payment in offline mode using e-challan. 

  • To make the payment using an e-challan, first take a printout of the e-challan by clicking on the ‘print e-challan’ option.

  • With the printed challan, go to a post office in Kerala and make the payment in cash. During payment, you have to submit the e-challan with the requisite along with the fee amount in cash.

  • Don't forget to collect the counterfoil of e-challan from the post office official.

  • Once the payment is successfully done, ‘Pay Application Tab’ will turn green.

  • If the payment tab doesn't turn green even after payment, candidates must inform the post office officials.

Step 4: Uploading of photograph and signature

Candidates are required to upload their photographs and signature along with the required documents which is the fourth step in the KLEE application process. 

Documents Required

DocumentsSizeFormat

Photograph

JPEG

JPEG

Other documents

Step 5: Printout of Acknowledgement

After completing application submission and uploading the documents, candidates must take a printout of the application acknowledgement for future reference.

KLEE reservation policy for admission

 *Seats under state merit will be on the basis of state-wise merit list.

^SEBC category will include candidates belonging to Ezhava, Muslim, Other Backward Hindu, Latin Catholic and Anglo Indians, Dheevara, Viswakarma and other related communities.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Success in the KLEE 2024 exam will depend on the candidate’s level of preparation. Here are a few KLEE 2024 preparation tips that the candidate may refer to when preparing for the exam.

  • Carefully study the KLEE 2024 exam pattern well in order to understand the finer details of the KLEE question paper, syllabus, and marking scheme. This information will allow the candidate to align their performance with exam requirements. 

  • The candidate must identify the important topics and allocate time and effort accordingly.

  • Make a study timetable and diligently stick to it. 

  • Use good books that have updated learning material, are easy to follow and contain practice papers.

admit_card.html_content:
The CEE Kerala has released the KLEE 2024 admit card in online mode for 5 year LLB, 3 year LLB courses on August 12, 2024. Candidates can download the admit card on the official website - cee.kerala.gov.in through their login. Candidates are required to take a printout of the admit card of KLEE 2024 and carry it to the exam hall. The admit card is a mandatory document and it contains information such as the roll number, exam venue, date and time of the exam and reporting time.

How to download KLEE 2024 Admit Card?

  • Visit the official website - mahacet.org

  • Go to the admissions page

  • Click on the download link

  • Login using your registration id and password.

  • The admit card will be appear on the screen

  • Download and take a printout of the admit card.

Discrepancies in KLEE 2024 Admit Card

The candidate needs to check the accuracy of the details mentioned on the admit card, including the candidate's name, allotted exam centre, etc. If there is any discrepancy, one needs to get in touch with exam officials and get it rectified at the earliest.

List of Important Items To Be Carried During the Exam

Candidates appearing for KLEE 2024 should carry the following items to their exam centres.

  • Copy of KLEE admit card 

  • Valid photo ID proof

  • Ballpoint pen

counselling_process.html_content:
CEE Kerala started the KLEE 2024 counselling registration on September 19, 2024. Candidates can register online and fill out their college options till September 25 for 5-year LLB and September 26 for 3-year LLB. The seat allotment will be announced later. Only those candidates will be eligible to participate in KLEE 2024 counselling who have secured the minimum qualifying marks in the entrance exam. The qualifying marks in KLEE 5-year LLB and KLEE 3-year LLB are 10% for general and OBC candidates, and 5% for SC/ST candidates. There are no minimum qualifying marks mentioned for KLEE LLM.

KLEE 2024 counselling – Procedure

Candidates can refer to the below-mentioned procedure for counselling of KLEE 2024. 

  • Click on the counselling link. 

  • Login with your roll no, application number, and password. 

  • Select courses and college options.

  • Options have to be entered in the order of preferences.

  • Submit the preferences.

  • Take a printout of the option list selected.

  • Based on merit and preferences seat allotment will be completed by the authorities

  • As final steps, candidates will have to pay the fees at the allotted college on the stipulated date to finalise their admissions.

CEE, Kerala prescribes the KLEE five year L.L.B exam pattern that candidates will have to follow when preparing for the exam. The exam pattern of KLEE contains information on the type and number of questions asked, topics covered, marking scheme, mode and duration of the exam, etc.

asked from them

CEE, Thiruvananthapuram, releases the detailed KLEE exam pattern for the three-year LL.B program. Candidates must carefully go through the KLEE exam pattern 2024 to know about the structure of the exam, including, type of questions asked, marking scheme, mode and exam duration.

CEE, Thiruvananthapuram, prescribes the KLEE exam pattern 2024 for LLM program before the conduct of the exam. The KLEE 2024 exam pattern will contain details on the type and number of questions asked, marking scheme, mode and duration of the exam, sections covered, etc. When preparing for the exam, the candidate should incorporate these elements for better orientation and results.

exam_name: SLAT - Symbiosis Law Admission Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Symbiosis International (Deemed University) has opened the SLAT 2025 application form on August 15, 2024. Candidates can complete SLAT 2025 registration from the official website - set-test.org. The deadline to submit the SLAT 2025 application form is November 22, 2024. SIU will conduct SLAT 2025 in two phases on December 13 and December 15.  Candidates can register and appear for any one or both the phases of SLAT 2025. The candidate's best score will be considered. The SLAT 2025 result is scheduled to be declared on December 26, 2024. After conducting the exam, the shortlisted candidates have to appear for a Personal Interaction session of the desired SLS as part of the SLAT selection process. The WAT has been removed from the selection process. The SLAT 2025 counselling will be done by each participating SLS separately. The university will admit students into BA LLB and BBA LLB programmes of the four Symbiosis Law Schools (SLS). The four SLS campuses are SLS Pune, SLS Noida, SLS Hyderabad, and SLS Nagpur.

What is SLAT 2025?

The SLAT full form is Symbiosis Law Admission Test. SLAT 2025 is conducted by the Symbiosis International (Deemed ) University for admissions into the integrated law programmes of the four Symbiosis Law Schools at Pune, Noida, Nagpur and Hyderabad.  SLAT 2025 will be conducted in online mode at 77 exam centres across the country.  Through the Symbiosis law entrance test the law schools offer BA LLB and BBA LLB programmes with a total seat intake of 1080 seats.

SLAT Admission Process 2025

The SLAT admission process consists of two steps namely the exam and Personal Interview.

  •  Candidates have to apply online before the final SLAT 2025 registration date form the official website - set-test.org
  • Next, appear for SLAT 2025. Candiates can appear for one or both the phases of SLAT 2025.
  • If a candidate appears for both the phases, the best score among the two attempt will be considered.
  • Shortlisted candidates from SLAT 2025 would be asked to participate Personal Interaction round.
  • Consolidated scorecard on the basis of performance in the test and PI will prepared. The SLAT 2025 score will be converted to a scaled score out of 70 marks. The PI will be for 30 marks.
  • Publication of merit list of selected candidates
  • Payment of fees and document verification to finalise admission

SLAT Selection Process 2025

The final selection in SLAT 2025 will be made on the basis of composite score obtained in the two components of the SLAT selection process. Shortlisted candidates after the exam would be invited to participate in the PI round which would be conducted in online mode. Candidates who fail to attend the  PI round would not be considered for admission. 

SLAT Selection Process: Weight Distribution

ParticularsWeight in the SLAT admission processMax Marks (Scaled scores)
SLAT 202570%70
PI30%30

SLAT 2025 Exam Instructions

The university  will issue SLAT 2025 exam instructions and guidelines on its official website. The exam instructions will be available on the SLAT 2025 admit card as well.

  • Only a colour printout of the SLAT 2025 admit card is valid for the exam.
  • Candidates must arrive at the exam centre at the prescribed time mentioned on the admit card.
  • A colour photograph not more than four months old should be pasted on the SLAT admit card.
  • Candidates must also carry a valid ID proof on the day of the exam. The valid id. proof includes documents such as voter id, Aadhar card, passport, driving licence and so on.
  • Cell phones, camera,smartwatches and other electronic gadgets are not allowed inside the exam hall.
  • Candidates found to indulge in any malpractice during the exam would be disqualified and barred from appearing for the exam in the future.
  • On the day of the exam, the SLAT 2025 admit card will be authenticated by the authorised person. Candidates must preserve the authenticated admit card till the end of the admission process.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Before applying for the Symbiosis Law Admission Test, candidates must ensure that they fulfil the SLAT eligibility criteria as prescribed by Symbiosis International (Deemed University). If candidates are found to be not conforming to the eligibility criteria prescribed by the university, then they will not be able to be admission into the law courses, even if they have cleared the exam.

The eligibility criteria pertain to stipulations regarding minimum educational qualification, passing marks and age limit. Given below are the details of the eligibility criteria.

SLAT 2025 Eligibility Criteria

ParticularsDetails

Educational Qualification

10+2 pass or equivalent

Passing Marks

45% for general and OBC category. 40% for SC/ST category.

Age Limit

No age limit

application_process.html_content:
Symbiosis International (Deemed University) has opened the SLAT 2025 application form on August 15, 2024. Candidates can register online from the official website - set-test.org till November 22, 2024. The SLAT 2025 registration fee is Rs. 2250.  Additionally, candidates have to pay a programme fee of Rs 1000 per programme which they wish to apply for.

How to apply for SLAT 2025?

  • Visit the official website of SET - set-test.org.

  • Click on the SLAT registration link.

  • Enter email id and phone number to register and obtain login credentials.

  • Fill out the SLAT registration form personal information, educational qualification, communication details and other relevant information.

  • Choose the test slot.

  • Choose the exam centre- candidates can give three exam centre preferences.

  • Complete fee payment. SLAT registration fee can be paid online or through DD.

SLAT 2025 Registration Fee

ParticularsAmountSecretariat AddressSeparate Registration Fee

SLAT registration fee

Rs. 2,250 per test (for all categories)

Symbiosis Test SecretariatSymbiosis International (Deemed University)

Gram: Lavale, Tal: Mulshi, Dist.: Pune – 412115


Phone: 020-61936226/27

Candidates are also required to pay the prescribed registration fee for each of the programmes they wish to enrol into at each of the law schools.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Preparation for SLAT requires preparing on three fronts - the SLAT exam and PI. Candidates must focus on all the aspects of the selection process to finally gain admission into one of the Symbiosis Law Schools.

Important Tips

  • Study the syllabus and exam pattern properly to understand what the exam expects the candidates to do.

  • Create a section-wise study plan and a daily study time table. All the sections carry equal weights in the exam.

  • Practise with good study material. There are study materials specially designed for SLAT preparation which are updated as per the latest syllabus and exam pattern. Search for good books for each of the sections in the SLAT exam.

  • Practise with SLAT mock tests and sample papers to build speed and also assess the level of preparation and pinpoint any weak areas that need improvement.

  • Allocate time efficiently both during the preparation and solving mock papers and also on the exam. Time management is key to succeed in competitive exams to maximise attempts and score high marks.

admit_card.html_content:
Symbiosis International (Deemed University) will issue the SLAT 2025 admit card on December 3, 2024. Candidates will be able to download the admit card from the official website through their login. The SLAT admit card is a mandatory document to be carried to the exam hall. 

How to download the SLAT admit card 2025?

  • Visit the official website - set-test.org.

  • Click on the “Download admit card for Test 01/ 02” link.

  • A login window will appear on the screen.

  • Enter your SLAT exam id and password.

  • The admit card will be displayed on the screen.

  • Review all the details mentioned on the admit card.

  • Download and take a print of the admit card for future use.

Important details mentioned on SLAT admit card 2025

  • Name 

  • Category 

  • Roll number

  • Date of birth

  • SLAT Application number

  • Exam centre name and address

  • Exam date and timings

  • Reporting time

  • Exam day instructions

counselling_process.html_content:
The counselling process will be held separately for the four SLS that are part of the Symbiosis group as per their respective schedules. It must be noted that during the application process, candidates are required to separately apply for programmes at different SLS. The counselling schedule will be published on the official websites of each of the participating SLS.

The selection process at Symbiosis Law Schools consists of the SLAT exam and PI. While the SLAT exam carries 70% weight, PI carries 30% weight respectively. The SLAT WAT has been removed from the selection process.

Merit List

Symbiosis International (Deemed University) will publish the SLAT 2025 merit list for each round of the admission process. The SLAT merit list will contain names of the selected candidates who have successfully cleared the exam, and PI stages. 

Each SLS would publish its own merit list for different programmes.This list is only provisional as candidates would be required to complete the admission process.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
As per the SLAT 2025 exam pattern, there are 60 questions divided across five sections. Each section carries twelve questions. Each question carries one mark. There is no negative marking for wrong answers.

SLAT 2025 Exam Pattern

Candidates must also appear for a Personal Interview (PI) after appearing for the exam. The SLAT exam carries only 70% weight in the selection procedure. PI carries 30% weight in the selection process.

faqs.question: Is there negative marking in SLAT 2025?
faqs.answer: No, there is no negative marking in SLAT 2025.

faqs.question: How many seats are there in SLAT 2025?
faqs.answer: There are 1080 seats in SLAT 2025.

faqs.question: What are the programmes offered through SLAT 2025?
faqs.answer: Through SLAT 2025, students are offered admissions into BA LLB and BBA LLB programmes.

faqs.question: Which colleges participate in SLAT 2025?
faqs.answer: There are four law schools participating in SLAT 2025 namely SLS Pune, SLS Noida, SLS Nagpur, and SLS Hyderabad.

faqs.question: Who conducts SLAT?
faqs.answer: SLAT is conducted by Symbiosis International (Deemed) University.

faqs.question: How to download SLAT admit card 2025?
faqs.answer: SLAT 2025 admit card can be downloaded from the official website - set-test.org.

faqs.question: When is SLAT 2024 conducted?
faqs.answer: SLAT 2025 will be conducted on December 13 and 15.

faqs.question: When will SLAT 2025 registration begin?
faqs.answer: SLAT 2025 registration was opened on August 15, 2024.

faqs.question: When was the last date to apply for SLAT 2025?
faqs.answer: The last date to apply for SLAT 2025 is November 22, 2024.

faqs.question: Is SLAT 2025 conducted online or offline?
faqs.answer: SLAT 2025 is conducted in online mode

faqs.question: What are the sections in SLAT 2025?
faqs.answer: The sections in SLAT 2025 include reading comprehension, gk, legal aptitude, logical reasoning, and analytical reasoning.

faqs.question: How many questions are there in SLAT 2025?
faqs.answer: There are 60 questions in SLAT 204

faqs.question: What is the marking scheme for SLAT 2025?
faqs.answer: As per the marking scheme of SLAT, each question carries one mark and there is no negative marking. SLAT 2025 is for a total of 60 marks.

faqs.question: Is SLAT easier than CLAT?
faqs.answer: SLAT is easier than CLAT. The number of candidates appearing for the exam is lesser than CLAT. Also, the SLAT syllabus is less cumbersome with no negative marking for wrong answers.

faqs.question: Is SLAT conducted twice a year?
faqs.answer: SLAT is conducted in two phases (Test 1) and (Test 2) every year.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for SLAT?
faqs.answer: Any candidate who has passed class 12 with a minimum of 45% (for general/OBC) and 40% (SC/ST) is eligible to appear for SLAT. Candidates appearing for class 12 exams are also eligible to apply.
